story:
I grew up around music since I was 8, listening to the psychedelic sounds of the 60’s  and 70’s Rock, and also doing soul and dance choreographies. 

I started playing the guitar at 16, but I never took it seriously until I was 29 years old, when I started recording my first professional album with a band named “La VIbra”. When the band broke up I started a solo project and recorded an EP of 4 songs, in 2013, finally I got to open big concerts, which led the way to promote known artists, and could start my Southamerican tour.

This tour was fully financed by the venues I played and the fans I met along the way from Costa Rica, Panama, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia, Chile, Argentina, Brazil and Venezuela. 

Now I am asking you to help finance my new album with a simple project, that consists on recording 8 new songs, describing the life experiences of a backpacker musician through Europe, documenting the process of composition and struggle of an independent artist as I travel in different places meeting new people.

I already organised a tour in 2014, but with the money I collected I could only record one song with a video of very low budget.

Of course my songs are in Spanish, because I am Panamanian, so my goal is to fund the first phase of the project which is focused on the travel to then record these songs, so I can share my experience and art with everyone that enjoys a Latin Rhythm fusion of rock songs.

As a backer you will be encouraging other musicians, promote their music abroad and also have musicians from different nationalities perform as I tour in different places. Once the songs are recorded in cooperation with Reverb Nation you will help the foundation “Keep a child alive” with every song sold. Don’t forget you will be mentioned on every update as I continue my journey. 

I already got my ticket and started playing and composing in Stuttgart, Germany so the hardest part is already covered which is to begin, you can check it all out on my Facebook page www.facebook.com/alejandrohilton2.0 So this why I am asking for your support on IndieGoGo.

story:
As many of you know, I have been playing music for over 30 years and I have just finished recording my new record 'Til The Wheels Fall Off. I am very excited about this project and it's impending release.   I am reaching out to you all at this time, to ask for your help in putting together funds to tour behind, promote, produce videos and manufacture this record. You have all been there for me for a long time and I am asking if you can help give this project the backing it deserves.  

The All-Star Austin Band who recorded 'Til The Wheels Fall Off:

Jasper Cronym (lead guitar) - Willie Nelson, Calvin Russell, Bo Diddley,The Vanguards

Matt Hubbard (keyboards, harmonica, trombone, accordion) - Willie Nelson, The Seven Walkers, Bill Kreutzmann, Calvin Russell

Will Landin (bass) - Gary P. Nunn, Guy Forsythe, Jimmy LaFave

Bryan Austin (drums) - David Grissom

Can't wait for you to hear the CD and to see us live!! I hope you can be a part of making that happen!!

Thanks and Rock On!  

                                                                                                    

(More detailed overview of schedule & budget)

Get 'Til The Wheels Fall Off Rolling

A proposal for financial assistance to launch the CD ‘Til the Wheels Fall Off’

“Til the Wheels Fall Off’ is the most ambitious project ever pursued by the Bruce Smith Band. 

We are currently seeking funding in the amount of $26,000 to launch a six-month campaign to gain notoriety for the band and ensure the successful debut of the album.

Our Team

We have assembled an amazing and talented team to assist in this effort. They include:

- Stephen Easley, primary legal counsel to the Buddy Holly estate and foundation;

- John Burris, manager for Gary P. Nunn 

- Jeremy Fischetti and staff of 34 Management, oversee day-to-day operations of the campaign.

Strategic Plan

As mentioned earlier, we envision a six-month campaign which will hopefully result in the successful launch of ‘Til the Wheels Fall Off.’ Initially, the band will engage on a number of strategic live music venues throughout the State of Texas, and in the meantime utilize the internet and social media to increase media awareness for the band and create increased visibility. 

This phase of the project is expected to last approximately three months. During this period, it is our intention to produce a minimum of two highly professional and engaging music videos which will be distributed through YouTube, Facebook, and all other relevant internet vehicles.

Once funding is secured, a proposed timeline for the six-month campaign is as follows:

Week 1 – Take photographs and write new bio to be used with album artwork and digital and hard copy press kits.

Week 1 through Week 4 – Our booking agent will set up a three month schedule of live music events in Austin and other interstate markets. Meanwhile, the public relations/social media coordinator will make contact with all relevant local media outlets and distribute the new album and press kit. During this period, management believes it will have the opportunity to pursue certain licensing arrangements with the television and motion picture industry and those discussions will occur at this time. At the conclusion of Week 4, it is our goal to have produced two new music videos from the album, as well as 100 promotional albums and vinyl copies. As mentioned earlier, the Bruce Smith Band will continue to tour in strategic markets, interact with the appropriate local media, and continue an aggressive public relations and social media campaign.

Week 12 – Album release event will be scheduled in Austin at a prominent live music venue. We will use all available resources to maximize local media coverage and secure a large public turnout for the event. The release event will also be utilized to film the performance and create a new live video.

Week 12 through Week 24 – Initiate new tour dates to promote the new album. We intend to greatly expand the number of markets we are exposed to through heavy interaction with Texas Independent Radio. During this period, it is our intention to fully leverage exposure on social media. YouTube, iTunes, bandcamp, ReverbNation, CDBaby, Facebook, and all relevant social media will be utilized to produce the maximum amount of exposure for the band and album release. If successful, we believe the album will sell very well, potentially procure a licensing arrangement, and set the stage to tour nationally on the festival and/or independent music venue circuit.

The Budget

We have estimated the total cost of the six-month campaign is $26,000 The budget is itemized as follows:

 $1,000 – Consulting fee to pursue television, motion picture, and potential advertisers;

 $6,000 – Public relations professional to oversee all traditional and social media activities, as well as any television, newspaper, or magazine promotion activities;

 $1,100 - Professional Photograpghy and new Bio of the new band and album

 $500 – Development of a new website and web hosting services for the duration of the six-month campaign;

 $3,000 – Fee for a radio consultant to market the new album to numerous independent Texas radio stations. This individual will also be responsible for promotional activities in markets where live performances will occur;

 $2,000 for New Video Production new music videos at approximately $1,000 each;

 $400 – Digital music distribution expenses;

 $10,000 for Transportation Costs wich include van rental, gas and expenses

 $2,000 – Production expense for merchandise associated with the band. This includes the manufacturing of t-shirts, koozies, etc.

In closing, I would like to personally thank you for taking the time to consider this proposal. As a valued friend, it means a lot to me that you would consider making an investment in the Bruce Smith Band. As I mentioned earlier, ‘Til the Wheels Fall Off’ is my best, most adventurous musical undertaking yet and I hope you look favorably on the contents of this proposal.

Your past and continued support is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Bruce

story:
Hi!

  • My name is Julie McCloud & I am so honored you have come to learn more about me! My dream is to make a difference in people's lives through music. My life journey has been quite exciting & I have always had songs to write about. 
  • Being a single mom is the most amazing thing in the world! Music brings such joy to our lives & there is nothing better than dancing in the kitchen with my 4 and 5 year old to mommy's newly written tune!
  • Escaping an abusive relationship and coming out alive has been an amazing blessing as I realize we are only here in this world a short time and it's so important to chase your dreams! I believe I also have a responsibility as a survivor to be an advocate for women. 
Putting an album out would change my family's life. It would also allow me to do what I love.  Who could ask for more? 

What Is Needed?

  • Professional Musicians
  • A Surprise Guest 
  • Photo Shoot For Album Cover

Track Record 

  • Written with James House, Big Smo, Bud Reneau & many wonderful songwriters!
  • Is on A reality show raising funds for Rett Syndrome appearing with Clint Black Nationally on Fox October 3rd , 2015.
  • Has written over 1,000 songs & wants to share them with you!

I Want To Inspire!

My dream is to inspire others & move them through my music!

Help In Other Ways...

If you are not able to help financially, please share this link to get the word out and help my campaign! Help me reach my dream!

story:
I have been composing music since the age of twelve and it has long been my ambition to write a piano concerto.

I am convinced that my concerto will make an impact on audiences worldwide. it is colourful, tuneful, exciting and expressive. this view is shared by the other members of the team, Peter Seivewright, the acclaimed concert pianist and Ron Corp, the renowned conductor and champion of new music. we also have the commitment of the Divine Art record company to issue a CD of the concerto together with some of my music for piano solo. Peter Seivewright has recorded a number of CDs for the Divine Art record company www.divine-art.com and Ron Corp has an extensive catalogue of recordings listed on his website www.ronaldcorp.co.uk

Our aim is to put on a concert performance and to make a studio recording of the piece. the majority of the £25000 we seek to raise will pay for the orchestra. should we raise less than the full amount, we can make a live recording of the piece.

Everything is in place for this project to go ahead. Peter Seivewright is an outstanding soloist with an impressive history of concert performances and recordings which may be viewed here; www.divine-art.com/AS/seivewright.htm and Ron Corp also has a long track record of successful concerts and recordings over many years with his New London Orchestra. We simply need to finance the project.

If you are able to contribute in any way, you will be enabling a significant new work to come to the attention of the world's music lovers and with your help this piece will become a concert favourite. If you cannot contribute financially, it would greatly help our cause if you can spread the word as widely as possible.

story:
Short Summary


Founded in 2012, Studio Botan is San Francisco's only SOMA-based pole dance studio. We pride ourselves on the diversity of our clientele and the classes that we offer. As our students and instructors have grown into pole artists on a  competitive and national level, we want to upgrade our poles to meet the competition standards and training needs of our performers. 


What We Need & What You Get

In order to complete the 45mm pole fundraiser, we will need to raise $8,000 so that we can purchase six 45mm/14 ft poles, pay for installation of the poles by specialized aerial equipment installers, and pay for the cost of removing the 50mm poles currently in the studio. If we don't reach our full goal, we will cut back the scope of the project to install two 45mm poles so that our competitors can practice routines one at a time. 

Now the perks!
In exchange for your donation, we are offering a variety of prizes, including:
  • Specialty pole classes and workshops; everything from booty and boudoir, exotic dance, routine building, and private pilates classes
  • Pole dedications
  • Tickets to an exclusive Fall Harvest fundraiser party with mini pole classes, cocktails, raffle prizes and an onsite photographer - an event for both polers and non-polers alike!
  • An exclusive fundraiser tank top

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please help us by spreading the word and posting to social media using the Indiegogo share tools. We appreciate every share as well!

story:
Beyond Unbroken

     Hello all, we are Monte & Mike former members of "Escape The Fate".

We have branched off to start a new journey with our new band called "Beyond Unbroken". Now we wish for you to join us on this new journey of ours! We have always appreciated the loyalty from all of you, especially through all of the drama & BS. We will never stop creating music, it will always be a big passion of ours. But now we ask for your help so we can continue this journey.

The past couple of years we've been battling through hardships from finding new members of the band to having enough funds to record. We've been lucky enough to save up money to record an EP in the studio with Matt Good (From First To Last/D.R.U.G.S.). Unfortunately, we have hit a rough patch at the moment and we are in need of your assistance.

Right now we are in a critical financial state and it is setting us back from reaching our goals and being able to share our new music with all of you. We've been working really hard in every avenue from writing new music to trying to coordinate show dates. We are asking for your help to set everything back into motion for us. With your help we will be able to release our new EP that you all have patiently been waiting for.

Beyond Unbroken will greatly appreciate any help that we can get from all of you. With your help we will be able to get back on the road in no time, have enough merch to put on our social media sites and of course to finally release our EP! Thank you so much for all of your loyalty even through this rough patch. We promise we won't let you guys down! Now let's get this ball rollin so we can get on the road to see all of you!!!

story:
Hey everyone!  I'm A. Mason, (perhaps you know me as Andy:), and I've been a performing musician and songwriter for many years now.  I've released a few CDs over the years, but I've had a lifelong dream of releasing a vinyl record.   I started this campaign to ask for your help in making it happen, because I'm just about to release my new album, "Blues For Your Grass".  I have a collection of songs already recorded that just need a few loose ends tied up before they're ready to go. 

If you can help me achieve my goal, you can get a limited edition CD or Vinyl album, with hand printed original artwork.  There are also a bunch of other cool handmade perks available, including limited edition screen prints or prints of black and white photos I took and developed myself.  Check out the gallery for examples - I will be adding as I go, and you can make your choice after the campaign ends (Update: Photo prints for the $50 level are 11 x 14).

In short, I need to get the songs mastered, the records and CDs pressed and packaged, and then hopefully have enough for a promotional campaign.

If you just want to know what cool perks you can get in exchange for helping then skip the rest, or you can continue reading for the financial details of the campaign:


Here's the general breakdown compared to the cost of producing a record/cd, so you can get an idea why my funding goal is what it is:

My fundraising goal is $5000.  This will cover:

(recording is taken care of already, though this is often thousands of dollars!)

Mastering - up to $1000 (two different versions required for cd/vinyl)

Vinyl Printing - $1000-1500 (I'll print more depending on how much I raise)

Limited edition hand printed album covers -  approx. $500

Cd pressing $500-$600 + $200-$300 for jackets

Promotion to radio - $1000

+vinyl shipping, perk production, and things I've forgotten to itemize - más y más

As you can see, it adds up fast.  Now take a look at the cool perks, and THANKS for your help!

story:
HouseBelowProductions.com

We've always been able to make the most of what we have, but now it's time to step it up. With opportunities opening up left and right in the Music City, it's time to upgrade the gear so we can upgrade the product! Investing in House Below is investing in the artists. We're here to create fresh music and serve the artists, and you can help us do that even better! #SupportHouseBelow

House Below Productions is a home studio originally based in Longview, Washington and now operating in Nashville,Tennessee. Our philosophy is based around innovation: discovering new sounds, new styles; creating original, creative music that will wrap you up and take you home.  We’re after something new; unique, yet familiar. Your music should sound like you, and that’s what we’re after. We’re here to help you find your voice, and use it to the fullest. Be you, and show the world.

See our work at HouseBelowProductions.com

House Below Productions is owned and operated by Mitchell Maldonado. Mitchell has worked in virtually every aspect of the music industry. After studying recording in music school in Santa Fe, he continued his career touring with various bands, playing several different instruments. He’s worked in many studios from Albuquerque to Boise, Kansas City to Nashville. He also worked as a live audio engineer in the Portland, OR area. He currently resides in Nashville and works as a songwriter/producer for House Below as well as playing guitar, keys and anything else for a CCM band, The Neverclaim.

House below also offers video services. Whether you’re looking for a promotional video, commercial use or music video, House Below can take care of your needs. Check out this playlist of videos we’ve done for clients all over the country.

With opportunities opening up left and right in the Music City, it's time to upgrade the gear so we can upgrade the product! Investing in House Below is investing in the artists. We're here to create fresh music and serve the artists, and you can help us do that even better! #SupportHouseBelowHouse Below Productions is a home studio originally based in Longview, Washington and now operating in Nashville,Tennessee. story:
I'm very excited to announce that I will be releasing a Christmas rap album on December 1st! This will be my very first album, and my first time selling my music. I would really appreciate if you would make a contribution to help me make this album a success. Donations can be as much as you want to give. I'm still a college student and haven't started an official job as of yet, so I would greatly appreciate any and all donations. There are also rewards listed on the right (including this one) for those of who help contribute to my fundraiser. Side note: this is what the inside of the Christmas card looks like. The front will look much cooler!


This project is very special to me for many reasons. The main reason is because it is not all about ME. I want to provide YOU with quality Christmas music that you can listen to during the holiday season for years and years to come. Many Christmas songs have been made in the past, but very few of them are Christmas RAP songs. Also, these songs are listenable for ALL ages (kids from 1-92), since they have clean, non-explicit lyrics.

This project also has the potential to benefit OTHERS as well. A portion of the proceeds of the album will be donated to charities such as the Diabetes Partnership of Cleveland and Toys for Tots in Cincinnati. These charities both support causes that are near and dear to me. Having seen my brother (pictured below) deal with Type 1 diabetes since he was 11 made me want to donate to an organization like the Diabetes Partnership. They give support and education to thousands of children and adults with diabetes and help them learn how to effectively manage the disease and live healthy lives. 


Toys for Tots helps to donate toys to children who are not fortunate to have them at Christmas time. It breaks my heart to know that some kids cannot know the joy of opening Christmas presents as much as I did when I was younger. I chose to donate a portion of these proceeds to these causes because they are causes that I strongly believe in and they can positively impact people in my hometown and in my current city.

This is the breakdown for my album budget:


Also, shipping costs are included in the price of the rewards that need to be shipped.

story: Evah Doheny is 9 years old. She began singing, dancing and acting when she was 5. One of her biggest inspirations and favorite singers is Christina Aguilera. Evah has a vision to empower girls and others through her music and to give people a good message to live by. When Evah met Jens Gad they were talking and she quickly realized that they shared many of the same visions. They are creating an album to achieve their goals and to inspire all ages!  Please Help Evah receive her BIGGEST Christmas gift ever! Come on and be a part of Evah's project Team by contributing even if in a small way!!! Every sponsor counts! Evah is grateful for any help you can offer!

story:
Hi there! My name is Taryn Jessen--I front the Taryn Jessen Band from Utica, NY, featuring my two amazing bandmates, Colin Jewett on drums and Jason Roberts on bass.

My grandpa was the first musician I knew, and when I was 15 and first started playing guitar, it's fair to say that he was my original inspiration.  High school is a difficult time for many. For me, socializing and "fitting in" weren't exactly things that came naturally to me--this left me in a pretty raw emotional state, but music was always something I could relate to, and so I started hiding away in that. To this day, songwriting and performing provide a real way for me to express myself and that's been really helpful to me.

Taryn Jessen Band has playing together for about three years. I've been blessed to find such great musicians, Colin, and Jason, to collaborate with and bring out the best in my songs. Over the past two years, we've released two live demos, and while these recordings have been helpful to us, we've never had the opportunity to record in a commercial studio and create a truly professional product. 

We have a great batch of new songs ready to go and a fantastic producer and recording studio waiting to bring this project to life! This Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating our first professionally recorded studio album.


This campaign is raising funds for our first professionally recorded album with Mike Davidson, a Boston-based producer and engineer with 15+ years of experience working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. We are working together with Mike to comb through our original material, fine tune arrangements, and help capture and execute our vision for this album.

We've already recorded one song with Mike for you to check out for free on this campaign page, called, "What Can I Do." Check it out directly below!


This song is a great example of the album we'll be able to make if this campaign reaches its goal, with its heavy-hitting rhythm section and edgy, emotive vocals. If we reach our goal, we'll be able to get back into the studio with Mike to record the rest of our album!

While we've been able to cover the costs of recording "What Can I Do" on our own, when you're recording at this quality, costs up add quickly! Your donation will go towards the following costs:

  1. Pre-production: This is an important preliminary step standard in any commercial recording project. We will start by listening through our demos and previous recordings with Mike, discuss arrangements, examine lyrics and structure, and establish a plan for how to capture each song.

  2. Recording: Next, we will start by laying down the basic rhythm section: drums first, then bass and guitar, and lastly, vocals. Some songs will benefit from additional lead lines and backing vocals to make the recording more layered and exciting. 

  3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will be mixed to add excitement and nuance to the compositions. As a final step, the album will be mastered, so the listening experience is cohesive from start to finish.

What do you get for your generosity and support? So many awesome things!

We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, we've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign. 

Check out some examples of gifts below, and the full list to the right of this page! Lots of local artwork and awesome posters, hand-made t-shirts by yours truly, and of course, MUSIC: digital downloads and behind the scenes tracks, deluxe signed albums for your collection, and even a guest producer credit on the album!

Limited Edition Poster:


Hand-Made "Taryn Jessen Band" T-Shirt:

This success of the campaign will truly change our lives.
By creating this album, we not only have the chance to share this project with you, but to walk through a door where opportunities await--things like expanding our fan-base, radio promotion, bigger and better performances, record label interest; the list goes on. But before we can walk through this door, we need this record, which is exactly what your support will help us create. Sharing our music will always, always be a part of us but an opportunity like this would put us in the position to truly make our dreams a reality. 

If you're ready to donate, please click the pink "Contribute Now" button to right of this page. We are so grateful for your support, and any amount you can give help us make this project a reality.

Please also don't hesitate to share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested in local music and art. The more eyes and ears on this thing, the more ground we can cover together. There are social media share buttons here on this page--and please tell your friends how grateful we are for this support.

Thank you again for checking out our campaign and we can't wait to share more music with you soon!

<3 Taryn, Colin, and Jason

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi my names Jay and I am the founder of the music festival - Greenstone. Greenstone began in 2012 with a simple idea of getting together as unsigned and or upcoming artists and sharing each other’s music. We’re a tiny intimate festival set in Northamptonshire.

  •  We have been super lucky with the bands we have had play such as JAJA OK (previously known as Francobollo), MOHIT, SOPHIE JAMIESON, OH SISTER, VV BROWN, MANDLEBROT SET, MAYBUG and Many more.

    Two years later Greenstone is gradually growing and has gone on to do live nights within London and online music sessions called Canapé’s that we share twice a month and we aim to make weekly. This has all been self funded and now we need YOUR help to keep it going.

    We’re eager to build on the previous success of what we have done not just on one day but all year round consistently.

    So we’re planning for 2016. Specifically August 2016 which will be Greenstone’s 3rd birthday? 

  • Until now we have succeeded on the generosity of family, volunteers and putting our own money into this. To keep this developing the time has come to create a formal organisation to develop Greenstone.  For those of you who have played or been a spectator at Greenstone you know that it could be something great but we need your support to make it work.

The team consists of Val – Production , Matthias  - Film, Pablo – Finance and myself who books bands and keeps the Greenstone vision alive. We then have a team that we gather for the actual festival.

What is our vision?

The vision is to keep a quality of music sharing consistently and keep the festival going annually. A place for people to know that they will have a quality back to basics experience in an intimate setting and a place for people to reunite every year no matter where they may be. That’s it. That’s that.

The surroundings are beautiful, the food is great and the root of the festival is a passion for music and as long as we keep that in mind I don’t think we can go wrong. Obviously feedback is welcomed so anyway we can make your experience better our ears are vacuums.

What We Need & What You Get

The first thing you can do is come to Greenstone Festival! It is a short 60 miles north of London in the countrysides of Overstone Park  Northampton and will be on August 27th-28th 2016. The lineup and ticket announcements are upcoming on our socials as soon as we make the funds to make it happen!!

 Where Does Your monies go?

  • When you buy a ticket, your money goes to the artist's transportation and hospitality. 
  • You’re money is helping us fund cab rides, train and food for our artists. 

100% of the proceeds go to the artists or the mechanics of making this happen (rental equipment, lights, etc.). 

PLUS, the more you give, the cooler we can make this festival ;)

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Our aim is to make £5000.  That will be like £90 a day. If we keep this flow this will go towards bands travel expenses, food and equipment. 
  • We have some unique perks! We're giving away free festival tickets and T shirts.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal the funds will still go towards Greenstone!

The Impact

Your contributions will make a huge impact! It allows us to keep this magical idea alive and grow the music community network. We have always wanted people to feel apart of the Greenstone evolution and this is a chance to feel more involved in the building of it. Its the beginning and we aim to keep it going for as long as we can!

  • This project is valuable to the upcoming musician, to the established musician, to the keen music lover, to those that are just interested in meeting like minded people, to anyone who wants to get involved in music on human, personal and pure level.
  •  Greenstone started as party of 60 - 70 spectators in the first year. The second years went up to 250 and we'd like a chance to develop it to 350. There has been a beautiful growth and we're excited to keep it growing.
  • This is something that could be MAGICAL. If we can get this funded it would be amazing achievement! Hopefully see you there!
Green Love x

Risks & Challenge

As most people know, the entertainment industry is not the most accessible place of business.  Many people have tried and failed to accomplish what they set out to do in the world of Music. We are very aware of the odds and are determined to work harder than hard, and knowing that other people believe in us and are contributing to our efforts will be even more motivation for us to succeed.  There are many reasons why we think we have what it takes:

  • There is always a  strong demand for new music.
  • We not only have a love of music in performance, we already are a community of people.
  • Our goal is not to become the biggest festival in the world but one that has an attention to detail and focuses purely on music and gathering in a positive place.  We simply want to use our talents to make a difference.  Those in the life are often the movers and shapers of our society – and many demographics are often grossly misrepresented. We want to be able to represent the beautiful diversity of this country as well as make  art more accessible for everyone.
  • Most of our lives have been spent working in the arts, it is not just a hobby – this is our business and we hope to make it career.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money isn't always easy to come by: if you can't contribute monetarily we hope you will share this page with those who might be able to help. We also hope you listen to and share the music that we have on our pages and help to get the word out about our Festival and community. Our Youtube page with our Canape sessions can be heard here: https://www.youtube.com/user/greenstonefestival

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/greenstonecommunity

story:
It's been a while since we've heard any new music from Canadian singer Danny Michel, but thats about to pay off.  These turbulent times have his creative juices flowing. Known for his thoughtful lyrics, the multiple Juno nominee feels the time is now. So, as of today Danny is holed-up in his studio for the winter, writing & recording. We're only letting him out on Mondays so he can test drive new songs at his sold-out Dakota Tavern Residency.

For his 10th album (and 1st in years) Danny is coming full circle, back to where it all started. He's working in his home studio on a lifetime collection of vintage gear, even excavating his own 80's 4-track tapes to sample from. Over Snowed in with a fresh cord of wood and the stove burning, Danny will be taking his time and working his magic.

He'll also be writing, producing, cooking, engineering, chopping wood, playing, mixing, doing dishes and more. What a nut job!! The only risk here is Danny losing his mind, but that happened long ago. The funding will cover months of studio time, additional studios, additional musicians, mastering, videos, artwork, upgrades, gear, months of work, months of not performing live, Kraft Dinner & more.

In the past, Danny Michel has produced a record in Belize, produced two seasons of a TV show (while on tour) and founded a charity for children. Today we invite you to join another one of his heartfelt projects that will clearly be a success. 

"Danny Michel has reached a point where his musical vocabulary is so broad, his songwriting/arranging chops so sharp, his guitar playing so distinctive and his taste for the right sonic touch so impeccable that he can do whatever he wants and make it compelling"   *****    EYE MAGAZINE 5/5 STAR REVIEW

story:
About us

We are an independent music making group called 1sings, based in Stockholm, Sweden. We are working on studio projects with artists who we love and who we would like to support in every way possible. What we do::

  • Studio recording of albums including mixing and mastering.
  • Distribution.
  • Marketing.

What We Need & What You Get

Every penny we raise will go directly towards making music, including the studio/producer/engineer/mixer, as well as marketing and manufacturing the merchandise for campaigns. There's absolutely no way we could do this without you.

  • 20.000 USD will be used to help finance music production in 2016.

New Artists

Finding new artists and giving them the chance to make their music get noticed by new fans in 2016.

story:
Click here to download LYNX's last 2 albums FOR FREE: Click here for free album downloads

In exchange, we ask that you PLEASE donate 5 or 10 bucks HERE ON THIS PAGE (the cost of one drink/burrito) or more to this indiegogo campaign to help us make this new record!!! Thank you for all of your love and support!

About :

  • LYNX & the Servants of Song is a live band from Portland OR, dedicated to upholding the true heart of music and storytelling.  This Project is the latest brainchild of LYNX who has been performing, producing and recording professionally for the last 10 years. After touring solo for the last 5 years and performing at predominately electronic music events, LYNX is falling back in love with playing the guitar and has become inspired to focus on fine crafting the art of songwriting via leading this new live band. The band features the extraordinary talents of Cheya MacKay (Guitar), Nickles D'onofrio (Bass), Julian Fritz (Drums) and Asher Fulero (Keys). 
  • We have begun the process of recording at a gorgeous studio here in Portland called The Hallowed Halls with our wizard of an engineer, Justin Phelps (Cake, The Mars Volta, Amanda Palmer, Jolie Holland and more)
  • Your contribution will help this dream come true!!! You will be helping us to finish the production of our new album 'Northlands' and our new music videos!

 Breakdown:

Your financial support will go towards our FINAL GOAL OF 15,000 which will include:
  • Additional Recording - 1,500
  • Mixing - 3,000
  • Mastering - 1,000
  • Music Video production and editing - 5,000
  • Merchandise Production - 2,000
  • Hard Copy cds - 1,000
  • 1 month of album Promo - 1,500
Perks:
  • Your generous support will include perks such as: digital downloads, hard copy cds, t-shirts, hoodies, rare limited edition vinyl, tickets to shows and a potential house concert in your very own living room!

Our mission:

  • We believe that a good song can change the world and also help to carry people through beautiful and trying times in life like nothing else can! We believe in the folk tradition of telling the story of our time and making meaningful art. Our mission is to truly serve the song.

Risks & Challenges:

  • As we all know , it is hard to 'make it' as an independent artist in this world but that's not going to stop us from giving it everything we've got! With your help and the grassroots support of our beloved fans, we can continue to make beautiful music for years to come!

Other Ways You Can Help:

No money? No problem , here's how you can still help:

  • Post on social media about the campaign.
  • Tell your friends!

Thank you for all of your love and support , we cannot wait to share this with you!!!

LOVE

LYNX & the Servants of Song

story:
ATTENTION:
TODAY IS THE FINAL DAY TO CONTRIBUTE! Please do so :)

Mailed in Cash or Check donations can be written to Big Hoax and sent to:
Big Hoax
4326 Prices Distillery RD
Ijamsville, MD 21754

BIG HOAX is making its FIRST ALBUM!

Hey friends! In case you don't know us: Big Hoax is a band formed in Annapolis, MD as a Cello-Guitar duo. We played bars and open-mics and eventually grew to become a full-size group performing at festivals and in venues throughout the regional area.
We've earned a reputation as a strong live band, and we've had to rely solely on honing our live performances to build our following. You may have heard of us when we had our brief national spotlight in the National NPR Tiny Desk Concert Contest, in which our submission for the live video below was featured as one of the favorites by the judges amongst over 8,000 submissions nationally.

It's now time to bring the package full circle and complete the album of our dreams. We went into the studio with two goals in mind:
1) We wanted to represent our live performances and create something that the listener could feel through the recording.
2) We wanted create an album that was a true listening experience, a story the listener feels enticed to enjoy from beginning to end rather than a collection of songs and singles in random order.
We've already finished the tracking of the album, and we're ready to take it to a truly great producer to mix and master our recordings. If you don't already know, mixing is probably the most important part of creating a record. Like most things in the world, you get what you pay for when mixing and producing a record. When you have a team as headstrong and creative as this one, this part of the project can come with a nice price tag.


When we sat down with our budget in mind, we wanted to avoid crowd-funding at all cost. The idea of putting our album up for charity seemed wrong at the time. We wanted to earn the money. 
That's where we came up with the idea: 1-Hour for every $100
Why not truly earn our donations by paying it forward when the gift comes around? Being a musician is all about giving back and sharing what you create. Together, we can create an opportunity to share and give back, and make some pretty awesome music along the way.
 

What we need:

So far we've covered the cost of Mixing, Mastering, and Printing the album – which accounts for almost half the total cost. Aside from the impact you're going to help have on the local community by donating.

The Impact

 With the funds generated here, we can pair our reputation from our live performances with the backbone of truly great recorded material. We're going to drive this next year hard with extensive touring and lots of promotional media/merchandise that is dependent on this album. Not to mention the impact this campaign will have on the city of Baltimore and the citizens who could use a little warmth this winter. You're making a difference for us, and we feel its right to make a difference for someone else too. 

Risks & Challenges

Big Hoax has hit a lot of bumps in the road over the last two years. We've had little to no recorded material to appeal to a broader audience. By completing and releasing this album people will know what we do, and we'll be able to thoroughly and confidently invest in who we are as a team.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute. We (of all people) totally get that. If you can't contribute monetarily, please do us the favor of putting the word out! Call your friends and share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Myspace WHATEVER! The more noise we can make, the better the odds we have. Let's achieve this goal TOGETHER!


Love,

Big Hoax

story:
Club Vibelust® Ibiza

      Club Vibelust® aims to innovate and constantly improve the clubbing industry worldwide, by providing incredible experiences without the usual mess. Starting from a futuristic architecture on the inside and keeping the natural roughness of the Balearic island, Vibelust® is bound to be a one of a kind experience for artists and clubbers alike. A business branch of DUEBROS LTD London, Vibelust® is meant to be built following new and improved standards. The two cofounder brothers, Gabriel Stancu and Julian Stancu, are planning to use their cumulated clubbing experience of almost 30 years to set these new standards. 

Legal stuff 

      Ibiza is a magical place, where local authorities give few to no new construction permits, if the new building project modifies the environment or has a negative impact over the island. Clubbing is no exception and if the new architecture and waste system do not meet the requirements, no new construction can be erected.

      This is why we are working hard to create Vibelust® club as a self autonomous unit, with a state of the art and ecological drainage system. Yet, we do not know if the piece of land will be on the shore or inland. Our architectural plans from now are taking into consideration the shore areas.

The Architecture

    Here at Vibelust® we desire a zero impact over the environment. The entire construction will be around the environment and not in the environment. No trees will be cut, nor will there be modifications of the area, like excavating, yet, the club is meant to be a futuristic construction, also comprising an open terrace. Moreover, one of the future numerous Vibelust's features will comprise an innovative system which is going to offer a fast exit towards clubbers physiological needs in a fanciful way, based on the principle "Skip the queue like a pro".

Cultural impact

      Vibelust® plans to become a movement. We need the culture of electronic music to stay animated and interesting, as a bad clubbing experience can scare people away, people who otherwise love electronic music. This is why, maybe the greatest improvement Vibelust® brings to the world is the capability of the club to act as a movie set, or film studio. During summer season, the special movie crew from Vibelust® will film the entire action during the events and after the season ends, a feature film for worldwide cinema screenings and a film series will be released each year. We plan to bring to the cinemas a movie about the true electronic music culture each year.

Conclusions

      There is a lot of work to be done, but let us worry about that; it is our pleasure. The initial budget of £700,000 might not be totally in our favour, but at least we can buy the land, deal with the project approval and start the first phase of the construction. From there, we are pretty sure we can get more money coming in.

      From 2015 Vibelust® is a registered trademark in the European Union.

      For all this to happen sooner, Vibelust® needs everyone’s attention and contribution. 

       Our final update for you will be inside the club.

story:
We are a mixture of young artists with differing styles of music from Northern California. We are low income, struggling to get equipment, Internet access, and even basic needs, but we work hard & we are inspired to create music and live our dreams.

https://m.soundcloud.com/endever00

Kyler Cyrek is our DJ, at 20 years old, he is very professional and creative beyond his years. He is a leader and driving force behind Endever.

http://www.reverbnation.com/philparnell/song/20657513-raggatude-featuring-sean-parnell?1336410755


Phil and Sean Parnell are musical talents in guitar and BASS, recording, mixing and computer software. Sean, 22, is a vocalist with original and current lyrics with dozens of original songs and beats. Phillip, 24, has a prog-metal guitarist influenced by the many successful professional guitarist he has spent time learning from over several years. He was endorsed by Spear guitars about 4 years ago. He working on a new band project and has been recording original music at home as a solo artist.

Devon Dunkley, 22, we call him Brown Bear, he is a vocalist and creates digital music at home. All these kids need real computers and software and mics and the tools to boost their production. They have been struggling with the barest imaginable.

We live in a remote area and the young people here are desperate to buy music equipment and have reliable transportation.

Check out "Young Artists Need Music Equipment and More" on Indiegogo http://igg.me/at/rocknrollvan/shre

Two of my kids are aspiring musicians, and they have a lot of musician friends too. We have been utilizing the 1988 Chevy Camper van for the last decade. We have met famous artists, the Scorpions & Lamb of God and THEY rode around in the van with us! The young people are so inspired by successful and professional musicians and the time they have shared. We spent one summer following the Family Values Tour and the boys were with KORN when they rehearsed for the tour. They worked setting up equipment on the stage.
These days, I have replaced the motor twice, the transmission 4 times, the body is perfect, the tires & exhaust are new. I need to replace the transmission again, we live in a mountainous area. The interior and exterior are in need of repair. My desire is to have a rock n roll theme and maybe a custom design of the bands on the outside, a nice mural and advertising of all our sponsors!
We live in a mountainous community and need this vehicle to travel with a group of people safely. There are about a dozen young people who are inspired to be original artists, but the nearest city is 6 hours away.
I am offering some creative perks, please help our cause!

story:
Pourquoi une campagne de socio financement?

En 2014, une choriste du Choeur Radio VM visite le magnifique village de Saint-Venant-de-Paquette. C'est le coup de foudre! Elle contacte son chef de choeur et tente de le convaincre d'y présenter un concert. L'idée fera son chemin...

Au printemps 2015, le Choeur Radio VM et Mozart sont attendus à Montréal (23 mai) et à Saint-Venant-de-Paquette (24 mai) !

Le Chœur Radio Ville-Marie est un organisme de bienfaisance. Il doit assumer seul ses nombreuses dépenses (cachets des instrumentistes, location d’un local de répétition, achat de partitions, location d'instruments, publicité, etc.). Pour y parvenir, le Chœur Radio VM perçoit une cotisation annuelle de ses membres et fait également appel à la générosité de ses commanditaires. De plus, par souci d’autonomie, toute la gestion et la bonne marche du chœur sont assurées par un conseil d’administration bénévole, formé de cinq choristes membres, élus lors de l’Assemblée générale annuelle.

En mai 2015, nous présenterons La Messe du Couronnement et les Vêpres solennelles de Mozart, à Montréal, ainsi que dans un magnifique petit village bucolique des Cantons de l’Est, Saint-Venant-de-Paquette. Les présentations d'un concert d'une telle envergure exigent un financement important : pas moins de 12 000 $, afin entre autres, de s'assurer les services de solistes, un orchestre de 10 musiciens et de louer l'église Saint-Jude à Montréal et le Musée-église de Saint-Venant-de-Paquette.

Chaque contribution permet au Chœur Radio VM de poursuivre son rêve... et à vous, de recevoir de magnifiques RÉCOMPENSES:

  • Merci! Merci! Merci!! (5 $)

  • Album « Chants sacrés » en format MP3 (12 $) *

  • Album « Sept Paroles du Christ » en format MP3 (12 $) **

  • Album « Noël en Nouvelle-France » en format MP3 (15 $) ***

  • Album « Les Inédits » en format MP3 (15 $) ****

  • Les 4 albums en format MP3 (45 $)

  • Coulisses du Choeur Radio VM (50 $)

  • D'une paire deux coups! (100 $)

  • Pour l'œil et l'ouïe! (125 $)

  • Baguette magique : une baguette de direction signée Simon Fournier, chef du Chœur Radio VM (150 $)

  • Concert-Visite à St-Venant-de-Paquette (200,00 $)

  • Concert - B&B à St-Venant-de-Paquette (350,00 $)

  • Concert privé (1000 $)

Sans même contribuer, vous pouvez aussi nous aider en passant le mot via courriels et réseaux sociaux. Merci.

SAINT-VENANT-DE-PAQUETTE (102 habitants)

La municipalité de Saint-Venant-de-Paquette, nichée dans une petite vallée au cœur des Appalaches, lorgne vers le New Hampshire. En plus de disposer de la toute première Caisse populaire Desjardins en milieu rural en Amérique du Nord (1907), le petit village est fier de son église-musée (1877) qui a conservé son architecture et sa finition intérieure d’origine en bois vernis aux sonorités angéliques. La Maison de l’arbre et son Sentier poétique (initié par l'auteur-compositeur Richard Séguin), un circuit piétonnier de 3 km, animent les lieux et valent le détour dans ce charmant village aux panoramas époustouflants. La Voie des pionniers y fait l'un de ses arrêts pour mettre à l'honneur Hermine Malouin (1841-1941) une centenaire qui a défriché ce coin de pays. http://www.cantonsdelest.com/city/44005/saint-venant-de-paquette#sthash.KAIEQpFO.dpuf

http://amisdupatrimoine.qc.ca/

Marco Sirois, pianiste

Né le 14 mai 1984 à Edmundston au Nouveau-Brunswick, Marco Sirois entreprend, dès l’âge de 9 ans, l’étude du piano auprès de monsieur Charles Kilfoil et à l’âge de 11 ans, il est initié à l’orgue. Il poursuit ensuite des études en musique au niveau post secondaire et à 18 ans, il s’inscrit au baccalauréat en piano à la Faculté de Musique de l’Université de Montréal auprès de madame Claudette Berthiaume-Zavada. Boursier, en 2006, de la Fondation Jean-Paul-Fortin, il choisit de poursuivre ses études au niveau de la maîtrise en interprétation sous la direction de Marc Durand et la collaboration de Claudette Berthiaume-Zavada, Jean Saulnier et Jimmy Brière. Il obtient sa maîtrise à l’automne 2008.

Doté d’une grande expérience en accompagnement, ce jeune musicien travaille régulièrement avec plusieurs professionnels de l’art lyrique et d’ensembles vocaux tant au Québec qu’au Nouveau-Brunswick.

Depuis ses débuts, Marco Sirois s’est produit dans de multiples salles de concerts dans la grande région de Montréal et environs, de Trois-Rivières et d’Edmundston avec plusieurs ensembles. En 2007, il s’est produit en duo de piano (4 mains) avec Émilie Duff. Il a également participé au concert du 50e des Jeunesses Musicales du Canada à Edmundston.

conseil d’administration bénévole, formé de cinq choristes
membres, élus lors de l’Assemblée générale annuelle.

En mai 2015, nous
présenterons La Messe du Couronnement et
les Vêpres solennelles de Mozart, à Montréal, ainsi
que dans un magnifique petit village bucolique des Cantons de l’Est,
Saint-Venant-de-Paquette. Les présentations d'un concert d'une telle
envergure exigent un financement important : pas moins de 12 000 $,
afin entre autres, de s'assurer les services de solistes, un
orchestre de 10 musiciens et de louer l'église Saint-Jude à
Montréal et le Musée-église de Saint-Venant-de-Paquette.

Chaque contribution
permet au Chœur Radio VM de poursuivre son rêve... et à vous,
de recevoir de magnifiques RÉCOMPENSES:



	Merci! Merci! Merci!! (5
	$)


Album
	« Chants sacrés » en format MP3 (12 $) *


Album
	« Sept Paroles du Christ » en format MP3 (12 $) **


Album
	« Noël en Nouvelle-France » en format MP3 (15 $) ***


Album
	« Les Inédits » en format MP3 (15 $) ****


Les
	4 albums en format MP3 (45 $)


Coulisses du Choeur Radio VM (50 $)


D'une
	paire deux coups! (100 $)


Pour
	l'œil et l'ouïe! (125 $)

Baguette
	magique : une baguette de direction signée Simon Fournier, chef du
	Chœur Radio VM (150 $)
Concert-Visite à St-Venant-de-Paquette (200,00 $)


Concert
	- B&B à St-Venant-de-Paquette (350,00 $)


Concert privé (1000 $)


Sans même contribuer, vous pouvez aussi nous aider en passant le mot via courriels et réseaux sociaux. Merci.SAINT-VENANT-DE-PAQUETTE (102 habitants)La
 municipalité de Saint-Venant-de-Paquette, nichée dans une petite vallée
 au cœur des Appalaches, lorgne vers le New Hampshire. En plus de 
disposer de la toute première Caisse populaire Desjardins en milieu 
rural en Amérique du Nord (1907), le petit village est fier de son 
église-musée (1877) qui a conservé son architecture et sa finition 
intérieure d’origine en bois vernis aux sonorités angéliques. La Maison 
de l’arbre et son Sentier poétique (initié par l'auteur-compositeur Richard Séguin), un circuit piétonnier de 3 km, 
animent les lieux et valent le détour dans ce charmant village aux 
panoramas époustouflants. La Voie des pionniers y fait l'un de ses 
arrêts pour mettre à l'honneur Hermine Malouin (1841-1941) une 
centenaire qui a défriché ce coin de pays. http://www.cantonsdelest.com/city/44005/saint-venant-de-paquette#sthash.KAIEQpFO.dpufhttp://amisdupatrimoine.qc.ca/Marco Sirois, pianiste

Né le 14 mai 1984 à
Edmundston au Nouveau-Brunswick, Marco Sirois entreprend, dès l’âge
de 9 ans, l’étude du piano auprès de monsieur Charles Kilfoil et
à l’âge de 11 ans, il est initié à l’orgue. Il poursuit ensuite des
études en musique au niveau post secondaire et à 18 ans, il
s’inscrit au baccalauréat en piano à la Faculté de Musique de
l’Université de Montréal auprès de madame Claudette
Berthiaume-Zavada. Boursier, en 2006, de la Fondation
Jean-Paul-Fortin, il choisit de poursuivre ses études au niveau de
la maîtrise en interprétation sous la direction de Marc Durand et
la collaboration de Claudette Berthiaume-Zavada, Jean Saulnier et
Jimmy Brière. Il obtient sa maîtrise à l’automne 2008.
Doté d’une grande expérience en
accompagnement, ce jeune musicien travaille régulièrement avec
plusieurs professionnels de l’art lyrique et d’ensembles vocaux
tant au Québec qu’au Nouveau-Brunswick.
Depuis ses débuts,
Marco Sirois s’est produit dans de multiples salles de concerts
dans la grande région de Montréal et environs, de Trois-Rivières
et d’Edmundston avec plusieurs ensembles. En 2007, il s’est
produit en duo de piano (4 mains) avec Émilie Duff. Il a également
participé au concert du 50e des Jeunesses Musicales du
Canada à Edmundston.

story:
Short Summary

Supertrash has part of their EP recorded, but realized they don't have enough money cuz life and stuff. We would totally like to finish and release it, but it might be a while unless we can get a little financial support from some of our homies. We don't want you to feel like you have to, just know that it would help us achieve our dream of meeting Tim Allen and recording our EP.

story:
UPDATED 3/26: Audio preview posted above



Ghost locked himself in a room in the middle of nowhere over the last several months, armed with an Elektron Analog Keys synth and wrote an intensely personal, genre defying album regarding a series of encounters which he refuses to talk about. 

He asked his friends for some help in executing his vision, and wound up with an army of like-minded musicians from all over the world contributing as part of We Have A Ghost.

Due to the unique nature of how Encounters is being recorded and the sheer number of tracks collected, mixing will be a herculean task and needs to be handled by the right person. In addition, Ghost is especially concerned with working with someone who is alligned with his vision in crafting a cohesive, accessible yet unclassifiable sound that is equal parts heavy and light. Enter Matt Bayles. 

Matt produced ISIS (the band), including Oceanic, one of Ghost's all time favorites, as well albums by Mastodon, Russian Circles, assisted on Deftones Around The Fur, two Pearl Jam albums, and the debut from Alice in Chains. 

Roughly 75% of Encounters is written and tracked. Ghost is asking you for help in executing this vision. 

Funds are going towards Matt tracking drums and mixing the album at the Red Room in Seattle, as well as Ghost recording vocals, cello and violin, and getting the album mastered.

If we exceed this goal, we will unveil stretch goals.

Encounters will not initially be released to the public. It's going to backers of this campaign and shopped to labels 1st, via Ghost's imprint. We are hoping to wrap up production later this year, followed by a late 2015 / early 2016 backer release.

Thank you, 


WE HAVE A GHOST

--

FAQ

Q: Who is Ghost and what does his music sound like?

A: Ghost is an anonymous artist who makes electronic music. Examples of his music are embedded below. More about Ghost and his music here. 

Q: Can you tell me who else is contributing on this album?

A: Members operating under the We Have A Ghost collective include: Zia Uddin (The Mayfield Four, International Heroes, Modwheelmood), Danny Ryder (Of These, Hope), Ryan Colgan (Crepitus), Steven Sheffield - with contributions by Chris Vaughn, Jonno Lloyd (Ventenner), Vru Patel (Solarein), among others. 

Q: I want VINYL! Are there any plans for a physical release?

A. Ghost loves vinyl!  We have stretch goals for that if we can achieve a certain level above goal. The first priority is doing justice to this album by getting Encounters  properly recorded and mixed.

Q: What about touring? 

A: stay tuned...





Debut album here (With Zia on drums on track 1 "The Secret" and track 4 "The Incident"

story:
Welcome to the team...

I am wrapped up in the tornado that is the music business. I often forget to stop and reminisce. When I do, I realise the milestones that have been achieved. Little by little my childhood dream IS coming true. It's crazy, things that have happened to me that keep me on this great, yet gruelling path. Amazing people I meet & events that occur just when I am too exhausted to carry on. This truly is what I was born to do. It couldn't be clearer. 

THANK YOU for your consideration in joining me on this journey. If you want to, you can become a key player in the success of my next single - "Together" by producing an amazing video to release with the song this April. The song which I believe will take my career next level. I would love you to be a part of it:)

There are many unknowns in the music industry, but one things for sure - it is YOU that keeps me going. Iv'e worked hard, taken a ride on that emotional roller coaster, spent hours perfecting my skills, made many sacrifices and dedicated my life to this musical journey but I couldn't do any of it with out you. 

TOGETHER

"Together" is one of  14 songs off my new album due out April 24th 2015. It will be released as a single 10th April 2015. The album has been in the making for 2-3 years. It's my baby. I am bursting at the seams to get it out! Together is an EPIC song with inescapable hooks. Its powerful, dramatic, edgy and BIG POP sound flirting with country undertones has it poised to crossover into different market streams. It deserves an AMAZING video to showcase the emotion and purity that can be drawn from it. 

WHY I NEED YOU

I won't sugar coat it. As an independent artist having self - funded a vast majority of my career to date, and having on-going expenses, it is hard to keep up.  With your help, we can take what could have been an average video and turn it into an amazing video.

The magnitude of what could be achieved with the help of your contribution is HUGE. The goal is to hit main stream radio and then use that momentum to go international. I have an amazing creative team behind me made up of individuals of different expertise all over the country ready and waiting to help this song go BIG in NZ. It is important to me, YOU have the opportunity to be a part of this and become apart of the action. 

THE CREW

Little Sister Films of Christchurch has been contracted to direct and produce the video. They are an established company experienced in music video production with their own video production crew. A video concept has been produced. The only secret i'll give away is it involves fire and a grand piano! If I reach my goal, I can create this amazing video. The higher the budget - the more effective and higher quality the video.

Trudie Millar Stylist of Wanaka is on stand by to be in charge of wardrobe for myself and any actors/extras used in the video. She is amazing!

Tracey Z Taylor Make Up and Shannon Vanwalt Hair Stylist both of Wanaka are both on standby to do their part in the video also. Both incredible!

Noise PR in Auckland will be working on the radio plugging and release of the single/video.

WHATS IN IT FOR YOU?

As a thank you, I have formulated unique perks such as free copies of my new album, tee shirts, tickets to my shows, personalised thank-you's, dinner or lunch with me, the opportunity to be a part of the music video and much, much more!! 

If I DON'T reach my goal then I will use what I have raised and we will shoot the video accordingly. At the end of the day, having a video is better than not having a video.

I am really excited to see the progress of this campaign and I can't wait to have you involved. You can share my campaign with your friends to help make this project even bigger! I really feel like I am reaching a major milestone in my career, especially with my new music and I would really love for you to be a part of that:) 

Thank you so much! Keep rockin' life. 

Lots of love,

Jody Direen.

story:
Short Summary

 

Ever wonder how much of an impact you could have on the world?

By joining us, you could start doing your part in change!

RK Sympathy is an organization which takes technology and uses it to spread mental illness awareness, to change people's lives. The core part of the technology we use to do this are the singers we create, in a program called UTAU.

Creating singers, it sounds strange, right? Believe it or not, they sound very human. Not only that, they can teach us to be human!

By assigning each voice, or as we call them, Sympathyloid, a mental illness, we are able to create an entire personality and history to go along with them. With this, each of our creations have a life laid out in front of them, lives just like ours.

When we show you their experiences, you are viewing an example of what others with the same mental illness could be facing. All the hardships, the effects to daily life, the thoughts that come along with them, the physical impacts, and the dents in social abilities, you see them all, and hopefully, you understand it all.

Sympathy and empathy are two important factors in our organization, and if we're unable to achieve both, we're going to at least achieve one. Sympathy.

How can you help us with this? There are many ways. The most effective is by downloading our voices and using them for the better good!

Each stands for their own mental illness, and you can use them to share awareness about them from experiences and knowledge of your own!

If you'd like to support us further, complete voicebank languages are sold in our webstore, they include five extra banks!

Additionally, we now have an application section for those who wish to help out with our cause!

We thank everyone for their continuous support, and wish everyone a good journey in forming their empathy-filled lives!

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to create these computer-generated singers, each requires a voicer who can record themselves speaking specific syllables for the singer to process and make its own. Voicers are also called 'voice base's because of this.

The problem we're currently running into is a lack of funding. It costs a lot of money to keep this going, and so we figured we'd ask for help with the biggest part of us: our voices!
In order to produce the best quality voicebanks, we need the best quality equipment. There are currently 8 voicers who require access to recording studios, and each need to record 6 voicebanks for each language.
If we only ask for one language now, and each bank took only an hour, it'd still be $300 per voicer!
Our goal is to accumulate enough money for each voicer to record. (Factoring in the extra money that may be needed if one voicer takes too long recording, or any other problems we may run into.) If we don't make this goal, the money made will go into recording for whichever voicers are available soonest. If we exceed our goal, the money will go into both recording, and anything else the voicebank needs before release. (Official art for the voice [like the ones in the pitch image by Weissidian] and oto'ing of the voice.)
When the whole process is complete, the voicebanks become available to the public. There is both a free version and a full version of each. The free version is open for digital download to the public, and includes a 1-pitch main bank + tutorials on how to use everything. The full includes a 3-pitch main bank and 3 Appends (additional voices with a set emotion to them) + the same tutorials. A percentage of the money from the full version is donated to a selected charity or organization for the specific mental illness that Sympathyloid has. (Charities/organizations are contacted beforehand on the matter.)
The Impact

 

The actual impact of this is up to our audience. We are hoping to at least change the way you view mental illnesses (and any additional subjects we go over). Having a mental illness is like having any other type of illness. Instead of looking down on those who have it, why not try to put yourself in their shoes? Would you have been able to even make it as far as they have?

Isn't music a great way to share these feelings? That's why we have to do this! If we want to help create a positive mindset towards those who suffer from these illnesses, then we must portray it in a positive way!

Our idea may be a little strange, but we're at least putting effort into it to help everyone! Whether it be getting people to be looked at positively, or helping others to understand.

Risks & Challenges

A few problems that come up with recording at studios are the voicer taking longer to record than expected, and the voicer unable to record the reclist (recording list) properly from mispronunciation.

We've gone through it before. One voicer got nervous being in a setting such as a studio, and in the end only recorded 2/9 reclist pages in 2 hours. Does this mean it's impossible to record in time? No.

I (Ruka) am another voicer, and also the one who helps with Japanese (and some English) pronunciation to those who need it. After that voicer's time ran out, I recorded the full reclist in an hour.

So what happened? We didn't practice enough.

What needs to be done this time is a scheduling of practice sessions beforehand. Not of just one or two sessions, but of four or five instead. During these, we will go over both pronunciation and how to face microphone fears. Additionally, to make sure we have everything down, we shall make sure the voicer recording will be able to meet a few hours beforehand for extra practice and review.

Outside of the recording studio, the only real problem will be making sure our audience uses the voices for awareness. We will be ourselves, but we will need to trust you with doing so too!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Don't have the money to contribute? You can still help us by spreading the word!

    If you share this with others, you'll still be helping us! And we'll greatly appreciate your support!

Other Ways You Can Help
Don't have the money to contribute? You can still help us by spreading the word!
If you share this with others, you'll still be helping us! And we'll greatly appreciate your support!

story:
I am Katuš, a world-folk musician, based in Cumbria, UK. I have travelled the world performing my music, writing and collecting songs, and I sing in many languages - including Mandinka. Have a look at my website www.katus.cz

I also help run Wanderlusts Horse-Drawn Holidays with Barny Maurice www.wanderlusts.co.uk

Yankuba Conteh is a talented musician and good friend of mine from The Gambia, West Africa. Two months ago, his daughter Adama Conteh was killed and his wife Kaddy Jallow badly burnt when a gas stove exploded at his mother-in-law’s house in Brikama, The Gambia. After they buried their 2 ½ year old daughter, Yankuba’s wife had to get a bush taxi (there are no ambulances where they live) to Dakar in Senegal. There was nowhere for her to get good burns treatment in The Gambia. I  sent them  money to pay for her hospital treatment in Dakar and having spent 1 month there, she has now returned home where she needs ongoing care from family, not to mention emotional support.

I am hoping to raise enough money to allow Yankuba, to come to the UK and conduct a music tour that i am organising for us in April-May 2015. Following such a tragedy in their lives, I had also hoped to bring Yankuba's wife and five year old son over too, but due to her medical condition, she would not be allowed into the UK. I would like to send  some of the money raised to Yankuba's wife so that while he is in the UK , she and their son will be well looked after. All his family want Yankuba to come to the UK and do this tour!

Yankuba Conteh is an extremely talented musician - he is a Griotte - spiritual singer/storyteller and Kora player, like his father Momodou Konte and grandfather Alhaji Bai Konte of Brikama, The Gambia, before him.

I met him and played music with him in The Gambia in 2013. During this time we recorded songs for my newly released album "The Spring of 2022"which is available to buy on my website and on iTunes. All sales from this album will go towards making this tour happen, so please buy the album! 


I have tour dates lined up for us in April and May around the UK and since this tragic accident with his family and the death of their daughter, I am asking for contributions to fund Yankuba,  to come to the UK in April. The cost is around £1200  to get a visa and return flight . A further £2500 would help go towards costs of transport, food and accommodation while touring, as well as to record another album of the music we make together here.  He will stay at our home in Cumbria while rehearsing for the tour, and money will be sent to his wife ( I hope at least £300) so that while he is away she has everything she may need.

We are going through his second visa application at the moment, as the first was refused on the grounds that we hadn't advertised the job in the UK. So we have advertised the job and re-applied for his visa, and he has his interview on Monday. He also has letters from two UK agents stating that there is no other griot available in the UK to do the tour. The visa will  be from 8th April til 31 st May 2015. 

I have also applied for Arts Council Funding of £4000  to sponsor the tour – for publicity, musician fees,travel .If i  get this i can guarantee the whole band a fee so all 5 musicians can come, and sound man can come and record some gigs so we can make the live album. The Arts Council cannot however fund Yankuba's travel from The Gambia. I will be very surprised if we get the funding as it was very last minute and i have never recieved funding before.

The dates we have so far are :

Sprint Mill , Cumbria tbc

The Square and Compass, Worth Motravers  24th April

Jamboree London 27th April

The Tea House Theatre , London 28th April 

Lincoln Drill Hall 30th April

The Lighthouse Deal 2nd May

The Greenman Gallery Buxton 3rd May

Aros Centre, Isle of skye 8th May

The Crystal House, Strathpeffer 9th May

The Soundhouse Edinburgh 11th May

Argyll Hotel , Ullapool 12th May

The Boat Yard, Aberdovey 14th May

Glanfa Stage, Millenium Centre Cardiff 15th May

Shap Village Hall 16th May 

The Trades Club, Hebdon Bridge  20th May 

The Wonder Inn, Manchester   21st May

Musicport Whitby  22nd May

The Firestation, Penrith 29th May

We will also be performing from the Wanderlusts Horse-Drawn Stage around Cumbria.

Any gigs that you book us for by buying the "Perks" will be happily fitted into our ever growing schedule! Any Koras purchased will be given to you in person if we come to perform near you, shipped to you at the end of the tour, or can be collected in person.

I hope that we will make money on the music tour so that Yankuba can go home and work towards fulfilling his dream, which is to set up a music school. If he is refused the visa this time round, i will send him the remaining money to go towards setting up his music school and to help his wife with anything she needs to recover from the trauma.

I sincerely hope that we will make music together for many years to come, both here and in Africa, and I hope that this is the first of many visits here for Yankuba Conteh.

Please share this with as many people as you can, via Indiegogo, facebook, twitter and word of mouth - even if you cannot contribute yourself this in itself is helpfull! Please get intouch if you feel you'd like to help in any other way! We are open to ideas and you can email me on katuscz@gmail.com or call +44 7706361685.
story_txt:
I am Katuš, a world-folk musician, based in Cumbria, UK. I have travelled the world performing my music, writing and collecting songs, and I sing in many languages - including Mandinka. Have a look at my website www.katus.cz
I also help run Wanderlusts Horse-Drawn Holidays with Barny Maurice www.wanderlusts.co.uk


Yankuba Conteh is a talented musician and good friend of mine from The Gambia, West Africa. Two months ago, his daughter Adama Conteh was killed and his wife Kaddy Jallow badly burnt when a gas stove exploded at his mother-in-law’s house in Brikama, The Gambia. After they buried their 2 ½ year old daughter, Yankuba’s wife had to get a bush taxi (there are no ambulances where they live) to Dakar in Senegal. There was nowhere for her to get good burns treatment in The Gambia. I  sent them  money to pay for her hospital treatment in Dakar and having spent 1 month there, she has now returned home where she needs ongoing care from family, not to mention emotional support.


I am hoping to raise enough money to allow Yankuba, to come to the UK and conduct a music tour that i am organising for us in April-May 2015. Following such a tragedy in their lives, I had also hoped to bring Yankuba's wife and five year old son over too, but due to her medical condition, she would not be allowed into the UK. I would like to send  some of the money raised to Yankuba's wife so that while he is in the UK , she and their son will be well looked after. All his family want Yankuba to come to the UK and do this tour!
