story:
Hello you! 

Thanks for taking the time to come say hi and for taking an interest in helping a dream come true.
I am a solo artist by the name of MeMe Detroit. I have just finished recording my debut album ("Live to Love you'll love to live") after over a year & a half of hard and dedicated work not just from myself but from all the amazing musicians involved in making this record (Which I am so appreciative of). If you haven't already, you can click the trailer vid above to listen whilst you read.
I had the masters back for a final listen and I've gotta say I am so so proud of the finished product. It's everything a girl like me could ever want in a debut album. 
Album preview listens have already started generating great praise from the likes of Luke Johnson (ex Lost Prophets/No Devotion), Emma Scott (Pluggin baby/kerrang radio/XFm), Benjamin Weinman (Dillinger Escape Plan) & Adam Zindani (Stereophonics/Casino).
What I would love now more than anything in the world, is to get this album out there and heard by you and the people all over the world. I would love people to hear my album and have it move and inspire them like musicians and artists alike have moved and inspired me! Music is a lifeline to our lives in so many ways! :) 
This album so far has been completely self funded and I will continue to put my all into it, however, to push it to that next level I would love a little extra help. What better way to receive help than from the people who enjoy and support me and my music! So YOU, the fans become a part of this too! 

The breakdown (boring but essential bit)...

In order to get this album out there we're going to want to get good PR behind us for radio plays and press to spread the word........On average this costs around £2000 a month. With 2 singles and an album release we'll be looking at round about 5 months worth possibly longer dependant on the second and possibly a 3rd single release.
Good distribution to make the album accessible and available to buy across the board......Average pricing is £20-£25 for the album, £6-£8 per single.
Video production for the single releases (which will also then be placed into the PR bracket), I have just released the video for the first single which is completely self funded (www.youtube.com/MeMeDetroitofficial). I'm looking at a video budget from £500 for the next video.
Professional product manufacturing for physical copies of the album to be made. £1000
Then of course there's the live tours so I get to perform the album to you all......That bit I'm really looking forward to! :) Excitingly, Some dates are already starting to come in around the UK. The main cost for tour is transportation, accommodation and food. Of course I would love to be able to pay the wonderful musicians that join me on tour also so for a mini week's tour to start me off I'm looking at a budget of £1000.
Alongside touring, there is also the merchandise production of Tshirts, posters, badges etc. Average merchandise production budget £500.
There will of course be some fabulous rewards/bonuses for helping me out and for being a part of this so check down the right hand side to see if there's anything that tickles your fancy!

The Impact

A quick little extra question......Are you getting a bit sick and tired of some of the talentless, meaningless drivel that's been saturating the charts lately? I would love to be a part of putting a change in motion to get real music and real talent back onto our radios! I truly believe in the talent that has gone into this album and I truly believe that I have a great product full of ear candy for everyone to enjoy. Wouldn't it be nice to have some genuine artists and talent back in the charts? :) xxx


The risks? There is none!

With the music industry, there is a hell of a lot of pessimism towards becoming a success. All the "what ifs?" And "you'll be lucky"......Well here's what i say, You only live once, so make that once count. If you're doing what you love in life then you're already a success and things will only get better and better the more you keep doing what you love! I love music, I have already made an album that I am extremely proud and appreciative of. Now to get it out there and heard As well as appreciated by you and the masses?....What an awesome bonus! :) 


Spreading like wildfire

Thank you so so much for your time, I really can't express enough how appreciative I am and how much I am looking forward to this adventure with you all! 

I would love it if you could help me spread this out there like wildfire by hitting the share and like buttons etc. Maybe there's someone you know who's press/blog related who would be interested in covering, blogging etc. 

"Live to love you'll love to love".........Let's do this! 


MD xxxxxxx

story:
Hey People !!!

The indierockin three piece World At Large from Stavanger, Norway, has been around for 9 years and released 3 albums so far. The members have played together for almost 20 years in different groups and are now ready to record their best album yet.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We want to go to Norway's, and one of Europe's,  best studios. Thats's  Ocean Sound Recordings; a studio with an ocean view, the right sound and all the right gear (http://www.oceansoundrecordings.com)

 

  • We're working with, just like last time, Ashley Stubbert as producer. He is one of Norway's top producers and won't be affordable to us for much longer. He is a true  professional and essential to the albums chances of being a success.

 

  • We're offering tons of personalized perks. There is more than one way of getting your name or even face affiliated with this album. Check out our perks and join in.

We thank you !!!

 

  • Our last record was also partly financed by you; the fans. It helped us produce our best record yet. Thank you for that. We hope we delivered. Here are some of the results of you supporting us:
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dP17RX_vHmA 
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kxyaBTFiMY
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZDyYvBdxaZk
  • https://play.spotify.com/album/1qxzULiRl6iU9CMGaZi1x5?play=true&utm_source=open.spotify.com&utm_medium=open
  •  http://www.rb.no/lokal_kultur/article6856399.ece
  • Will you help us again? We promise to work hard 24-7 to make this our best record ever. 
  • Help us share and expose this campaign to as many as possible.

story:
We want...

We want our new album 'Mayhem' to be huge. Something that massively exceeds the scope of your everyday independent album production. We want grand songs, blasting like soundtracks from blockbuster films. We want them played by a live-orchestra. We want real choirs to back it up. We want the mix to be spot-on. 

We want to be THE groundbreaking and innovative Band you never saw and heard before from a Prog Black/Death Metal Band! We want to get GOLD in Austria!
We want to produce our jewel cases and Digipacks by ourselfs and  distribute our CD by our own and go on European - or - World Tour- with your help!

In short, we want to prove that YOU can release a record, a Tour and the Distribution without a record label.


We are...

HI, this is SCARGOD, an Austrian, innovative Black Metal Band, that needs your help. After our present/previous Austrian Recordlabel  had to close due to financial Problems, we lost a lot of Money - again! This happened to me (Martin "Dr. Maze Pain" Moser) already with his old Band Shadows Grey, where I lost all my Money the first time. So, I am not interested in working together with companies, that earn my Money and a small Band like Scargod is going to be busted by a Record Company and of course the Music industry again and again... !

Martin “Maze” Moser had the idea of a Black Metal Band without confinement within genre limits. So the band was born out of hell´s most obscure blackness in 2013 presetting without retrench itself. AND all comrades- in – arms ensueded.

You may us know from our Debut CD "Sacrilegious Symphonies". Released digital on 29th of September 2014. If not, please give us a Chance regardless.

Or you know us due to winning those Awards:

- Best National Band of the year 2007 and 2014 (stormbringer.at)
- Best Album  (2nd Place) of the year 2014  (stormbringer.at)
- Best Song of the year 2014 "The hymns of my disgrace" (stormbringer.at)
- Nominated for Best Band of the year 2014 (she-wolf.at)
- Winner of the Annual  Radio Single Charts with our Single "The hymns of my disgrace" (stahlradio.de)
- Six weeks in a row Nr.1 at the Radio Single Charts (stahlradio.de)


What will you get...

The Basics for all the Songs are already written. I am now writing the Orchester score for the Songs and when, or better to say if we reach the Goal, then we can start recording the Album in the Studio. AND: We already asked some famous musicians to help us on the Album. They are all in. But, I am not allowed to say something.  And of course  you will be informed further along the line :-)  So, stay tuned and be prepared! We COULD do a reduced version on a tight budget but that is not what we want and, still less, what YOU deserve! We have been supported by amazing people all around the world. . We want these people and everyone of you to have the best album we can possibly make! If you are willing to be part of something beautiful and prove to us once again why we are nothing without you, please contribute and spread the word! If we all pull on this together, the album will be done in no time and in the end it would be thanks to YOU and truly Special.


But not only the Album will be done within no time, also the Video shoot and the Tour will be planned, carried out and fullfilled with fun, success and professionalism - As we and primarily YOU deserve! - Against the gold-digging Industrie! Thank you for your Support! Martin Moser aka Dr. Maze Pain/SCARGOD

story:
Short Summary

Greater Manchester Police Male Voice Choir and Cantare Ladies Choir are coming together in July 2015 to perform an ambitious concert at the newly refurbished RNCM Concert Hall.  Alongside Bob Chilcott's A Little Jazz Mass and Faure's Requiem we have commissioned Chris Roe to compose a new work entitled Visions of Paradise.

What We Need & What You Get

Chris is an exceptionally talented young composer on the brink of forging a brilliant career, but performing new works is an expensive and time-consuming task.  The money we need will predominantly go towards Chris's commission fee, but also towards the cost of him attending rehearsals in order to make sure his musical ideas are realised as accurately and successfully as possible.  Funding will also go towards the cost of hiring musicians and soloists, hiring the RNCM concert hall, printing and other music hire, as well as costs for additional rehearsals.

By contributing towards this ambitious project you get the satisfaction of supporting a talented young composer and knowing that you've helped bring an exciting new piece of choral music into the world.  

The Impact

Firstly, by donating, you give an exciting young composer the opportunity to write a new choral work for a non-professional choir.  Very few choirs take on new commissions as it can be a risky business, not knowing what the music will be like as it's never been performed before!  This work will add to Chris's extensive and exceptional portfolio, hopefully giving him further exposure and boosting his career.

Secondly, the opportunity to sponsor a world premiere is a very rare occurrence and, we are hoping, that through our networks, friends and supporters in the music world, this work will see repeat performances across the country in subsequent years.  You can be a small (or large!) part of that by donating to the project.  Everyone who donates will be mentioned in the score in all subsequent reprintings.

Finally, you are giving two talented choirs the opportunity to sink their teeth into a really new and different work, and present a new work, a world premiere, to their family, friends and supporters.  

Risks & Challenges

Rehearsing and performing any new work provides many challenges for everyone involved. The music isn't readily available for the choir or musical director to listen to, or the composer's ideas may not be perfectly realised and compromise may be necessary.  We will limit the risks in various ways.  Included in the cost of the commission is provision for several visits from Chris to hear how the choir are progressing so he can advise accordingly.  We have added in additional rehearsals specifically on the new work where both choirs can meet each other and rehearse together.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you are unable to donate there are many other ways you can get involved:

  • Join one of the choirs!  Cantare rehearse on a Wednesday from 7.30 at the Rochdale Music Service in Rochdale, and Greater Manchester Police Male Voice Choir on a Thursday night, also from 7.30, at Sedgley Park in Prestwich.
  • Come to the concert at 7.30 on Saturday 18th July at the RNCM Concert Hall.
  • Share this fundraising campaign with anyone you think may be interested!
story_txt:
Short Summary Greater Manchester Police Male Voice Choir and Cantare Ladies Choir are coming together in July 2015 to perform an ambitious concert at the newly refurbished RNCM Concert Hall.  Alongside Bob Chilcott's A Little Jazz Mass and Faure's Requiem we have commissioned Chris Roe to compose a new work entitled Visions of Paradise.   What We Need & What You Get Chris is an exceptionally talented young composer on the brink of forging a brilliant career, but performing new works is an expensive and time-consuming task.  The money we need will predominantly go towards Chris's commission fee, but also towards the cost of him attending rehearsals in order to make sure his musical ideas are realised as accurately and successfully as possible.  Funding will also go towards the cost of hiring musicians and soloists, hiring the RNCM concert hall, printing and other music hire, as well as costs for additional rehearsals.
By contributing towards this ambitious project you get the satisfaction of supporting a talented young composer and knowing that you've helped bring an exciting new piece of choral music into the world.  
 
  The Impact Firstly, by donating, you give an exciting young composer the opportunity to write a new choral work for a non-professional choir.  Very few choirs take on new commissions as it can be a risky business, not knowing what the music will be like as it's never been performed before!  This work will add to Chris's extensive and exceptional portfolio, hopefully giving him further exposure and boosting his career.
Secondly, the opportunity to sponsor a world premiere is a very rare occurrence and, we are hoping, that through our networks, friends and supporters in the music world, this work will see repeat performances across the country in subsequent years.  You can be a small (or large!) part of that by donating to the project.  Everyone who donates will be mentioned in the score in all subsequent reprintings.
Finally, you are giving two talented choirs the opportunity to sink their teeth into a really new and different work, and present a new work, a world premiere, to their family, friends and supporters.  
 
  Risks & Challenges Rehearsing and performing any new work provides many challenges for everyone involved. The music isn't readily available for the choir or musical director to listen to, or the composer's ideas may not be perfectly realised and compromise may be necessary.  We will limit the risks in various ways.  Included in the cost of the commission is provision for several visits from Chris to hear how the choir are progressing so he can advise accordingly.  We have added in additional rehearsals specifically on the new work where both choirs can meet each other and rehearse together.  
 
  Other Ways You Can Help If you feel you are unable to donate there are many other ways you can get involved:


Join one of the choirs!  Cantare rehearse on a Wednesday from 7.30 at the Rochdale Music Service in Rochdale, and Greater Manchester Police Male Voice Choir on a Thursday night, also from 7.30, at Sedgley Park in Prestwich.
Come to the concert at 7.30 on Saturday 18th July at the RNCM Concert Hall.
Share this fundraising campaign with anyone you think may be interested!

story:
Carter grew up in a musical environment that developed his love for performing and songwriting. He is currently in his junior year studying at The Orange County School of the Arts. Carter's musical style was mostly influenced by Pop, R&B, and Rock albums. His upcoming single is a Retro Pop/R&B anthem that marks his transition from acoustic + singer/songwriter roots to a more mainstream sound.

                                      


Check out his website:

http://www.carterhodgesmusic.com/

FOLLOW CARTER ON: 

INSTAGRAM | TWITTER | FACEBOOK

Here at 2 Seas Productions, we are excited to be working with Carter Hodges. We first met Carter when he was performing with Maddy Vance at a DNT Agency Artist Mixer. During the performance, something about Carter's voice captured the attention of the producers. We are excited to create a stunning cinematic look for his upcoming single.

Our Crew Members:

       

Hao Blake Chang, Mr. Chang, founder & owner of 2 Seas Productions. 

  • As a producer, he successfully raised $20,000 for his recently finished short film, Mountain Man. 
      

  • Mr. Chang also produced & directed 2 Seas Productions' first two Music Videos: "Wouldn't Change a Thing"- Maddy Vance & "Lullaby for Natalie"- Anne Akiko Meyers.

Meet our team of producers:

                                    

Kaitlyn Marsters, Iron Woman, leading producer of this project

  • Producer for 2 Seas Productions' BETA Division. 
  • Assisted Mr. Chang in the making of Maddy Vance's Music Video.
  • Kaitlyn's knowledge of film law and business structure adds a necessary foundation for the production.
  • Her skills also expand into Unit Production Management as well as G&E.   

                                       

Patrick Broderick, The Recruiter 

  • He transitioned from a musical production to film. 
  • Broderick is the man that investigate where the 1% (best) crew member from colleges. (Find and Recruit)

Tyler Voss, The Wolf, also an actor
  • Voss is in charge of finding individual and corporate investors. 
  • As a producer, he raised $15,000 for his most recent short film.


     

Yuichi Yoshida, BETA Division: Director of Photography for the 1st team

  • Yuichi demonstrated his skill set as a director of photography (DP) in both 2 Seas Productions Music Video: Maddy Vance & Anne Akiko Meyers.
  • His background as a G&E trained his understanding of lighting.
  • His background as a Production Designer helped solidify his skill set as a DP

FOLLOW HIM ON: INSTAGRAM

                      

  

Karleigh Engelbrecht, ALPHA & BETA Division: Production Designer

  • Engelbrecht is a talented production designer (PD) that will help create the visual effect of everything you see in front of the camera: set design, props, make-up, and wardrobe.
  • Karleigh always looks for way to improve her knowledge as a PD by working on multiple sets, no matter how big or small. 
  • She work as PD for Maddy Vance's Music Video.

     

Here is a link to a music video contest we entered: 

(Finalist & Staff Pick): Lullaby for Natalie 

FOLLOW 2 Seas on: INSTAGRAM | FACEBOOK | YOUTUBE

story:
A new community centered, truly independent local radio station, needs your help to break the current monopoly and monotony!

Of the 24 mainstream 'local' FM & digital radio stations serving the UK Counties of Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire & Buckinghamshire, all but one are owned & programmed by just five companies: Global Radio, BBC, UKRD, Bauer Media & the Adventure Radio Group.

Some of this may sound good but what gets left out?

YOU! 

the people living in this region, set aside in favour of generic ideas & standard playlists, dictated by central HQ

Local radio is about place and all places are different. We believe that the radio should be different too.

Serious Radio UK will give you a choice AND a voice. We will highlight parts of the region you love, amplifying its voices and sounds. We will be a station for the people, businesses & organisations who live & work in these three counties.

Serious Radio UK is all about you the listener.

As part of your community, we will drive to deliver not just entertainment, but also empowerment, optimism, fun and a collective that will support you in your everyday life.


                                          


Why Serious Radio?

We will be locally owned and operated. Not networked from a studio in London with presenters that have no connection to the people or locality they are broadcasting to.

Why Serious Radio?

  • We are serious about supporting the communities and being a regular presence, including frequent live shows from the towns and communities.
  • We are serious about providing a voice and a platform to generate and enhance community interaction as well as promotion for events of all types, not just the 'showcase' ones!
  • We are serious about the music, which is why we will not have a restricted playlist.
  • We are serious about supporting local talent, providing airtime for bands and musicians, along with coverage of festivals and events of all genres and sizes.
  • We are serious about supporting causes important to you, which is why we intend to fundraise each year, along with generating awareness and support for chosen causes and issues. We are a station that, dances with BIG ideas!
We are serious about being a radio station for the people. Which is why Serious Radio UK will always be open to your feedback and suggestions.

 

                                         

                                          


                           Serious Partnerships

                                                    
                                                     

               Serious Radio UK will be the official media partner to 
                                        Biggleswade United FC  
                      

Just like Serious Radio UK; Biggleswade United FC is at the beginning of what they hope and anticipate to be an extremely exciting journey. They believe in an approach to football that is not only played the right way, but unites people and   communities who have a passion for all aspects of football. Here at Serious Radio UK, we too have a desire, to provide radio that not only is entertaining but that engages the communities and provides added value.

 Our partnership will include live broadcasts and commentary from the club and involvement in their community projects.

And who knows, we may even persuade United's Director of Football and Sky Sports presenter, Guillem Balague to present a show!

                         

                                           

                          Club Chairman Chris Lewis with Director of Football 

                                    & Sky Sports Presenter, Guillem Balague

                                                           

                                      

                                     


                        Serious Partnerships

                                              

                             


Serious Radio UK will be partnering with British Garden Centres, with our studios incorporated as part of their exciting re-development of Roxton Garden Centre as a major family attraction.


 

                                         


                           Serious Partnerships


                A small station that dances with

                                   BIG ideas!
        


Serious Radio UK is an official partner of VisionHeart Limited; an organisation dedicated to the delivery of emotional intelligence education and training programmes to schools and businesses worldwide. 
VisonHeart Limited is spearheaded by The Scary Guy, a unique entertainer and educator whose mission is: 
The total elimination of Hate, Violence and Prejudice Worldwide.
Not only will Serious Radio UK be the exclusive home of 'The Scary Guy Radio Show', but we will work with him to bring his powerful education programmes to schools and organisations across Herts, Beds & Bucks.




                         

                                                       

                              Help us to help you

With your help and support, this Indiegogo campaign will enable us to get Serious Radio UK on the air. The funding will be used for broadcast equipment and some marketing, but the largest proportion will be to obtain the digital broadcast licence. Running a radio station isn't cheap!

Unfortunately when it comes to the licence, we can't 'shop around' for the best deal as  all licences are regulated and provided by just one organisation.

However, while this annual cost may be prohibitive for many small stations - one reason we feel the big corporations dominate the airwaves - we have a solid business plan to cover this cost and once 'on air', we will offer the best deal to our listeners, advertisers  and sponsors. Providing a radio service as we believe it was intended and offering incredible value.

Sadly we are not multi millionaire businessmen. Nor do we have access to funds from another part of a huge corporation. This is why we are seeking your help to take on the establishment by asking kindly for your backing. In return we have compiled a great set of 'perks' (see below).

As well as backing us, maybe you are an individual or business that may have a skill or product that we could use? It might be a service that we need or even enhancing the perks that we offer? Or perhaps you would be interested in helping us with the project in some other way that we haven't thought of? However you think you can help us, we would like to hear from you. Please email: studio@seriousradiouk.com

Radio is supposed to be about the listener, but it doesn't seem that way!                     We want to, give radio back to the people. This is your chance to help create a radio station that gives you what YOU want.

  • Tell us what music you would like to hear?
  • If you're a musician or band looking for some airtime and exposure, send us your demo and information.
  • If you are a business or organisation, tell us how we can help you?
  • If you would like to work for us, we'd love to hear from you.                                                                                                                                                                                               

For all the above & for any other reason please email: studio@seriousradiouk.com

                                          

                                         

                          

                                         Perks

                            

                    

Along with the obligatory window sticker, a bag and mug, we wish to thank our     backers with perks that include tickets to an exclusive gig featuring Henry Priestman, singer songwriter and one time band member with The Christians.

                            

For our backers that are unable to travel to the event (see our terms & conditions), we will stream the gig online by live video.  An exclusive code to view the stream will be sent to all returned postcards

Other great perks include being invited to our studios for our VIP Launch event and for some backers, the opportunity to be a 'radio star' for a day and present your own show!

For businesses, there are three Perks offering opportunities for Serious Radio UK to thank you with 'on air' mentions. Check out our, 'On The Radio - Silver, Gold & Platinum' perks.


If that's not serious enough, how about our perk that is scarily exciting!

              

 The Scary Guy will thank 5 of you personally for backing Serious Radio UK                 by spending a day at a UK school or organisation that you choose and arrange.

Scary - as we know him - delivers his unique emotional intelligence programmes all over the world. He wants to visit you!

for more information about The Scary Guy, his work and programmes:

www.thescaryguy.com


PLEASE NOTE: 
While we will be a UK based digital radio station, we will still stream our sound across the globe online, making us an internationally local station!
Backers from outside the UK are most welcome.
Who knows, our second station may turn up in your backyard!

Terms & Conditions

  • The designs of the stickers, mug, bag & post cards may vary.
  • Contents of the 'Goody Bag' may vary and are subject to availability.
  • The date and venue for the Henry Priestman gig to be arranged.
  • All perks exclude travel and accommodation.
  • The Scary Guy visits in these perks are exclusive to the UK mainland only.
  • The Scary Guy visits will be organised by VisionHeart Limited.

 

                                            


                              Risks & Challenges

As mentioned above, most of the radio in the UK is owned by large media corporations, with huge budgets and a seemingly virtual monopoly on the airwaves.

Because of this, it is rare for a new station such as ours to try and break in to this market.

However, by 'networking' they might be increasing their audience, but they can no longer be considered as 'local radio'.

This is where we believe we can offer real choice and provide a proper local service to our listeners. We have a solid business plan in place and have met with some of the influential business leaders across the three counties. The feedback we have received to our creative ideas has been extremely positive.

Unfortunately, we can't share these ideas with you here on Indiegogo. Our competitors may be looking!!

Life is not without its risks and challenges. 

Learn about Trust & Safety on Indiegogo

As Steve Jobs once said: "You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future. You have to trust in something - your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever. This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life."

By supporting Serious Radio UK, you will be providing the dots. Together we can join them and see them grow in to a successful, entertaining, informative and inspiring radio station. 

                   We're SER!OUS 

                                                                 

                               Share the news

While our minimum donation is just £5, we totally understand that some of you are not in a position to contribute, but whether you have donated (THANK YOU!) or not, please help us in the following ways:

  'Like' us on Facebook and share our page with your friends.

  use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

If that's not serious enough, how about our perk that is scarily exciting!

              
 The Scary Guy will thank 5 of you personally for backing Serious Radio UK                 by spending a day at a UK school or organisation that you choose and arrange.
Scary - as we know him - delivers his unique emotional intelligence programmes all over the world. He wants to visit you!
for more information about The Scary Guy, his work and programmes:

www.thescaryguy.com



PLEASE NOTE: 
While we will be a UK based digital radio station, we will still stream our sound across the globe online, making us an internationally local station!
Backers from outside the UK are most welcome.
Who knows, our second station may turn up in your backyard!

Terms & Conditions



The designs of the stickers, mug, bag & post cards may vary.

Contents of the 'Goody Bag' may vary and are subject to availability.
The date and venue for the Henry Priestman gig to be arranged.
All perks exclude travel and accommodation.
The Scary Guy visits in these perks are exclusive to the UK mainland only.

The Scary Guy visits will be organised by VisionHeart Limited.


 

                                            


                              Risks & Challenges As mentioned above, most of the radio in the UK is owned by large media corporations, with huge budgets and a seemingly virtual monopoly on the airwaves.
Because of this, it is rare for a new station such as ours to try and break in to this market.
However, by 'networking' they might be increasing their audience, but they can no longer be considered as 'local radio'.
This is where we believe we can offer real choice and provide a proper local service to our listeners. We have a solid business plan in place and have met with some of the influential business leaders across the three counties. The feedback we have received to our creative ideas has been extremely positive.
Unfortunately, we can't share these ideas with you here on Indiegogo. Our competitors may be looking!!
Life is not without its risks and challenges. 
Learn about Trust & Safety on Indiegogo
As Steve Jobs once said: "You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future. You have to trust in something - your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever. This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life."
By supporting Serious Radio UK, you will be providing the dots. Together we can join them and see them grow in to a successful, entertaining, informative and inspiring radio station. 
                   We're SER!OUS 



                                                                 

                               Share the news

 While our minimum donation is just £5, we totally understand that some of you are not in a position to contribute, but whether you have donated (THANK YOU!) or not, please help us in the following ways:

  'Like' us on Facebook and share our page with your friends.

  use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

story:
The Project

Since the beginning of my musical journey I have been a fan of new music and new composers. Having been a student composer myself, I know how difficult it can be to find a chorus of people willing to read new music. So I have an idea!

Why not start an ensemble devoted to reading brand new compositions of student composers? We could read through the work, rehearse it, then as an ensemble discuss it briefly, sharing opinions, insights, thoughts, etc. We could then provide an audio recording for the composer, along with the conductor and singers' notes for the hopeful edification of the composer. 

So this is exactly what I am setting out to do. At first we will have one session intended for the singers as a sight-singing party simply to share in the joy of music making.

I will be gathering together an ensemble of singers to sightread brand new compositions by primarily student composers. These composers are primarily unpublished, and the music we will be reading has not yet been premiered. Our aim will be to read and rehearse each piece, and then have a brief discussion afterwards. Every participant will be invited to write comments, questions, and suggestions to each of the composers. After the event, the comments from the participants will be compiled and sent to the composers with an audio recording of the rehearsal of their work. 

It is my hope that this event is a success and becomes a recurring event, that perhaps will even spawn a semi-professional ensemble that is devoted to recording and performing the works selected for the project. 

The Conductor

A native of Green Bay, Wisconsin, Davy Chinn is a vibrant and energetic young conductor, composer, and percussionist. After earning his Bachelor of Arts degree in Music Composition and Theory from Indiana Wesleyan University, he spent a year studying choral music and conducting at the University of Colorado Boulder. He then ventured farther West when the University of Southern California’s Thornton School of Music accepted him into the Master’s program. In his first year of study at USC, Chinn was accepted into the USC Thornton School of Music’s Board of Counselor’s Mentorship Program, through which he was awarded mentorship with Grant Gershon. As a champion of new music, Chinn has prepared choruses for and conducted six world premieres, and hopes to continue doing so throughout his career. Within the field of the choral art, Chinn has a developing interest in multimedia and visual accompaniments of music, inspired largely by his interest in and passion for the Deaf community. During his undergraduate studies, he had the privilege to be the assistant conductor of the Indiana Wesleyan University Chorale, and One Voice, a small worship-centric vocal jazz ensemble. As a choral performer, he has performed with such artists as Point of Grace, Fernando Ortega, Barry Manilow, the Gaither Vocal Band, the Rolling Stones, and Elton John. He has performed on such programs as the Crystal Cathedral’s “Hour of Power,” the Thrilling Adventure Hour podcast, L.A. Live’s Christmas tree lighting, and the Primetime Emmy Awards. 

What We Need & What You Get

Though the singers are volunteers, there are always expenses with a production of this kind. Expenses include: recording engineer fees, copies of music for all of the participants, collaborative pianist fees, postage fees for shipping recordings and comments to the composers involved, and simple needs such as water for the singers. Every penny raised will go directly into the program, even if we do not reach our goal. If we are fortunate enough to exceed our goal the additional funds will be used for all future events. 
The perks are designed with the hope that all of the sponsors have a passion for continuing the art of choral music. You can get your hands on perusal copies of currently unpublished music, as well as hear the work that the singers put in to the sight-reading and rehearsal session. 

The Impact

The value of music has been made clear time and time again through scientific research, award winning productions, and our own personal experiences. Composers world-wide are continuing to expand the art by adding their voice to the available repertoire. We would be nowhere without the great composers of the past who have written pieces that have become "standards." However, at one point in time these composers were writing new music that was pushing the boundaries of composition. This tradition is what makes the arts unique. It is our responsibility and our privilege to encourage artists to continue creating, and to share it with the world.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge that we face is recruiting singers and continuing to collect compositions. I am doing all that I can to promote this project in the greater Grand Rapids area, trying to recruit singers from local high schools, colleges and universities, and the community. However, there is no way of guaranteeing that people will show up or attend, we just have to do the best we can to show people that it will be well worth their time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! We would love to gain awareness for this project all over the world. Please help us by telling all of the musicians that you know about this project, especially composers. We will continue to accept composition submissions as this project grows. The more compositions we receive the more likely this project will happen again!

Special Thanks

To Jordan Andrew Davis for the use of his setting of "Ave Verum Corpus" for our promo video. 
Find out more about Jordan at www.jordanandrewdavis.com

story:
It began in Red Ink...

The story goes.  As a teenager, I lived my life inside a dream - I didn't fit in, apart from when I sat inside a classroom - or when I was writing words on paper.  This became a ritual of mine - rather than face the world, I'd make notes of the world and people around me.  Hiding inside toilet cubicles, plugging the headphones into my ears, the music made most sense to me.

And I stole a piece of your diary - traced the words with my fingertips - in red ink.  These words lead me to the math which lead me to the music.

I wished I had a head for math.

Sometimes, it is the things we need the most, which come to us in disguised ways.  And the mix tape lead me here.  For on that tape, was everything my future holds.

The photo above was taken in Bellows Falls, Vermont, 2003.  The summer after finishing my first year of uni, I made the decision to fly across the Atlantic to be there.  Because it was the math, it was the red ink, that lead me there.

And so, this lead me here.  To write my own songs, and to be here now, typing these words, that have long been forgotten.

How you can help...

So that I can take my demo songs into the studio and work on them with some musicians and get them recorded, produced and mastered, there is going to be a bit of work involved:

  • I am setting my goal at £750 with the remaining £250 to be made up by myself (this seems small, but I am doing this because my options are few) - this will cover the predicted fortnight-long access to studio time to get the album recorded, produced and mastered.
  • If you are happy to pledge any amount to this project, you will be rewarded!  These will range from a copy of my EP (which will be a pre-cursor to the album), to gig tickets, the chance to write for a music paper, your name on the album credits, the chance to co-write a song or short story.
  • If I do not reach the entire goal, the remainder of the funds raised will go towards the charity record (a separate project) I have been working on for the past two years, too - which also needs to be funded in order to be produced.

The Record...

There are personal reasons for wanting to get this album made.  Mostly, because the songs have been written for a while now, but have been put on the back-burner for various reasons.  To create something tangible with artwork and liner notes, would feel a massive achievement.  As well as music, I am working on a collection of short stories which are sometimes loosely connected to the song themes - as yet, I am not sure when this will be completed but the album and the book will work in conjunction and one will help to explain and inform the other...

  • I hope I can bring something to the world with my music and writing.
  • If I can inspire you even just a small amount, as I have been inspired in my lifetime, then I will feel like it wasn't a waste.
  • This will remain in the world beyond my own existence.  Art and thought remains.

The Process...

The songs I would like to include on my album are written in their basic bones stage of evolution.  I'd like to build on these demos and take the songs to the studio where I can record the vocals and guitar parts - and then work with adding additional instrumentation and production - mixing them up & getting the final album made and hopefully a few physical copies of CDs too (that's the hope)!

  • To do this, I need to first decide where to record the tracks.
  • I need to work out alongside a sound engineer, the best ways to add to my work - this is where the big costs come in - and a reason why I am crowdfunding.

Your Encouragement...

Really helps!  Seriously.  Apart from helping me to fund the recording - it is also a boost to know that there are folks out there who actually would sit down and listen to my songs at the end of it all.

  • Please feel free to share this campaign and support where possible.
  • Please contact me with any questions or ideas you might have - happy to respond! :)

Thank you so much for reading/listening/watching/sharing - it means a LOT.

story:
Short Summary

He watched in wonder as the big bad wolf crept into the crowd, his beautiful dark brown eyes wide with anticipation.   His little heart was beating like a drum as he clutched his sister’s hand.  The wonder and excitement was written all over his cherubic face for the music and story had captured and awakened something deep within him. A Treasure Chest had been opened.


  • Lark Chamber Opera is a dynamic ensemble of West Australian Artists committed to bringing classical music and Opera to a wider audience, beginning with children and young people.
  • Your contribution can have a powerful impact on the children, especially those who otherwise may never have the opportunity to access classical music and Opera. There is nothing as powerful or universal as music, the magic that comes from learning may give them a passion to listen and later to inspire others.

  • The survival of classical music and Opera are important and we are committed  to providing the inspiration that may unite and transform an entire generation. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • The purpose of our fundraising is for ongoing tour projects and to greatly subsidize the cost of tickets for children to give them an opportunity to listen learn and love the classical music, Opera and dramatic emotions in our productions.
  • The benefit of your donation is to attract and maintain the young audiences for the future.   Every $10 donated will support a child at a show.  We would be honored to have our donors attend our shows. 
  • If we do not reach our entire financial goal of $50,000 we will perform as many shows as we possibly can within the April, July and December 2015 school holidays to reach as many children as we can while we continue to seek funds.

  • Funds raised will pay for our  musicians, venues, advertising, administration and any extra funds will go towards new costumes and sets for future  shows.

The Impact

  • If opera is to survive we need to introduce it to the younger generation at a level they will understand.  We need to build up a future fan base to ensure we do not loose the history and passion for classical music and Opera that the world has enjoyed since the performance of Daphne, in Florence in 1580.
  • We have already touched the lives of 4000 children in schools throughout Western Australia.  The children love what they see, what they hear and what they learn. Delightful comments from our young audiences pour into our email address after our shows:

    “I learnt that you can do amazing things with your voice”
    “It made me love music even more”
    Thanks for coming to our school to sing real opera to us. I really loved it and it was cool because I’ve never seen real opera in a funny way…”
    “I thought that opera would be boring but it was really cool”


  • To breathe new life into classical music and opera is our goal.   Opera is fun and recognized by millions of people as the most beautiful music genre.

Risks & Challenges

We need to move away from the Opera cliches of  "boring" and "elitist" and ensure the younger generation are not discouraged by these stereotypes. 

  • Our goal is to have fun and to introduce children to new, fresh and funny Opera with colourful and purpose built sets, costumes and puppets.  We can produce fantastic and funny shows that not only look incredible, but provide young people with a valuable insight into how Opera works and its basic principles and forms.
  • Children will laugh and play whilst learning about recitative, arias, ensemble singing and the classical voice from our fabulous and expressive singers. 
  • The is the opportunity to give them an outlook and an appreciation of Opera that they may enjoy throughout their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help.  If you love children, if you love music, if you love opera then:

  • Please send our information to your family and friends by email, or on social media, make some noise about our campaign and send our information on.  We would be so grateful for your help in spreading the word about Classical Music Opera for children and young people.
  • It is simple just click on the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page and you can forward our information.  Thank you for your help.

story:
A more intimate and elaborate reintroduction to Mr. Lazaro Arbos!! Lazaro is back again with his richly anticipated debut album, giving us a more upfront and upclose view of all that makes him so intriguing to every heart he's touched! Despite a stutter he has battled since age 6, Lazaro bravely ventures forward with the zeal to sing strength and beauty into the hearts of people all over the world! Lazaro Arbos is an ardent musician that not only caresses his love of music, he is also equally as passionate about his love for people and taking part in creating a world that confronts and conquers the ails that challenge humanity. He hopes to speak inspiration and change into the ears of music lovers everywhere! It is his desire to contribute 20% of the proceeds of this album to the following four charities...
      
    "Feeding Children Everywhere"-  An awesome organization founded by Don and Kristen Campbell that has supplied over 20 million meals to hungry and disadvantaged children all over the world!
www.feeedingchildreneverywhere.com
L.A's Best - An organization created in 1988 by "The Late Mayor Tom Bradley" to address an alarming rise in the lack of adequate adult supervision of children during the critical hours of 3:00 pm-6:00pm, serving over 28,000 children at 195 of the most vulnerable elementary schools in the Los Angeles area daily.
www.lasbest.org ,

 Salvation Army an astronomical organization that clothes, feeds, and cares for families of broken homes and broken lives everywhere! Salvation Army operates 7,546 centers in communities across The United States. These efforts include food distribution, disaster relief, rehabilitation centers, anti-human trafficking efforts, and a wealth of children's programs.
www.salvationarmyusa.org , 

 St. Jude-  A phenomenal organization that treats children battling cancer and gives their families the most comforting and nurturingly supportive services during their traumatic conquest's for the lives of their children, without  asking nothing in return. 
www.stjude.org        
"Just Be Brave" allows Lazaro to take the vehicle of music and have a private party with the people he loves so much! From his edgy ballads, to his infectious dance tunes, right on down to his romanticizing cuban pop tracks , that he says," Let's music paint the answers to the questions we think but rarely ask!" So" Let's "Be Brave and Let's Be Love", all over the world, collaborating our minds and hearts in the conversation this album can't wait to tell!

It is his desire to contribute 20% of the proceeds of this album to the following four charities...          "Feeding Children Everywhere"-  An awesome organization founded by Don and Kristen Campbell that has supplied over 20 million meals to hungry and disadvantaged children all over the world!www.feeedingchildreneverywhere.comL.A's Best - An organization created in 1988 by "The Late Mayor Tom Bradley" to address an alarming rise in the lack of adequate adult supervision of children during the critical hours of 3:00 pm-6:00pm, serving over 28,000 children at 195 of the most vulnerable elementary schools in the Los Angeles area daily.
www.lasbest.org , Salvation Army an astronomical organization that clothes, feeds, and cares for families of broken homes and broken lives everywhere! Salvation Army operates 7,546 centers in communities across The United States. These efforts include food distribution, disaster relief, rehabilitation centers, anti-human trafficking efforts, and a wealth of children's programs.
www.salvationarmyusa.org ,  St. Jude-  A phenomenal organization that treats children battling cancer and gives their families the most comforting and nurturingly supportive services during their traumatic conquest's for the lives of their children, without  asking nothing in return. 
www.stjude.org        "Just Be Brave" allows Lazaro to take the vehicle of music and have a private party with the people he loves so much! From his edgy ballads, to his infectious dance tunes, right on down to his romanticizing cuban pop tracks , that he says," Let's music paint the answers to the questions we think but rarely ask!" So" Let's "Be Brave and Let's Be Love", all over the world, collaborating our minds and hearts in the conversation this album can't wait to tell!

story:
Corner Indie Fest is an event held in April, created to give talented University of Virginia student performers as well as local and traveling bands the opportunity to showcase their music. It's a band night experience organized purely for the love of music! Corner Indie Fest takes will take place on the University of Virginia's historic Corner.

Corner Indie Fest was created by two undergraduate music students, Olivia Bona  and Joanna Spotswood, with the help of Unresume, a start-up group part of HackCville-- a clubhouse for student "ruckus makers." Together, they plan to make it an annual event that will grow each year and hope to leave it as their legacy at UVa. 

The idea began in April 2013 over coffee  after a networking luncheon. Jo had always wanted to make a music festival, so she sought out fellow music major, Olivia, for help. Now, Jo and Olivia have interns to help plan the festival. Corner Indie Fest has really taken off!

With contributions, Jo and Olivia will be able to rent an open, out-door space on UVa's Corner, hire security and sound runners for the event, and pay the talented musicians more than just donations from concert-goers. This will incentivize more talented bands and performers to travel to Charlottesville for CIF.

Corner Indie Fest is for the love of music!

It is for that part in all of us that wants to hear something different.

It is for experiencing, exploring, and sharing.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's where the money will go:

  • about $1000 for the venue
  • $100 for security staff 
  • $100 for sound runners
  • $250 for each band or performer 
  • at least $250 for swag and merchandise
  • If we don't reach our maximum goal, the money will first go to renting the venue, then to paying the artists! 
You'll get:
  • stickers
  • tank tops
  • CDs
  • and much, much more! 

The Impact

Our campaign is valuable, and here's why your contribution will make an impact: 

  • Student performers are able to perform for a large and excited audience
  • Artists are able to collaborate across genres 
  • Music lovers from across the city and the University are able to celebrate talented performers and the love of music

Other Ways You Can Help 

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Make some noise about our campaign! If you love music, tell your friends! If you hate music, tell your enemies! 
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Read More About Corner Indie Fest

http://indieu.com/meet-joanna-spotswood-and-olivia-bona-co-creators-of-uvas-corner-indie-fest/

http://www.cavalierdaily.com/article/2014/04/in...

story:
What’s this all about? Wizard Sex? What the hell is that?

 

THE WIZARD TALK

We are a band of three very independent, unique individuals. Creating music and impacting the universe is what we major in:

Dmitry Wild – Guitar Player / Vox

Hayes Thunderfoot – Drums

LASE – Bass Player.
 


OUR GOALS

We are finishing the mixes for our new FULL LENGTH record, and to move forward we want to achieve the following 2 goals:

1). MUSIC VIDEO

Currently we need to record a video for one of our songs. We can keep expenses to the very minimum, but directors still need to rent the equipment, we can’t get away from that. We don’t want to do an iPhone video, since the concept and aesthetics  we are going for, would be limited; lets raise the money to get this done.

We project that we will need $1000. 

2). FULL LENGTH RECORD

We are big propagators of Vinyl. We feel that when someone holds and listens to vinyl nothing can replace that feeling in our digitally driven world.

We want to get our music to the people
the RIGHT WAY – the POWERFUL WAY.


EVERYONE THAT PLEDGES GETS AN IMMEDIATE
FREE DOWNLOAD of OUR BEST SONG:  WITCH & WIZARD

PERKS

1). $5 -  you get a digital download of our new single. 


2). $10 – you get a digital download of our new LP record. 



3). $25 – you get a digital download of our new LP record  + signed vinyl in the mail  + T-shirt in the mail .

4). $50 – you get a digital download of our new LP record + signed vinyl in the mail + tshirt + hand written lyrics to your favorite song by Dmitry Wild.

 

+ HAND WRITTEN LYRICS

5). $100 – you get a digital download + signed vinyl in the mail  + T-shirt in the mail + video of us thanking you. 

 

+ THANK YOU VIDEO

6). $250 – Digital Download + Signed Vinyl + T-shirt in the mail  + your favorite song hand written lyrics + video of us thanking you + name on the credits of the album  

 

+ THANK YOU VIDEO

+ HAND WRITTEN LYRICS

+ YOUR NAME ON OUR VINYL


7). $500 – Digital Download + Signed vinyl in the mail + your favorite song hand written – name on the credits of the album + we are going to dedicate a song to you during our live performance and you can jump on stage with us and sing out loud LIVE!!!!

 

+ THANK YOU VIDEO

+ HAND WRITTEN LYRICS

+ YOUR NAME ON OUR VINYL

+ YOU GET A PERSONAL ACOUSTIC PERFORMANCE (Or Electric If Possible) at YOUR LOCATION / HOUSE 

If we don’t reach our indiegogo goal, we are still doing what we have been doing, which is funding ourselves the way we were. It will just take longer.


The PLAN

Everything we do, we do - 150%. Everyone is commited. We love our family, fans and friends and we all love and respect them for putting up with us, but our music and our art is that strong element in our lives that we strive to bring to people. We believe that our message is important and powerful.

Having the right funding we will move quickly and efficiently. Wizard Sex is known for launching projects, efficiently and on time.


Risks & Challenges

For the most part we are self-sufficient band!

LASE - mixes/produces the record aside from playing bass.

Josh - takes care of the marketing and the promotion in the band.  

Dmitry -  reigns on the creative side and business aspects of the band.

All 3 of us know what responsibility is and how to get projects done. We just need the right funding to keep moving forward and delivering our art and energy to the people.

Challenges are facts that escape our control.

For example, the video person takes way longer to edit the footage.

Really all that’s needed is to stay on top of the plan and do the things that we set out to achieve.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, no sweat. We thank you for being here and reading this far. The best thing you can do is to share our campaign and like our band on social medias and stay in touch and just come out to our live show and introduce yourself. We love to meet new people.

PEACE!!! 

May the power of Wisdom and Rock be with you!!!  

The journey through life is not a straight line, it’s a journey through day and night.

story: Hi, I'm Adam Moyer.  I'm a fingerstyle guitarist about ready to record my first album.  I'm raising funds to help get my guitars "studio ready".  (Both are American made Breedlove Pro Series, one has a Sitka Spruce top, one is Red Ceder.  They both need refretting and some regular maintenance.)  I am also raising funds to help offset the cost of some of the studio time.  Any help would be greatly appreciated.  I have already recorded a Promotional CD and will be sending to Patrons as a "Thank You" for helping out.

story:
New recording of world music to be produced by John Wubbenhorst and "Facing East"

 Over the years, we've been playing music that is deeply influenced by the classical music from India and modern jazz concepts that we have called "Facing East". We feel that this kind of cooperative world music is especially important in this divisive time. This collection is from a group of musicians from very different parts of the world coming together expressing our common spiritual ecstasy in sound. It has been over a decade since we have recorded new material for this format and from playing  the music live, we feel it is ready to go. The music features the bansuri (North Indian Bamboo Flute) along with bass, percussion and keyboards. We plan on several guests on vocals and other instruments. Already we are fortunate to have had Mahesh Vinayakram share his vocals on one track and are planning on inviting other guests as soon as we can fund. Local bay area musicians Eric "Doc" Smith on percussion and keyboardist Steve McQuarry are lending their support and Jason Everett on the 7 string fretless bass is working hard with us from his Seattle area location.

Recording engineer Andrew Scott is helping record the project from his SF studio and we are very happy with his sensitivity to the music. We have started recording already, but need funds to continue. For this recording we are featuring vocals much more than previous recordings and hope to have several guests for that. We are hoping to bring in people like Paul McCandless (woodwinds) as a guests, stay tuned to see how it unfolds! We estimate about $11,000 for studio time, musicians, mixing and mastering. Cover art and design around $1,200. Manufacturing of the actual CDs about $6500. Promotion assistance $2,000 (press release, radio promotion). Music video production (these days video is critical to promotion) around $2,000. It is quite a project to do this work but if 1580 people pre-order the $15 full download, then we are done!

We do not really like being political, but at this time with so much division, we feel this type of musical statement is important. With the current administration wanting to eliminate the National Endowment for the Arts, we feel this type of thinking needs to be challenged. Part of the reason that Indian music developed to such a refined degree is that many musicians were supported by the rulers of that time. They realized that the deep spiritual values of music were good for everyone. In 1963 the US state department sent Duke Ellington to the middle east. Duke was sent there by the State Department to spread America's message of democracy and brotherhood to the rest of the world, So we appreciate all supporters of this and other projects that bring out the universal beauty that can be conveyed in music. We will continue to speak out about how we can demonstrate non-violent cooperation and tolerance with music as an example.

story:
Singer/Songwriter from Birmingham UK has been chosen to perform on an American TV show in New York on April 30th to sing songs from his forthcoming crowd funded album.

Spence  Cater, 44, from Birmingham, was personally invited by the show’s presenter and executive producer Jimmy Lloyd to the next recording of the show in the Soho area of New York.

They initially met in 2013 at a recording of a UK episode of the show and have since co-written several songs together.

Jimmy comments,'Spence is a supremely accomplished songwriter, his songs are very believable, any listener can relate to them.'

Spence who started busking 3 years ago, has so far played in London, New York, across Belgium and recently played a sold out show in San Francisco.

Spence is about to record his first album with top producer and musician Michael Clarke who recently featured in last years comedy ‘On the Road’ starring Ricky Gervais’s alter ego David Brent, as a member of his band Foregone Conclusion.

Spence says, ‘This to play on this show is a huge opportunity for me as Jimmy only selects songwriters of a high calibre, to even be invited to play is a real honour.

About Spence.

Singer/Songwriter Spence estimates that he has played to over 1 million people since he started busking in 2014.

His recorded music has also been heard by over a million people a year as it’s played across stores in Europe.

The opportunity to promote his songs on the Jimmy Lloyd show is a promotional package that can't really be bought off the shelf, it is only by invitation. This will go a long way help to raise awareness of his forthcoming album.

All this is in your hands as potential investors, could you help Spence make the most of this golden opportunity? 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get.

OK, so let me be clear about this as there are two projects rolled into one campaign.

The priority here is to record my album, which will cost £2640.

That breaks down as £2000 for the studio time (14-15 days approx.)

PLUS £400 for CD manufacturing (first run of 300)

PLUS £240 for Indiegogo and paypal fees which are 10% approx.

Michael Clarke, the producer has very kindly agreed to take on this project at a special rate.

His services are very much in demand and his skill and talent will be a huge factor in making this a great record.

This means that any money up to and including the target will be used solely for recording the album. You will be funding the Album project only and NOT the trip to New York if you choose to BACK IT.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

So, that means any extra that I make after the £2460 has been reached will be towards my trip to New York. 

Here are the approximate extra costs that I will spend any excess on:

£600 will be on the New York trip, the accommodation and expenses.

£500 will be for the video production and design costs*

*Dominic Day produced the promotional video for me and I think he's done a terrific job on it. He brings a lot of energy focus, creativity and skill to any project and his dedication and professionalism is unquestionable. He offered to do this completely free and so I would dearly love to be able to pay him for his time. 

If I am lucky enough to exceed the goal and cover the costs above then any more extra will go into making the record better, extra time mixing, mastering, better quality manufacturing, promotional costs, etc.

I will be using live streaming to capture the studio process as well so you can be a part of it and see how the songs are developing.

I hope that is clear to you as a potential investor!

There are some great perks to be had.

You could jump straight in and fund the whole album which will effectively make you the executive producer where you will have a say in how the album plays, the look and design and even get a writing credit on one of the songs!

You could even pay to come along and experience the behind the scenes of the TV recording in New York. Meet the presenter and the other performers then hang out afterwards.

You can also get a song written and recorded for you personally, just give some information about you or your loved one and I will write and record your very own song and add the option of recording it on to vinyl, your very own record!

If I am unlucky enough to reach my goal then the project will still go ahead as much as the budget allows, so instead of a 10-11 track album it would be a 5-6 track EP for example, everyone involved will just get a smaller fee and the project will take a lot longer, thus losing out on some momentum. 

The Impact

This is my very first studio album and has all my life experience up to now in it.

I really want to leave a legacy of my music for my daughter, so she can have something that I have created just for her, her arrival changed my life in many ways and I would love to leave her this gift, that's if I never get to make another album.

As a Singer/Songwriter this album will be my calling card and allow me to access the next level of my career, getting airplay, support slots and planning a tour will all be more possible with a strong album to promote and sell,  the profits getting reinvested back in to recording more tracks and albums and supporting promotional costs.

Being invited to feature on the Jimmy Lloyd Songwriters showcase is a really huge bonus opportunity for me.

Jimmy has his pick of the best emerging songwriters in New York and LA and so isn't into giving favours, he has a reputation to maintain and his show has high  production and content values which is why it has been taken up by NBC, Apple TV and now Amazon TV, they only accept high quality productions. Needless to say this kind of exposure to a potentially huge audience will help to raise my profile and help to secure more airplay and gigs both here and in the US.

This chance to play on the show, plus having a new album to promote at the same time is a terrific way of capturing the momentum and taking advantage of the opportunities that arise during this time.

Promotion of this type is priceless and would go a long way to getting my songs out to the biggest possible audience and hopefully create more interest in the album.

These songs are the story of my life so far and include themes of addiction, recovery, broken relationships and death. If one song helps one person through a dark time then it will be worthwhile because music has certainly saved my life. 

I have recorded many tracks before in many different studios and many different producers, I am very experienced in starting and finishing recording projects.

The last track I recorded was with Michael whom I have chosen again to work with as he is such an incredibly talented producer, musician, singer and genuinely lovely guy, a real safe pair of hands. Plus he is very local to me so it maximizes the time in the studio cuts down on travel costs.

Risks & Challenges

The challenges that face me during this project are lack of funding and blocking out the time to record the album. The lack of funding issue will be solved by tailoring the project to the budget so just recording fewer songs as well as actively looking for more sponsorship and support, in order to make the record that I want to give to you.

I am aiming to block out 10  consecutive days to record the album so I can get it done in one flow but that may not be possible due to having work commitments, but the aim is to get the album done swiftly but not rushing, so it get's to your ears as soon as possible.

The more support I can get to finance the record and the trip then the sooner it can be produced and be out there for your guys to listen to.

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally get that you might want to help but can't contribute financially, that's OK, if you were to share this campaign to your friends and family then that will be a very kind act that may help me reach my target and to take advantage of this unique opportunity.

Indiegogo have some great tools for sharing on your platforms so go-go crazy!
