Jimmy comments,'Spence is a supremely accomplished songwriter, his songs are very believable, any listener can relate to them.'
Spence who started busking 3 years ago, has so far played in London, New York, across Belgium and recently played a sold out show in San Francisco.
Spence is about to record his first album with top producer and musician Michael Clarke who recently featured in last years comedy ‘On the Road’ starring Ricky Gervais’s alter ego David Brent, as a member of his band Foregone Conclusion.
Spence says, ‘This to play on this show is a huge opportunity for me as Jimmy only selects songwriters of a high calibre, to even be invited to play is a real honour.
About Spence.
Singer/Songwriter Spence estimates that he has played to over 1 million people since he started busking in 2014.
His recorded music has also been heard by over a million people a year as it’s played across stores in Europe.
The opportunity to promote his songs on the Jimmy Lloyd show is a promotional package that can't really be bought off the shelf, it is only by invitation. This will go a long way help to raise awareness of his forthcoming album.
All this is in your hands as potential investors, could you help Spence make the most of this golden opportunity? 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get.
OK, so let me be clear about this as there are two projects rolled into one campaign.
The priority here is to record my album, which will cost £2640.
That breaks down as £2000 for the studio time (14-15 days approx.)
PLUS £400 for CD manufacturing (first run of 300)
PLUS £240 for Indiegogo and paypal fees which are 10% approx.
Michael Clarke, the producer has very kindly agreed to take on this project at a special rate.
His services are very much in demand and his skill and talent will be a huge factor in making this a great record.
This means that any money up to and including the target will be used solely for recording the album. You will be funding the Album project only and NOT the trip to New York if you choose to BACK IT.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
So, that means any extra that I make after the £2460 has been reached will be towards my trip to New York. 
Here are the approximate extra costs that I will spend any excess on:
£600 will be on the New York trip, the accommodation and expenses.
£500 will be for the video production and design costs*
*Dominic Day produced the promotional video for me and I think he's done a terrific job on it. He brings a lot of energy focus, creativity and skill to any project and his dedication and professionalism is unquestionable. He offered to do this completely free and so I would dearly love to be able to pay him for his time. 
If I am lucky enough to exceed the goal and cover the costs above then any more extra will go into making the record better, extra time mixing, mastering, better quality manufacturing, promotional costs, etc.
I will be using live streaming to capture the studio process as well so you can be a part of it and see how the songs are developing.
I hope that is clear to you as a potential investor!
There are some great perks to be had.
You could jump straight in and fund the whole album which will effectively make you the executive producer where you will have a say in how the album plays, the look and design and even get a writing credit on one of the songs!
You could even pay to come along and experience the behind the scenes of the TV recording in New York. Meet the presenter and the other performers then hang out afterwards.
You can also get a song written and recorded for you personally, just give some information about you or your loved one and I will write and record your very own song and add the option of recording it on to vinyl, your very own record!
If I am unlucky enough to reach my goal then the project will still go ahead as much as the budget allows, so instead of a 10-11 track album it would be a 5-6 track EP for example, everyone involved will just get a smaller fee and the project will take a lot longer, thus losing out on some momentum. 

The Impact
This is my very first studio album and has all my life experience up to now in it.
I really want to leave a legacy of my music for my daughter, so she can have something that I have created just for her, her arrival changed my life in many ways and I would love to leave her this gift, that's if I never get to make another album.
As a Singer/Songwriter this album will be my calling card and allow me to access the next level of my career, getting airplay, support slots and planning a tour will all be more possible with a strong album to promote and sell,  the profits getting reinvested back in to recording more tracks and albums and supporting promotional costs.
Being invited to feature on the Jimmy Lloyd Songwriters showcase is a really huge bonus opportunity for me.
Jimmy has his pick of the best emerging songwriters in New York and LA and so isn't into giving favours, he has a reputation to maintain and his show has high  production and content values which is why it has been taken up by NBC, Apple TV and now Amazon TV, they only accept high quality productions. Needless to say this kind of exposure to a potentially huge audience will help to raise my profile and help to secure more airplay and gigs both here and in the US.
This chance to play on the show, plus having a new album to promote at the same time is a terrific way of capturing the momentum and taking advantage of the opportunities that arise during this time. 
Promotion of this type is priceless and would go a long way to getting my songs out to the biggest possible audience and hopefully create more interest in the album.
These songs are the story of my life so far and include themes of addiction, recovery, broken relationships and death. If one song helps one person through a dark time then it will be worthwhile because music has certainly saved my life. 
I have recorded many tracks before in many different studios and many different producers, I am very experienced in starting and finishing recording projects.
The last track I recorded was with Michael whom I have chosen again to work with as he is such an incredibly talented producer, musician, singer and genuinely lovely guy, a real safe pair of hands. Plus he is very local to me so it maximizes the time in the studio cuts down on travel costs.

Risks & Challenges
The challenges that face me during this project are lack of funding and blocking out the time to record the album. The lack of funding issue will be solved by tailoring the project to the budget so just recording fewer songs as well as actively looking for more sponsorship and support, in order to make the record that I want to give to you.
I am aiming to block out 10  consecutive days to record the album so I can get it done in one flow but that may not be possible due to having work commitments, but the aim is to get the album done swiftly but not rushing, so it get's to your ears as soon as possible.
The more support I can get to finance the record and the trip then the sooner it can be produced and be out there for your guys to listen to.

Other Ways You Can Help
I totally get that you might want to help but can't contribute financially, that's OK, if you were to share this campaign to your friends and family then that will be a very kind act that may help me reach my target and to take advantage of this unique opportunity.
Indiegogo have some great tools for sharing on your platforms so go-go crazy!

story:
Short Summary of Rather Be

  • Laramie is a captivating indie rock band with roots in Memphis, Tennessee. The group is a diverse combination of multi-talented musicians and writers guided by lead singer and songwriter, Laramie Renae. Rather than being hindered by a challenge, Laramie turns diversity into one of their strongest qualities and uses it as a tool to write dynamic works of art. Band members are given the freedom to express their individual creativity and craft while staying true to the group’s underlying message and overall sound. With each song, Laramie aims to leave a lasting impression and to draw the listener in for a ride that promises to be haunting, raw, and transparent.
  • This is the first full-length album that Laramie will have produced. In order to create the best representation of each song, funds are required. Laramie strives to use the best of the best, as best they can to allow each song to come alive. There are worlds within songs, so we need as much support as we can get!
  • Achieving the sound that we hear with this album will be the greatest gift that comes with your donation to the project. Allowing as many people as possible to be a part of making this album successful is what will really launch the album to greatness. Without you, without your love and support, the album will not be all that it can be. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $12,000. This is a very ambitious amount, but we trust that those who believe in our music will be drawn to the project and help us get the album underway! The funds will go towards production, manufacturing, graphic design, mixing and mastering, and promotion of the album. 
  • The perks are awesome! The incentives for this album will include: A pre-release of the album, a download of the leading single, merchandise (such as shirts, stickers, posters, etc.), the Laramie discography, house shows, and a personal song written uniquely for you!
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds we do receive will go towards studio time and production, as well as mixing and mastering. We still want the music to be heard!

The Impact

  • These songs represent raw, transparent, honest and wild feeling. As we have said before, there are worlds within these songs and we want you to be able to be a part of each unique experience. 
  • For our first EP, The Good Men, we successfully raised more than our goal, which was significantly less than what we are raising for this album. Regardless, we know that we can do it with your help and financial support. Nothing is impossible, we are sure of that. 
  • We are genuinely, so, so excited for you to hear these songs, stories and snapshots. We want you to be able to step inside each song whenever you want to and experience each journey on your own. Music is a universal language and we want to translate ours. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Our support and fan base has grown since the last time we did this! But, this also means that there is a greater responsibility for us to produce music that is timeless and valuable. 
  • If we do not raise the funds, we will do what we can with what we have. If we are only able to produce a small number of songs, we will make sure that each song receives the same effort it would if we met our goal. 
  • The risk with this campaign is not making it. If we don't reach our goal, our vision won't be completed...but...we've never been hindered by a couple of challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't contribute, you can still be a part of making this successful! We need street teams, campaign ambassadors, lovers of music. 
  • PLEASE like, share, spread the word, tell your friends...then repeat!

And that's all there is to it! Let's bring these songs to life.

story:
APELO // A DRAC PRECISA DA TUA AJUDA

Depois de nove anos a transformar um antigo armazém de peixe numa fortaleza do rock, de forma autónoma e independente, a tua associação carece agora da tua ajuda monetária.

Para que não fiquemos sem electricidade, seremos forçados a instalar um novo sistema eléctrico que incluirá a montagem de postes, quadros, e de toda a cablagem adjacente. Esta obra é de urgência máxima e está orçamentada em 3600€, montante que a associação e os membros que mais sacrificam pela mesma não conseguem suportar.

Apesar de já contarmos com o apoio de inúmeros sócios e 'adeptos', a questão hoje não se coloca em melhorar as condições do espaço, mas sim, em SOBREVIVER.

Desta feita, se não contarmos com a contribuição de todos, por mínima que seja, a electricidade não será a única luz a extinguir-se neste espaço..

Pensa no que a DRAC vale para ti e ajuda com o que puderes.

Obrigado!

 

#WEAREDRAC

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit this page and check out my campaign. I know most of you will be here because you already know me in some capacity, but in case you don't...

Previous Form...

"Having risen to prominence in the early nineties as guitar player in the trail-blazing blues band , THE HOAX, Jon Amor has gone on to establish himself as a talented singer and songwriter in his own right. With his band AMOR, he released two influential albums in 2001 and 2002 that gave British blues rock a much-needed shot in the arm.

Jon disbanded AMOR in 2005 to write “Unknown Soldier”, produced by Stephen Evans (Robert Plant, Goldfrapp, The Proclaimers, Thea Gilmore), an album endorsed by an outstanding guest appearance from the legendary Robert Plant on ‘Ball & Chain’, and featuring drummer Clive Deamer of Portishead and Radiohead fame.

Jon followed this with the more stripped-down acoustic studio album, “Stories From The Crooked Room”, which features a collection of finely crafted songs with Dave Doherty on guitar, Chris Doherty on bass and Simon Small on drums.  This quartet then formed JON AMOR BLUES GROUP, a high energy, dynamic blues rock outfit that toured Europe extensively and produced two highly acclaimed studio albums between 2011 and 2013.

The reformation of The Hoax then brought two new albums to a grateful audience: 2013's "Big City Blues", a collection of originals written and recorded in California, and 2014's "Recession Blues: A Tribute To BB King".

Jon continues to tour extensively around the UK and Europe and will return to the studio in 2017 for a new album of self-penned material."

The Plan...

With most of the album now written, I'm preparing to go into the studio this summer to record these brand new baby songs and then set them loose in the world. I'm very excited to be working with Stephen Evans, a long-time friend and a producer with whom I've enjoyed a fruitful working relationship. I'm also hoping to persuade some of my fine musician friends to come along and play a turn on the record.

The aim, with the help of you good people, is to raise £10,000 through this campaign. This will cover:

  • Studio time
  • Production costs (recording, mixing and mastering)
  • Pressing, printing and design costs
  • .....and hopefully a small slice to give it a bit of promo

You can help me get there by simply pre-ordering the album in its various formats (all of which will be signed, but don't forget 'the unsigned ones are rarer'....)

Or you can browse the list of additional perks, on the right of your screen, which include all sorts of offers, from simple packages, credits on the album artwork, a day in the studio seeing it all go down, to watching me play a solo set in my very own living room (drinks and nibbles supplied). You can even pay for me to bring a band to YOUR living room to do a gig.

And, I'm offering the one and only notebook that I've been exclusively using to scribble down lyrics and ideas. One of a kind, and still not fully finished.

You'll receive your copies of the album ahead of the official release date, of course.

It's been a while since I've had the opportunity to make a new album of my own songs in my own name, and I'm raring to go. If you guys can help me do it by making a pledge, I'll be your friend forever.

 

...but if you can't....

Times are hard, and sometimes it's just not financially doable, but you can still help by sharing this page with people you think may be up for it. Indiegogo provide simple tools for doing that.

Thanks in advance,
Jon

story:
My dream is to see uplifting, heart opening, chant and meditation music become mainstream… Beautiful soul-full music that fills the airwaves and  our hearts with Love, Compassion, Kindness and Peace.

Sounds good doesn’t it.  I am calling for help from all of my friends to birth "Peace Within, Peace on Earth"….  My latest album.

As some of you may know, I have been busily and lovingly recording my latest album. The last time I was involved with an impromptu crowd funding I recorded "Affirmation Chants Sung by Kath and  Ini", with Kath in 1985.

This album, “Peace Within, Peace on Earth", is an uplifting, spirit filled, deeply nourishing, chant meditation album.

It is designed to be a musical, spiritual journey with the goal of encouraging us to feel, and have, “Peace Within, Peace on Earth”. 

Each chant progressively frees and opens our energy centres on the path to peace within. 

This campaign is to help fund the cost of recording and printing the CD.

By pre-purchasing this album you will help me to raise the funds I need to complete the final stage of production.

For your love , encouragement and donation, you will receive a signed, lovingly energised, copy of this uplifting transformational chant  meditation CD.

This CD is as unique and as powerful as the much loved "Affirmation Chants Sung by Kath and Ini".  

In September this year I plan to start  on my next album of Affirmations. Not only is this my life work but it is a much needed resource for our planet, and for those of us who want to love, protect and heal Her and ourselves.

I would love, and be honoured  to come and facilitate Sonic Healing workshop and Chant Meditations in your communities.

Please let all your friends know about this campaign ……thankyou…every little bit helps.

You can do this by using the. Indiegogo share tools.

Much love and blessings to you all. 

Ini

May we find Peace Within and create Peace on Earth.

story:
My Story, My Vision

Hi! For those of you who don't know me, my name is Dave Mallen, and I’m an independent musician living in the Washington, DC area. In 2006, I founded Innovation Station Music, a professional recording studio uniquely focused on artist development and helping musicians to be successful in their careers.

Working out of my home, I've been able to foster a comfortable, collaborative environment where musicians feel free to express themselves and explore their full potential. I'm proud to have produced over 200 artists and bands from the DC area and beyond, as well as numerous award-winning songs.

Now, after a decade of making music in a small townhouse basement, I’m excited to be building the studio of my dreams: a state-of-the-art, multi-room facility that will provide even greater benefits for musicians from the DC area and beyond!

What exactly are those benefits, you ask? 

Well, if you're a musician, you'll appreciate the sweet-sounding, fully soundproof rooms, pristine audio, relaxed vibe, and opportunities to collaborate and network with other artists and music industry professionals. If you're a music supporter, I want to welcome you into the world of music creation. When completed, Innovation Station Music "2.0" will be the only area studio specifically designed to allow YOU to engage with musicians and the creative process through a fantastic series of events. Pretty cool!

As you might expect, a project of this magnitude requires a significant investment. Construction is already underway, but we've been hit with some unexpected costs. That's why I’m asking for your help in getting this project across the finish line. Your support will allow me to purchase audio equipment I need to make truly incredible-sounding recordings and empower our local music community for years to come.

Would you like more details? Yes?  Great! Please read on.

Project Details & What I Need

For the past year, I’ve been working with renowned studio architect Wes Lachot to design a world-class studio in the basement of my new home in Annandale, VA.

The amount of detail that has gone into the planning of this new studio is staggering. From the 4-zone, quiet-operation HVAC system designed to make every room comfortable with no audible noise, to the structural redesign needed to remove columns and afford more space to musicians, to the Philips Hue LED lighting system in which each individual bulb can be adjusted to set the right mood -- every aspect of the design has been thoughtfully considered to ensure musicians have the space, comfort, and tools they need to create and communicate freely.

When I first contacted my designer, I must admit I had a bit of sticker shock. He told me I'd need to budget $175/sq. ft., which would mean roughly $200,000 for the construction alone! After a lot of soul-searching, I decided I was all-in. My wife Emily and I put a huge chunk of our life savings into escrow, secured a bank loan, and got some additional help from our families. We hired several contractors, and were off to the races!

Well, not exactly. As we neared construction, we were faced with the reality that some of the cost projections provided by our contractors were seriously underestimated.

Now, rest assured, this thing is getting built! But I need to raise at least $25,000 so I can afford to purchase and provide the very best audio equipment for my artists on day one. By contributing to my Indiegogo campaign, you'll not only be helping me make up the difference, you'll be MAKING A DIFFERENCE -- in my life and the lives of so many in our music community.

Here's What's In It For You

At first, I was reluctant to ask for help. I've always relied on my own resourcefulness and resolve to work through life's challenges. But the more I thought about crowdfunding, the more I realized how many amazing rewards and unique experiences I could offer all those who contribute!

Our complete list of "Perks" is over on the right (with more TBA!), but let me highlight just a few:

  • Music and Merch: "Dave's Faves" 20-song sampler featuring tracks I've produced and engineered over the past 10 years, CDs donated by award-winning singer/songwriter Talia Segal, Limited Edition Innovation Station Music supporter T-shirts
  • In the Studio: "Legends & Locals" Listening Parties, Songwriting and Guitar Master Classes, "Be an Executive Producer" experiences, VIP Concerts with our artists, plus Studio Tours
  • Other Cool Experiences: Wine Tasting/Music Pairing with international wine expert Sonja Eberly, a semi-formal "Backers' Ball", Pizza with Dave, DeLorean rides(!!)...and more to be announced throughout the campaign.

As you can see, we have some incredible stuff to offer you! And hey, if you're interested in more than one perk, you can check out as many times as you like (you'll just need to make separate transactions for each one). I think there's something for everyone, but you can also simply donate by clicking the BACK IT button at the top of the page. No matter how you choose to participate, you'll have my sincere thanks, and the knowledge that you're helping me make my dream a reality -- and in turn, fueling my efforts to support the music community around me.

(Dave & Emily hosting one of their house concerts w/Kipyn Martin and GOODING)

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you're able to contribute, I humbly ask you to please share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested. Emailing the link (www.supportdavesstudio.com) to your friends and family is great, and Indiegogo has conveniently provided tools to make it easy to share on social media.

I'm so grateful to have your support, and look forward to updating you on construction progress and seeing you in the finished studio in Spring 2017!

Cheers!

-Dave
story_txt:
My Story, My Vision
Hi! For those of you who don't know me, my name is Dave Mallen, and I’m an independent musician living in the Washington, DC area. In 2006, I founded Innovation Station Music, a professional recording studio uniquely focused on artist development and helping musicians to be successful in their careers.
Working out of my home, I've been able to foster a comfortable, collaborative environment where musicians feel free to express themselves and explore their full potential. I'm proud to have produced over 200 artists and bands from the DC area and beyond, as well as numerous award-winning songs.
Now, after a decade of making music in a small townhouse basement, I’m excited to be building the studio of my dreams: a state-of-the-art, multi-room facility that will provide even greater benefits for musicians from the DC area and beyond!
 
What exactly are those benefits, you ask?  
Well, if you're a musician, you'll appreciate the sweet-sounding, fully soundproof rooms, pristine audio, relaxed vibe, and opportunities to collaborate and network with other artists and music industry professionals. If you're a music supporter, I want to welcome you into the world of music creation. When completed, Innovation Station Music "2.0" will be the only area studio specifically designed to allow YOU to engage with musicians and the creative process through a fantastic series of events. Pretty cool!
As you might expect, a project of this magnitude requires a significant investment. Construction is already underway, but we've been hit with some unexpected costs. That's why I’m asking for your help in getting this project across the finish line. Your support will allow me to purchase audio equipment I need to make truly incredible-sounding recordings and empower our local music community for years to come.
Would you like more details? Yes?  Great! Please read on.

Project Details & What I Need
For the past year, I’ve been working with renowned studio architect Wes Lachot to design a world-class studio in the basement of my new home in Annandale, VA.
The amount of detail that has gone into the planning of this new studio is staggering. From the 4-zone, quiet-operation HVAC system designed to make every room comfortable with no audible noise, to the structural redesign needed to remove columns and afford more space to musicians, to the Philips Hue LED lighting system in which each individual bulb can be adjusted to set the right mood -- every aspect of the design has been thoughtfully considered to ensure musicians have the space, comfort, and tools they need to create and communicate freely.

When I first contacted my designer, I must admit I had a bit of sticker shock. He told me I'd need to budget $175/sq. ft., which would mean roughly $200,000 for the construction alone! After a lot of soul-searching, I decided I was all-in. My wife Emily and I put a huge chunk of our life savings into escrow, secured a bank loan, and got some additional help from our families. We hired several contractors, and were off to the races!
Well, not exactly. As we neared construction, we were faced with the reality that some of the cost projections provided by our contractors were seriously underestimated.
Now, rest assured, this thing is getting built! But I need to raise at least $25,000 so I can afford to purchase and provide the very best audio equipment for my artists on day one. By contributing to my Indiegogo campaign, you'll not only be helping me make up the difference, you'll be MAKING A DIFFERENCE -- in my life and the lives of so many in our music community.

Here's What's In It For You
At first, I was reluctant to ask for help. I've always relied on my own resourcefulness and resolve to work through life's challenges. But the more I thought about crowdfunding, the more I realized how many amazing rewards and unique experiences I could offer all those who contribute!
Our complete list of "Perks" is over on the right (with more TBA!), but let me highlight just a few:


Music and Merch: "Dave's Faves" 20-song sampler featuring tracks I've produced and engineered over the past 10 years, CDs donated by award-winning singer/songwriter Talia Segal, Limited Edition Innovation Station Music supporter T-shirts

In the Studio: "Legends & Locals" Listening Parties, Songwriting and Guitar Master Classes, "Be an Executive Producer" experiences, VIP Concerts with our artists, plus Studio Tours

Other Cool Experiences: Wine Tasting/Music Pairing with international wine expert Sonja Eberly, a semi-formal "Backers' Ball", Pizza with Dave, DeLorean rides(!!)...and more to be announced throughout the campaign.


As you can see, we have some incredible stuff to offer you! And hey, if you're interested in more than one perk, you can check out as many times as you like (you'll just need to make separate transactions for each one). I think there's something for everyone, but you can also simply donate by clicking the BACK IT button at the top of the page. No matter how you choose to participate, you'll have my sincere thanks, and the knowledge that you're helping me make my dream a reality -- and in turn, fueling my efforts to support the music community around me.

(Dave & Emily hosting one of their house concerts w/Kipyn Martin and GOODING)

Other Ways You Can Help
Whether or not you're able to contribute, I humbly ask you to please share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested. Emailing the link (www.supportdavesstudio.com) to your friends and family is great, and Indiegogo has conveniently provided tools to make it easy to share on social media.
I'm so grateful to have your support, and look forward to updating you on construction progress and seeing you in the finished studio in Spring 2017!Cheers!-Dave

story:
• My name is Dani Shain. I was born in JHB South Africa, and have been living in Israel for the last 11 years. I have been singing since I was 3. My passion is creating meaningful music that brings hope, comfort and joy, to all people, no matter their background.
  • This campaign will enable me to independently create my art, will all the artistic freedom needed to ensure it stays pure in every way.
  • Contributors will help me create and release meaningful and hopeful music, that resonates with feelings of love, hope, and oneness, to the whole world.
  • The funding is going toward a "mobile studio" which includes a laptop, mics and cables, earphones and software.
  • Top contributors get to write a song with me, or other personalized perks.
  • Even if the goal is not reached, these funds still go to my "mobile studio".
  • Even if you don't contribute monetarily, there is so much you can do by sharing this project with your friends!
  • I'd like to express a special thank you to HaRav HaGoan HaBochur HaChoshuv HaBen Aliya HaNifla Pini Stimler Shlita, for his excellent proofreading of all these words!!!
story_txt:
My name is Dani Shain. I was born in JHB South Africa, and have been living in Israel for the last 11 years. I have been singing since I was 3. My passion is creating meaningful music that brings hope, comfort and joy, to all people, no matter their background. This campaign will enable me to independently create my art, will all the artistic freedom needed to ensure it stays pure in every way.
Contributors will help me create and release meaningful and hopeful music, that resonates with feelings of love, hope, and oneness, to the whole world.
The funding is going toward a "mobile studio" which includes a laptop, mics and cables, earphones and software.
Top contributors get to write a song with me, or other personalized perks.
Even if the goal is not reached, these funds still go to my "mobile studio".
Even if you don't contribute monetarily, there is so much you can do by sharing this project with your friends!
I'd like to express a special thank you to HaRav HaGoan HaBochur HaChoshuv HaBen Aliya HaNifla Pini Stimler Shlita, for his excellent proofreading of all these words!!!

story:
In the Studio

Over the last few months, I've completed recording 10 songs with piano, bass, drums and vocals.  Please help me bring this record to the next level with horns, percussion, background singers, mixing, mastering, and production!

Here's how it sounds now:   https://soundcloud.com/joel-zighel/san-lorenzo-...   

Your contribution will help pay for:

  • A-level NYC Studio Musicians to play on the record
  • Pro Recording Facilities at Mighty Toad Studios in Brooklyn, NY
  • Mixing, Mastering, Production of Digital Downloads, CD's and Vinyl

Budget

Here's how the budget breaks down:

  • $4,000 for Horn Arrangements, Horn Players, Percussionists, Vocalists
  • $4,000 for Studio Time, Production, Engineering
  • $2,000 for Mixing, Mastering, and Final Production 
  • $0 for Marketing, PR, Advertising, Other BS

Why

--does the world need another record?  

  • It's all analog!  NO DIGITAL recording, fully live, the real way... 
  • 5 years of songwriting packed into 10 songs - they are really good! 
  • Style - guaranteed impeccable production aesthetic!

No Risk

--no reward!  Sure, there are always risks to getting involved, but the real risk is never doing anything about your goals.  Plus, my personal guarantees:

Extra Guarantees:

  • Even if I don't make my funding goal, I will keep making the record, little by little, until it is done.  It WILL happen, so your help WILL make a difference!
  • If you help this project, the universe will thank you by producing a gravitational wave with your name on it!

Any Amount Counts

Your positive energy will be captured by Indiegogo's patented Positron Emission Converter -- every time you listen to the record or tell someone about the project, the stars in the sky will glow just a little bit more brightly!

story:
(Espanol)

Por primera vez les presento una compilación de mis temas en un disco físico y por solo un tiempo limitado. Al contribuir aportaras al crear el disco en si y también con este dinero se aportara para la creación de nuevos temas al igual que mercancía tal como camisetas y gorras en un futuro cercano. El disco es titulado "Focus (Atención)" ya que cada detalle ya sea la melodía, la letra o estrategia de mercadeo a sido siempre hecho con mucho detalle, atención y sobretodo pasión. Ahora con eso dicho, también les pido que rieguen la palabra o simplemente apoyame al suscribirte a mi canal de Youtube atreves de http://Youtube.com/TaynoNetTV

Les agradezco por su tiempo y espero poder contar con su apoyo, recuerda que cualquier granito cuenta!

(English)

For the first time ever during a limited time, I present to you a mini compilation of all my exclusive singles in a physical format. Your contribution will both assist in the creation of the disc as well as help fund future tracks limited merchandise such as shirts and hats. The album is titled “Focus” based off of the perseverance, dedication and overall passion taken while creating every track. Also and most importantly the attention to detail in every melody, word and artwork direction. With that being said, if you’re not able to contribute I ask of you to at least share this campaign or subscribe to my YouTube channel via http://Youtube.com/TaynoNetTV

I appreciate your time and I hope that I can count with your support and please remember that any little help counts!

story:
raFreal Morris
Soundcloud page: https://soundcloud.com/raphael-morris/tracks

You’re the ones I’m doing this for. You’re the people who come to shows, offer up your time, and give dudes like me a chance. I appreciate that.

I wrote everything down from the beginning. Starting as Yung Real on the streets of Chicago.  I've lived just about any way a person could live. Worked on my craft and tried to say something. Out of that chronicle comes the story of rafReal Morris.

Here's the deal. I got a chance at a tour of a few southern U.S. states this July, 2016. Right after that tour, I want to produce my first official mixtape. I need your help to do both.

Right now I'm working hard on demos, slamming my live set, getting ready. With a little help, I can expand my reach, so that next tour, I can play your town.

I'm already counting you in. And if you can't give right now, that's OK. It all comes out in the mix. I'll see you at the next show.

Much Thanks.

-     rafReal 

The Impact

I've been at this for a long time, working with incredibly talented people. This campaign is about my next step up. Building a solid foundation with fans like you.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk in life is NOT taking that shot. I have the songs, the support, and the trust of people around me. And from a practical standpoint, this summer I'll be performing the songs that will be on my EP, so when studio time comes, I'll be blazing it out fast.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Not all of us have cash a the moment, but we DO have voices! Let your friends and fellow earth-dwellers know about my campaign. I appreciate the shout-out.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

MahraJazz (2017) is a small alternative jazz festival, the first-ever Palestinian music festival to take place in Haifa (Palestine). Organised by an independent group of young individuals working in various fields of culture and production, MahraJazz will be held on two consecutive weekends on 24-26 August – 31-2 September, and will showcase a variety of international and local jazz musicians and subgenres. MahraJazz is a non-profit, volunteer based event which aims at reaching wider Palestinian crowds in gathering as well as through radio broadcasting.

In recent years, there has been a snowball of local Palestinian efforts that are reclaiming Haifa as a Palestinian urban centre for culture and knowledge production, as it was before its occupation and dismantling in 1948. These various efforts and projects have been contributing to the building of a cultural autonomy that seeks to be ungoverned by occupation or colonialism.

Location: Haifa and Ramallah.
Line up: Kevin Brady Trio (Ireland); Ruba Shamshoum Quintet (Palestine); Dirar Kalash, with Luke Stewart (Palestine, US); Elliot Galvin Trio (UK); Gevende (Turkey); Nathan Daems (Belgium); and more to be announced + Masterclasses/workshops.

What We Need

  • MahraJazz is an independent, volunteer-based, and non-profit project.
  • We are hoping to obtain the needed funding from Arab and international cultural investors. 
  • Tickets will be sold at a symbolic price to enable maximum audience accessibility – and all ticket sales will be used to cover the costs of the festival.
  • Our total needed budget is 23000$, the remaining income of which we are hoping to secure through ticket sales and from the support of local Palestinian businesses and cultural organisations.
  • Although we are an independent non-registered project, we have obtained the great support of Al-Qaws organisation [http://alqaws.org/siteEn/index/language/en]&nbs... are willing to vouch for our legitimacy and to provide us with formal bureaucratic assistance and functions.

               

The Impact

  • MahraJazz festival is a fascinating opportunity: 
  • It introduces an alternative jazz scene to the local Palestinian community and highlights different music genres in Palestine, and thus functions as a bridging point in the production and organisation of a new Palestinian music culture.
  • It facilitates the development of producing and consuming jazz music by giving a stage for both local and international jazz musicians to meet on, to share knowledge, and to network through.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our project and event on Facebook and with whoever might be interested.
  • Come and watch the amazing live acts in MahraJazz.
  • Come to the planned workshops and masterclasses.
  • Even if you are not in Haifa or can't attend MahraJazz we would still be so so happy if you share this with your own groups to which this cause is relevant abroad.
  • And that's all there is to it.

مهرجاز (2017) هو مهرجان جاز بديل، وأول مهرجان موسيقى فلسطيني يقام في مدينة حيفا (فلسطين). يقوم بتنظيم المهرجان مجموعة مستقلّة من الأفراد الشابة، الذين يعملون بمجالات ثقافية متعددة. سيُعقد مهرجاز بنهايتي أسبوع متتاليتين، من 24 الى 26 آب ومن 31 آب الى 2 أيلول. سيُقدم المهرجان مجموعة متنوعة من فرق الجاز العالمية والمحلية وانواع متعددة من الجاز. مهرجاز هو حدث غير ربحي ومبني على أساس تطوعي، هدفه الوصول لجمهور فلسطيني واسع

شهدنا في السنوات الأخيرة مجهودا فلسطينيا محليا واضحا يسعى لإستعادة حيفا كمركز حضاري للإنتاج الثقافي، كما كانت قبل احتلالها وتفكيكها عام 1948. لقد ساهمت هذه الجهود والمشاريع المختلفة ببناء استقلالية ثقافية هدفها أن لا تكون محكومة من قبل الإحتلال او الإستعمار.

الموقع: حيفا ورام الله

العروض الموسيقية: ثلاثي كيفن برايدي (ايرلندا)؛ خماسية ربى شمشوم (فلسطين)؛ ضرار كلش ولوك ستيوارت (فلسطين، أمريكا)؛ كين فندرمارك (أمريكا)؛ جيفندي (تركيا)؛ ناثان دييمز(بلجيكا)؛ وعروض أخرى سيعلن عنها قريبا، بالإضافة الى ماستر كلاسز/ورشات عمل.

ماذا نحتاج

كما ذكر سابقا، مهرجاز هو مشروع مستقل وغير ربحي، ومبني على أساس تطوعي، ونحن نأمل بالحصول على التمويل اللازم من مستثمرين ثقافيين عرب وعالميين.

ستباع التذاكر بأسعار رمزية للتمكن من الوصول لأكبر عدد من الجمهور- وسيستخدم مدخول التذاكر بكامله لتغطية تكاليف المهرجان. إجمالي الميزانية التي نحتاج لها هو 23000$، ونأمل أن نؤمن باقي المبلغ المطلوب من بيع التذاكر ودعم شركات ومنظمات فلسطينية محلية.

على الرغم من أننا مشروع مستقل غير مُسجّل، لقد استطعنا الحصول على الدعم الكبير من جمعية القوس [http://alqaws.org/siteEn/index/language/en]، التي عبرت عن استعدادها بأن تشهد على شرعيتنا وتمديدنا بالمساعدة البيروقراطية الرسمية اللازمة.

التأثير

مهرجاز هو فرصة رائعة:

سيقدم المهرجان مشهد جاز بديل للمجتمع الفلسطينيّ المحليّ وسيلقي الضوء على الأنواع الموسيقيّة المختلفة، وبالتالي سيشكل نقطة وصل لإنتاج وتنظيم ثقافة موسيقيّة فلسطينيّة جديدة. فهو يُسهّل تطوير انتاج واستهلاك موسيقى الجاز عن طريق توفير منصة مشتركة للتواصل ومشاركة المعرفة بين موسيقيين محليين وعالميين.

طرق اخرى يمكنكم المساعدة من خلالها

شاركوا مشروعنا على الفيسبوك ومع اي شخص ممكن ان يكون مهتم بالموضوع.

تعالوا إحضروا العروض الحيّة الرائعة بمهرجاز.

شاركوا بالماستر كلاسز والورشات المخططة.

حتى إذا كنتو مش متواجدين بحيفا ومقدرتوش تشاركوا بمهرجاز، مننبسط كثير إذا قدرتو تشاركو المشروع مع دوائركم الخاصة.

وهذا هو :)

بنهايتي أسبوع متتاليتين، من 24 الى 26 آب ومن 31 آب الى 2 أيلول. سيُقدم المهرجان مجموعة متنوعة من فرق الجاز العالمية والمحلية وانواع متعددة من الجاز. مهرجاز هو حدث غير ربحي ومبني على أساس تطوعي، هدفه الوصول لجمهور فلسطيني واسعشهدنا في السنوات الأخيرة مجهودا فلسطينيا محليا واضحا يسعى لإستعادة حيفا كمركز حضاري للإنتاج الثقافي، كما كانت قبل احتلالها وتفكيكها عام 1948. لقد ساهمت هذه الجهود والمشاريع المختلفة ببناء استقلالية ثقافية هدفها أن لا تكون محكومة من قبل الإحتلال او الإستعمار.الموقع: حيفا ورام اللهالعروض الموسيقية: ثلاثي كيفن برايدي (ايرلندا)؛ خماسية ربى شمشوم (فلسطين)؛ ضرار كلش ولوك ستيوارت (فلسطين، أمريكا)؛ كين فندرمارك (أمريكا)؛ جيفندي (تركيا)؛ ناثان دييمز(بلجيكا)؛ وعروض أخرى سيعلن عنها قريبا، بالإضافة الى ماستر كلاسز/ورشات عمل.ماذا نحتاجكما ذكر سابقا، مهرجاز هو مشروع مستقل وغير ربحي، ومبني على أساس تطوعي، ونحن نأمل بالحصول على التمويل اللازم من مستثمرين ثقافيين عرب وعالميين.ستباع التذاكر بأسعار رمزية للتمكن من الوصول لأكبر عدد من الجمهور- وسيستخدم مدخول التذاكر بكامله لتغطية تكاليف المهرجان. إجمالي الميزانية التي نحتاج لها هو 23000$، ونأمل أن نؤمن باقي المبلغ المطلوب من بيع التذاكر ودعم شركات ومنظمات فلسطينية محلية.على الرغم من أننا مشروع مستقل غير مُسجّل، لقد استطعنا الحصول على الدعم الكبير من جمعية القوس [http://alqaws.org/siteEn/index/language/en]، التي عبرت عن استعدادها بأن تشهد على شرعيتنا وتمديدنا بالمساعدة البيروقراطية الرسمية اللازمة.التأثيرمهرجاز هو فرصة رائعة:سيقدم المهرجان مشهد جاز بديل للمجتمع الفلسطينيّ المحليّ وسيلقي الضوء على الأنواع الموسيقيّة المختلفة، وبالتالي سيشكل نقطة وصل لإنتاج وتنظيم ثقافة موسيقيّة فلسطينيّة جديدة. فهو يُسهّل تطوير انتاج واستهلاك موسيقى الجاز عن طريق توفير منصة مشتركة للتواصل ومشاركة المعرفة بين موسيقيين محليين وعالميين.طرق اخرى يمكنكم المساعدة من خلالهاشاركوا مشروعنا على الفيسبوك ومع اي شخص ممكن ان يكون مهتم بالموضوع.تعالوا إحضروا العروض الحيّة الرائعة بمهرجاز.شاركوا بالماستر كلاسز والورشات المخططة.حتى إذا كنتو مش متواجدين بحيفا ومقدرتوش تشاركوا بمهرجاز، مننبسط كثير إذا قدرتو تشاركو المشروع مع دوائركم الخاصة.وهذا هو :)

story: It's all here.  The history is long but this chapter is ready to close.  We are really proud of the puzzle we've assembled and are ready to share it and move on to performances and the next set of recordings!
story_txt: It's all here.  The history is long but this chapter is ready to close.  We are really proud of the puzzle we've assembled and are ready to share it and move on to performances and the next set of recordings!

story:
Short Summary

For those of you that don’t know me I’m a singer/songwriter from Philadelphia, PA. I released my first 3 debut singles back in 2012, all of which were recorded in Nashville & produced by multi-platinum producer Kenny Lamb (N’SYNC/Justin Timberlake/Rhett Atkins) with engineering by Chris Rowe (Taylor Swift/Jewel).

Since then I’ve toured up & down the east coast playing over 200+ shows, graduated from college, opened for Jon McLaughlin during the summer of 2016 & spent 2016 living in Nashville writing for both myself & other artists.

It’s been 5 years since I’ve released new music and well...I think it’s about time! I have so many new songs I want to share with you guys!! In addition to my own original material, I’ll be putting together an acoustic cover video series. Taking some of my (and hopefully yours!) favorite songs from pop, country & soul, stripping them down to an acoustic form and making them my own. I’ve had this vision in my head for over 2 years now. The only thing standing in my way are the funds to make it happen!

I’ll also be contributing a portion of the funds raised to VocaliD, an amazing company out of Boston that creates unique vocal identities for individuals who rely on text-to-speech devices to communicate. The donated funds will be enough to cover the cost of a voice for someone in need. After being sidelined with a vocal injury a few years back, I feel so lucky to have the ability to sing and get to do what I love, given the circumstances. If I can use my voice to inspire someone else and help someone in need, to me that’s everything. Thank you so much for your support!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

So what does the money go towards? A lot of things!

  • - 6 FULLY PRODUCED Original tracks
  • - 12 FULLY PRODUCED Acoustic Cover tracks & videos.
  • Paying the musicians, paying the producers/engineers, paying the videographer, paying for studio time, paying for the costs associated with printing the actual physical CD’s (the EP will be available in physical copy as well as digital), covering our licensing & distribution costs, promotional materials, tip reward fulfillment costs, along with a tiny extra cushion to cover any additional costs that may occur: think extra musicians, an additional track, any additional distribution fees etc.
  • And as mentioned a portion of the funds raised will be going towards VocaliD to fully cover the cost of a voice for someone in need.

What Do You Get:

  • Some really cool prizes and an unbelievably grateful heart from me, not to mention a TON of NEW MUSIC!!!

What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal:

When there’s a will there’s away. I’m going to make this project happen no matter what! If I make less than our goal, I’ll have to reevaluate a few things and figure out how I can make things work within our financial constraints. But hitting our goal will make for a fast streamlined process and will make creating this project a lot easier.

 

The Impact

As an independent artist, I sometimes wonder if what I do really matters. Have I grown as an artist? Am I further than when I first started down this crazy road five years ago? Does any of it truly matter? The answer: Yes. It matters because I haven’t given up. I keep playing and the gigs & the crowds just keep getting better, as does the music. 

The immediate impact of this campaign is we get to create a debut EP, an acoustic cover video series, creating 18 tracks in total, along with providing a voice for someone in need. This new material will allow me to present myself in a new light, with a new sound, allowing me to finally be able to put new material into the world.

In the ever-changing music industry, this project will also create new opportunities for me to step up as an artist along with the platform to move forward both in my career and in life.

While all of the above is extremely important, it's the impact I have an artist that matters most. It's having the ability to inspire & brighten someone's day through music that makes all the difference.

It’s the group of middle school girls who come up to you after you've played a show at their school, the look of sheer joy, excitement & the thought that maybe they can do this too. It’s the little kids who have been in a hospital for far to long, that you get to make laugh & smile as you go from room to room playing a few songs through Musicians On Call.

It’s the younger artist who you get to cheer on & watch as they grow in their confidence, and think to themselves, “Well I’m here now, but maybe someday I can be there, because look, she did it.” To me, that’s the impact.

No, I don’t have a major label or hundreds of thousands of dollars to put into a project, create large budget videos and no I don’t play arena shows – yet. Instead, I get to call the shots, write the songs I want to write, perform at some really cool venues and maybe if I’m lucky, I’ll get to inspire one or two people along the way.

Join me in creating this project. You never know what kind of opportunities it could create and hey, it might just lead to opening one of those arena shows. We've gotten this far. You never know unless you try. 

Thank you so much for all of your support. Let’s do this!

Other Ways You Can Help

If for any reason you can’t contribute financially, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE help spread the word about this campaign. Share it on social media, send it to a few friends in an email, tell your mom, your boyfriend, your girlfriend, your neighbor - we can use all the help we can get. Every little bit counts and makes a huge difference!! Thank you so much!

story:
My Campaign

My debut album Dakota Sol is 10 years in the making and will be one of the most unique albums brought out to-date. I've spent years crafting a unique style that encompasses folk, rock, blues, soul/R&B, and reggae with lyrics that speaks from the heart and aims to inspire, empower, uplift and bring hope.

Having worked tireless over the last two years as an indie artist to get to this point, I am my own booking agent, manager, A&R agent, tour manager, and promoter. All the hard work has paid off as I am now inches way from making it all happen and am in the studio recording the album with shows booked for my tour! The work load forced me to leave my job months ago and sadly as I have exhausted all my funds, without your support Dakota Sol will not be possible. With your support we will  help change the world through music and prove it's never too late to chase dreams or something bigger than ourselves!

Who is Johan Danno?

As an old man sits on a dusty armchair lost in a dream, he’s weighted down by his life decisions asking himself why he chose to fall in line instead of following his heart… this was the vision Johan Danno saw in his reflection of his future at age 27.  
Later that night he accepted the offer to play music at a friend’s birthday party, the first time he had performed in awhile. It was at this party when he finished playing that a young man suddenly walked up to him with tears rolling down his face, wrapped his arms around him smiling said “thanks to you, I now feel like everything is going to be alright.” 

The next morning Johan threw his tie away, picked up his guitar and started writing the songs that would free himself as much as the people who heard them, performing countless shows both big and small from homes to festivals, gaining a following while touching peoples hearts as his feet travelled one step at a time across the world.

Why Do I Need The Funds & What Do You Get?

You contributions will give me the opportunity to record and release my debut album, along with completing a tour that will help launch my music to an international audience. 

The costs are as follows:

 Recording & Releasing Dakota: $6,000

  • $3,000 | Production, Recording & Mastering
  • $1,500  | Pressing Physical Copies
  • $1,000  | Marketing & Promotion Through College Radio
  • $500     | Album Artwork

Dakota Sol Tour (Canada, USA, Australia, Hawaii): $9,000

  • $1,800 | Air Fair Tickets (x5)
  • $3,000 | Van Rental
  • $2,000 | Marketing & PR through Big Picture Media
  • $1,200  |  Tour Merchandise
  • $1,000  | Equipment Rental/Purchase

Incentives Include:

  • All contributors receive invites to shows I will be hosting during my tour
  • Pick a song for me to do a cover of and upload to Youtube
  • Lyrics to one of my songs hand drawn in calligraphy and framed
  • Private 3-hour performance in your home for you and your friends
  • Official t-shirt for the "Dakota Sol World Tour 2016" and stickers
  • Pre-purchase a copy of Dakota Sol (digital or physical)

The Impact

Together we will release music that has an uplifting and positive message. You will be a part of my journey and decision making through the album and tour The funds raised will launch my music and enable me to record another album and perform shows internationally. Let’s save and heal people with the power of music!

Preparation & Training

This album is ten years in the making, meaning I have invested a lot of time and resources to get to this point. Some of the preparation, investment, and training I have undertaken to complete this project includes:

  • Performing shows every weekend (sometimes up to 6 shows per weekend) over the past 2 years preparing for the tour
  • Undertaken 1-year mentorship with the Who Agency (Gold Coast, Australia)
  • Completed three classes with Berklee Online : 'Music Business Industry 101,' 'Intro to Production,' and 'Writing Better Lyrics (w/ Pat Patterson)'
  • Vocal lessons with professional vocal coach Deborah Wilson 
  • Attended workshops and training sessions
  • Work with music industry professionals (producers, A&R, managers, etc.)
  • Obtained 'Bachelor in Marketing' with a certification in 'Entertainment Marketing' from the University of Central in 2010

Risks & Challenges

During the 1-year planning phase for this album and tour, it became clear to me that I would need to leave my part-time job and focus 100% of my efforts on this project. That was a big leap of faith, but I was bolstered by my confidence in this dream I have had for so long.

The greatest challenge I have is raising the necessary funds to make Dakota Sol a reality. This is why I have turned to Indiegogo and developed a number of incentives to thank you for helping contribute from big to small - every dollar makes a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign (feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools)! You can also organise a "House Concert" when I am coming through your area with at least 20 friends who are willing to pay $20 each and put me in touch with a venue to perform at or a paid gig. Other than that, share this campaign on any social media platforms you are using: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. The more people know about this, the better off we will be!

Thank you for your support and with your help we can make this a reality!

story:
Simon Tucker has joined with the newly formed Lewis-Clark Valley Music Alliance to produce Confluence Music Festival: a two-day family-friendly music event.

The Music Alliance believes that music is an integral part of the human experience, and we want to enrich the musical culture in the Lewis-Clark Valley by bringing more quality music into our community.

Our plan is to bring a top-talent music experience to fruition in a family-friendly atmosphere and to pay our musicians fairly for the time, effort, and money they’ve put into their passion, art, and careers.

It’s also important to us that we make this experience available to everyone who wants to attend by keeping ticket prices affordable for easy access. To make this possible, we are seeking sponsorships from local businesses and individuals like you.

By partnering with this project, you will be helping to provide our community with a culturally enriching and unique experience to our LC- Valley area.

We want to make this event different by bringing around 10 music acts, each equally talented, respected and accomplished, rather than hiring one “headliner” for the show and asking local “openers” to play for a reduced rate or for free.

This way, we hope to provide the best possible musical experience for our area, rather than banking on a top-heavy music lineup.

To put this on, we’ve formed a governing board representing a wide range of professional and philanthropic individuals who that share the vision of a greater music culture for our community.

Cari Miller has been a Captain in the Army, manager at Lewiston Home Depot, North Central Branch Manager of the Idaho Food Bank, and most recently, a Lewiston City Council woman and Branch Manager at Washington Trust Bank.

Suzanne has worked as an administrator in the human services field for 12 years, and she is a founding member of Green Apple Project, a local non-profit formed raise autism awareness and support in our community.

Nathanael Tucker is a Lewiston native and long-time player in the Valley’s art and music scene. When he’s not working the newsroom at the Lewiston Tribune, he’s teaching violin privately and for Children’s House Montessori School, and playing in local favorite 7 Devils band.

Dan Prasil is Vice President of Food Service and Vending for Idaho Beverages. Dan played an integral part in working with the City of Lewiston Parks & Recreation, the Valley Skate Park Association, and the local business community to build Mountain Dew Skateboard Park.

Carol Maurer is a former anchor for KLEW news and current Public information officer for the City of Lewiston.

Kaitlyn Bergman has formerly worked with Clarkston School District, is a long-time volunteer for Boys & Girls Club, and currently works for Valley Physical Therapy.

Amanda Coleman is Event Coordinator for Lewis Clark State College Continuing Education and Community Events’ Art Under the Elms

And Cory Sandstrom is Senior Sales Consultant at Mick McClure Honda, Lewiston Chamber of Commerce Ambassador, and board member for local non-profit Rockin’ on the River.

As Executive Director, Simon Tucker is drawing on 18 years’ experience as a music industry professional to curate this one-of-a-kind event.

We look forward to working with you, the LC-Valley community to bring great things to our community, beginning with this: Confluence Music Festival, 2016.

greater music culture for our community. 
Cari
Miller has been a Captain in the Army, manager at Lewiston Home Depot, North Central
Branch Manager of the Idaho Food Bank, and most recently, a Lewiston City
Council woman and Branch Manager at Washington Trust Bank. 
Suzanne
has worked as an administrator in the human services field for 12 years, and she
is a founding member of Green Apple Project, a local non-profit formed raise
autism awareness and support in our community. 
Nathanael
Tucker is a Lewiston native and long-time player in the Valley’s art and music
scene. When he’s not working the newsroom at the Lewiston Tribune, he’s
teaching violin privately and for Children’s House Montessori School, and
playing in local favorite 7 Devils band. 
Dan
Prasil is Vice President of Food Service and Vending for Idaho Beverages. Dan
played an integral part in working with the City of Lewiston Parks &
Recreation, the Valley Skate Park Association, and the local business community
to build Mountain Dew Skateboard Park. 
Carol
Maurer is a former anchor for KLEW news and current Public information officer
for the City of Lewiston. 
Kaitlyn
Bergman has formerly worked with Clarkston School District, is a long-time
volunteer for Boys & Girls Club, and currently works for Valley Physical
Therapy.
Amanda
Coleman is Event Coordinator for Lewis Clark State College Continuing Education
and Community Events’ Art Under the Elms
And Cory
Sandstrom is Senior Sales Consultant at Mick McClure Honda, Lewiston Chamber of
Commerce Ambassador, and board member for local non-profit Rockin’ on the
River. 
As
Executive Director, Simon Tucker is drawing on 18 years’ experience as a music
industry professional to curate this one-of-a-kind event.
We look
forward to working with you, the LC-Valley community to bring great things to
our community, beginning with this: Confluence Music Festival, 2016.

story:
AltitudeProject.org

30 musicians based in Chicago collaborating on one album.  All proceeds will be donated directly to the Music Box Foundation.  

Music Box Foundation:

  • Free classes to children and disabled individuals.
  • Help students achieve scholarships.
  • Teaching the business of music to advanced students.

We are inspired as musicians by the work within the community that Vernon Lloyd and his staff at Music Box provide.  The passion shown by these educators is infectious. As Musicians who live in Chicago, we aim to do whatever we can to help fund grass-roots organizations such as Music Box.  When you take the arts away from a child, they loose one of the most effective avenues of self discovery.  They miss out on a chance to learn the meaning of dedication, critical thinking and the vision of a bright future.

Our Goal (Budget Breakdown)

Recording, editing, mixing, scheduling and mastering an album for any band is a process with a lot of overhead when you are adhering to industry standard production value.  What if your band has 30 working musicians?  The overhead multiplies exponentially.   

The scope of this project is enormous.  Though the musicians are lending their talents for free, there are third party professionals who will need to block out their schedules to work on this project exclusively for nearly a month and a half.  The $11,500 allocated to our Executive Producer and his team is more than a bargain.  Blocking out a month of your schedule adds up quickly.  One must also consider the amount of work they've already contributed over the last year of planning, as well as the 6 studio sessions already completed.

The rest of our budget is geared toward making the album a success.  Our definition of success is two fold;  On the one hand we want to sell as many copies of the album as we possibly can.  That is a success because none of the musicians, producers, engineers, designers or videographers will receive any of the profits, rights or royalties from the album sales.  All of the former will be owned 100% by the Music Box Foundation.  The Altitude Project is creating this album for that purpose specifically.  The Altitude Project was founded for this purpose.

Our second definition of success would be to sell as many copies as we can, in turn raising awareness that something like this is even possible.  What if musicians all over the country got together once a year in each city and made an album that would benefit an organization promoting the arts in high risk area to children and the disabled?  That's what we aim to do.  That makes it possible by definition.

We want to see collectives like the Altitude Project pop up in cities everywhere.  Musicians willing to put their reputation on the line to raise money for charities that give back to their community.

$20,000 allocated as follows:

Tracking, Overdubs (30 Musicians), and Studio Fees

$4,000

Mixing/Editing

$6,000

Mastering

$1,500

Hard Copies (qty 2000)  and Distribution (iTunes, Amazon, Spotify)

$2,500

Two advanced students from the Music Box Foundation will appear on the album.  They will be compensated as follows:

$500 – Student A

$500 – Student B

Advertising:  The only way that Music Box can benefit from this is by advertising the album.

This will include Street Teams, Chicago periodicals and short run Billboard campaigns

  • $5,000

 

Why?

Not only do we have a growing roster of talented musicians committing to this project, we are proud to announce that two advanced students of the Music Box Foundation will be featured on the album.  This will help give the Music Box Foundation more than just the proceeds.  This gives them a personal sense of ownership over the album.  The chance at a crucial age to take part of a massive project and learn from that experience.

One album won't change the harsh realities of the south side of Chicago, however, it will give these students an experience that fosters personal growth.  It will raise awareness that there are safe havens like Music Box that are available and are fighting to keep the arts alive for children in Chicago.

The arts teach us how to dream.  Music teaches us how to dream. 

When you promote the arts to children, you empower a community from within.

 

Challenges

This album can become a reality with your contribution.  We have already begun production.  We finished 1 track featuring our core group of musicians.  Check it out at www.altitudeproject.org

We ask that you keep up with our progress.  Hold us accountable.  Give suggestions.

With so much negativity surrounding the the current socio-economic climate of Chicago, it's time we raise the altitude a bit and get behind something positive.  

This project is about self empowerment over violence and gentrification.  As musicians from Chicago, we want to make sure that every child has access of the arts.

This is our city.  We owe it to our youth.  We will make an album if we fall short of our goal.  We hold true to our word to the Music Box Foundation no matter what.  That said, If we can make this budget a reality together... WE CAN ACCOMPLISH SO MUCH MORE!

Spread the Word!

Help us spread the word on social media about the Altitude Project and the Music Box Foundation.  We will be posting content and updates daily on Indiegogo and Altitude Project .org

story:
Greetings everyone!  I am Andrea Lane, Rockstar for God.
Do you want to participate in the transformation of your own consciousness......which also affects our consciousness as a whole? Have you noticed that some change needs to happen on all fronts?

 I am so super excited to announce that I am in the studio recording a new EP that I have been guided and called to do.   It is a meditation EP that will inspire the listener into more joy, peace and freedom.  I started doing yoga a few years ago and it literally saved my life.  Since then, I often listen to yoga inspired music.   The blissful, peaceful way I feel after listening to this style of music is what I want you to experience!   Sometimes people become stuck in their lives.  Whether it's from a loss or fear, they freeze and stop living life to the fullest.  I am absolutely convinced that through meditation, prayer and yoga this can be improved enormously. From your peaceful state, you are more able to make positive changes and decisions.  DO YOU WANT TO LIVE MORE FULLY AND AUTHENTICALLY?  LET'S LIVE LIFE TO THE FULLEST TOGETHER!


What do I get for my contribution?

You will see various 'perks' on the campaign page. You can choose any perk you like which includes the meditation EP and other additional items like angel card readings, yoga classes, homemade pies, your name in the credits of the EP and more!  The music will have some singing, chants and affirmations.


I really want you to be a part of this project!  Have you noticed that the world is really up for some revolutionary healing right now? Are you being called to do something or be a part of something that assists in the transformation of our consciousness?  I am!! And I am stronger with you.  I can't do it alone! Come and dream big with me!!  If you are already a freedom rocker, you know that I did a campaign in 2013 with amazing success.  I reached all of my goals! I was ever so grateful to deliver a high quality rockin' product on time.  I have an excellent track record!  It was a huge challenge, raising the funds and finishing the recording and ultimately I overcame every so-called setback. 

Because there is an incredible expense involved in studio time, musicians, mastering, and replicating  CDS (not to mention artwork and hours of rehearsing) indie musicians like myself do not release CD's that often.  That's where your financial assistance comes in........Additionally, a percentage of funds raised will be given to Rickie Byars-Beckwith's  Kuumba school for children.  They are in full force looking to build their own school in Compton.    Right now it is a mobile creative experience for youth and their families.  Visit   http://www.kuumbainmotion.org/ Let's help kids to learn music, math and movement in a creative way that actually WORKS! Are you in?

YOU MAKE A DIFFERENCE! All support is welcome and anything you can contribute makes a difference to me, this project, and the kids.

Thanks for reading this far! Come be a part of my dream. xoxoxoxo 

Here's where the funds go:

recording 

musicians 

mixing, mastering

replicating the cd 

artwork - Special artwork/painting by Gabriela Z. Hath (www.morethanarts.com)

marketing and promotions

donation to Kuumba School for children- 10% of amount raised

You may also mail a check to : PO BOX 3821 Redondo Beach, CA 90277

This will be an EP or short CD.

If you are inspired to help out by promoting:  you can share this page on  Facebook or your twitter account. I appreciate any help or promo you are able to give!! Rock on Freedom Rockers!

story:
I am so proud of the albums I have made in the past but I really need to move beyond the basement recording studio. I'm no longer able to financially sustain a career in music in obscurity and so I hope you will help me to elevate my work through quality recording and help me to get it out there with some professional marketing. I really believe in this music, so does the band and the growing fan base we are creating. I hope you will join our team of supporters!

I'm Collette Savard, a singer-songwriter originally from North Bay ON Canada now based in Toronto. For nearly my whole life I've been writing and performing my own songs. I have already recorded three albums mostly with my own funds and with the generous help of many other talented musicians. 

In the last year I started working with a full band. It's always been a dream of mine to do this and the awesome pros I've managed to assemble are nothing short of a miracle for me.  If you asked them why they are willing to play shows for next to nothing I think they'd tell you it's because they love my songs (and my charming personality of course!) We are all thrilled to get into the studio and honour this great bunch of tunes. 

The Toronto Arts Council got us started with a generous grant of 9k. I know that sounds like a lot of money in this era of DYI but at this stage in my career it's time for me to take this thing to another level. As always, I'm working with professional musicians who deserve to be paid their worth especially given the fact that the live music business just doesn't pay reasonable wages. Studio work is one of the last paying options for musicians and those gigs are few and far between so it's important for me that my musicians get paid proper scale. The 9k the Arts Council provides would just barely cover this cost. I then need to pay my amazing producer his fee as well. We're also recording in a professional studio, Marquee Sound, and though it is a smaller independent facility it's still more money than playing in the living room but well worth the expense!

There will also be costs for mixing, mastering, and duplicating the album including graphic design. I'd also love to put it on vinyl but that doesn't come cheap. Beyond that it would be great to get a bit of money for promotion. Ideally we will need to hire a publicist for the release so that the world knows what a masterpiece we've made! The more money we raise the better the publicist. The better the publicist, the more people hear about the album. The more people hear about it, the more people buy the album or come to shows. The more that happens, the more we get to make more albums and so on and so forth...
If we don't manage to raise this amount through crowdfunding and other grants it means that people start getting paid less, that we don't get as much time in the studio, that there are no vinyl copies and that promotion is done solely by me and so the album reaches fewer ears. I'm hoping this time around you fine folks will help me make this album the way it deserves to be made. In return you get some fun incentives and are also promised some world-class music!


Meet the band:

John Switzer is a Toronto-based independent record producer. He has produced records for Jane Siberry, Andrew Cash, The Grievous Angels, Rita Chiarelli, and The Waltons, among many others, including Songs of Work and Freedom from The Brothers Cosmoline, which was nominated for a 2001 JUNO, and Spirit World, Solid Wood by NWT singer Leela Gilday, winner of three awards, including Best Folk Album, at the 2002 Aboriginal Music Awards. Jimson Weed , by Winnipeg band Nathan, was nominated for a 2005 JUNO award for “Best Roots/Traditional Album and received the award for “Best Album–Contemporary” at the Canadian Folk Music Awards.


Rebecca Campbell is an acclaimed and prolific singer and sometime songwriter. She sings myriad styles, in countless settings, up front and back up. She plays percussion, and some guitar and melodica. But mostly she sings. Born in Toronto in 1963, Rebecca has been making music, and helping others to do the same since her teens. Bred in the Maritimes and Ottawa, and educated in Montreal, she has been based in Toronto since the late-nineties. She has performed with countless individuals and ensembles, most notable among them: Jane Siberry, Meredith Monk, Paul Quarrington, Porkbelly Futures, Ian Tamblyn, Lynn Miles, Carol Ann Weaver, Ernest Ranglin, The Special Interest Group, Fat Man Waving, Bec and Rusty, Three Sheets To The Wind, Justin Haynes, Collette Savard, Stephen Fearing, Dave Bidini, Microbunny, King Cobb Steelie, Jim Cuddy, Dan Hill, Parachute Club, Ken Whiteley, Joe Hall, Emmylou Harris, Ani Difranco, Daniel Lanois, Fred Eaglesmith, The Skydiggers, Carlos Del Junco, Kevin Breit, Melwood Cutlery, CCDT, and the list goes on and on… on stages across Canada, the USA, Europe, South Africa, South Korea, Hawaii, and the Caribbean. Rebecca's voice has graced both the big and small screen, and she has sung on over 100 recordings. Beyond being a singer of songs, she is and/or has been a producer, presenter, publicist, booking agent, tour manager, actor, youth workshop leader, South African field trip co-leader, Artscape Gibraltar Point Centre For The Arts bookings manager, Ratspace Rehearsal Studio manager and sound engineer, music festival production assistant, event driver, arts council jurist, arts organization board member, voice teacher, photographer, poster artist, and milliner.


Martin Worthy has been enjoying life as a musician since he began playing drums as a 12 yr old. He met his lifelong friend and musical partner, Paul Quarrington, in high school and they soon established themselves as  Quarrington/Worthy, a singer-songwriter duo in the early 1970s. They released a number of recordings together, with their self-titled album leading to a #1AOR hit - "Baby and the Blues", engineered by Daniel Lanois. During that period, Martin also played drums in the rhythm section for the legendary Joe Hall and the Continental Drift (with Paul Quarrington joining him on bass). Since those early years, Martin has composed music for various film and video projects, recordings and bands. Currently, he is singing and playing drums and a variety of other instruments in Stuart Laughton's eclectic band Radio Dial. Prior to this, he was a member of the well-known blues/roots band, Pork Belly Futures for many years, writing songs and playing numerous gigs as their drummer and vocalist. Throughout his career, he has continued to work as a singer/songwriter, receiving an Ontario Arts Council Grant to write a series of songs inspired by Canadian novels in the late '90s, and most recently, releasing his own CD - "Everyone's Gone to the Moon". More information about Martin can be found at martinworthy.com.


Tim Posgate plays guitar, banjo, mandolin and fiddle.  He has recorded Eight CDs (Most recent is the soon-to-be released debut by So Long Seven) and toured in support of them internationally as well as performing at most of the major Canadian Music festivals. He is a member of many groups including So Long Seven,  The Cluttertones, Collette Savard Band and The Lipliners,. Tim has also performed with Jane Bunnett, Jerry Douglas, the Shuffle Demons, Andrew Downing and Jaron Freeman-Fox among others. He lives in Little Italy with his wife and two sons.


Megan Worthy is a professional pianist and teacher who began playing the piano when she was six years old. Her first passion was classical music, but an emerging interest in jazz piano led her to enter into Humber College's prestigious four year B.F.A. degree program, where she focused on jazz performance and pedagogy. She also had the opportunity to study jazz with many great jazz piano players, including David Virelles, Nancy Walker, Brian Dickinson, and Bernie Senesky. Megan has extensive experience as a professional accompanist, recording artist and performer. She has recording credits on two albums with the Canadian band, Pork Belly Futures and also recorded a single with Turkey-based EDM artist DJ Tarkan, creating an international pop song that has been making waves online. Currently Megan is composing, playing keys and singing harmonies with local band Edgewater Hotel who recently celebrated the release of their debut EP. Edgewater Hotel can be seen playing at iconic Toronto venues such as The Horseshoe Tavern and The Silver Dollar. Megan can also be found playing and singing solo at various venues in the GTA.
