Martin Worthy has been enjoying life as a musician since he began playing drums as a 12 yr old. He met his lifelong friend and musical partner, Paul Quarrington, in high school and they soon established themselves as  Quarrington/Worthy, a singer-songwriter duo in the early 1970s. They released a number of recordings together, with their self-titled album leading to a #1AOR hit - "Baby and the Blues", engineered by Daniel Lanois. During that period, Martin also played drums in the rhythm section for the legendary Joe Hall and the Continental Drift (with Paul Quarrington joining him on bass). Since those early years, Martin has composed music for various film and video projects, recordings and bands. Currently, he is singing and playing drums and a variety of other instruments in Stuart Laughton's eclectic band Radio Dial. Prior to this, he was a member of the well-known blues/roots band, Pork Belly Futures for many years, writing songs and playing numerous gigs as their drummer and vocalist. Throughout his career, he has continued to work as a singer/songwriter, receiving an Ontario Arts Council Grant to write a series of songs inspired by Canadian novels in the late '90s, and most recently, releasing his own CD - "Everyone's Gone to the Moon". More information about Martin can be found at martinworthy.com.
Tim Posgate plays guitar, banjo, mandolin and fiddle.  He has recorded Eight CDs (Most recent is the soon-to-be released debut by So Long Seven) and toured in support of them internationally as well as performing at most of the major Canadian Music festivals. He is a member of many groups including So Long Seven,  The Cluttertones, Collette Savard Band and The Lipliners,. Tim has also performed with Jane Bunnett, Jerry Douglas, the Shuffle Demons, Andrew Downing and Jaron Freeman-Fox among others. He lives in Little Italy with his wife and two sons.
Megan Worthy is a professional pianist and teacher who began playing the piano when she was six years old. Her first passion was classical music, but an emerging interest in jazz piano led her to enter into Humber College's prestigious four year B.F.A. degree program, where she focused on jazz performance and pedagogy. She also had the opportunity to study jazz with many great jazz piano players, including David Virelles, Nancy Walker, Brian Dickinson, and Bernie Senesky. Megan has extensive experience as a professional accompanist, recording artist and performer. She has recording credits on two albums with the Canadian band, Pork Belly Futures and also recorded a single with Turkey-based EDM artist DJ Tarkan, creating an international pop song that has been making waves online. Currently Megan is composing, playing keys and singing harmonies with local band Edgewater Hotel who recently celebrated the release of their debut EP. Edgewater Hotel can be seen playing at iconic Toronto venues such as The Horseshoe Tavern and The Silver Dollar. Megan can also be found playing and singing solo at various venues in the GTA.

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone,
Our names our Steven and Sarah Cardwell. We have been married for 9 years and have two wonderful kids. Collectively we make up a duo called Crenshaw. We have been very blessed to be able to write and share our music with those around us but would love the opportunity to share our new music with a larger audience with our second album. We have both been singing and playing since we were teens ( actually that's how we found each other). Our love for music is huge and we want to share that. We hope you will consider contributing, no matter what the amount. Thanks and have a great day !!

Crenshaw (Steven and Sarah Cardwell)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are needing funds for tracking, mixing, as well as distribution. We really want to do this the very best we can for those listening.
  • We have a lot of perks we are willing to give to those who wouldn't mind partnering with us. 

The Impact

For those who know us, know this is a big deal for us and for those who have been asking about it. A second, full length album would be monumental.

If you can't contribute...It's completely okay. If this is supposed to happen, then it will. We would just ask you do two things for us regardless if you contribute or not.


1. Keep us in your thoughts and prayers.

2. Share the heck out of this for us. WE REALLY APPRECIATE YOU!!!

story:
THE LONDONIANS 

Hey There, 

We are Billy Deen and Jason Napier from the band Los Angeles based rock/pop/soul group called The Londonians. 


We met 4 years ago though mutual friends and bands, and became close friends and songwriting partners, and this year formed our group and began the early stages of work on our debut album with acclaimed producer Jean-Michel Guirao.

We are here asking if you will join in with us on this arduous journey.

A journey to help us finish and fund our self titled debut album. Our first album.

It has been such a great experience taking the first steps in making this album - really - we are humbled and appreciative in asking for your help. Your support is helping us make a dream come true.

This debut album is our new journey. Pouring our lives into it. Over the past years we've had lots of new life experiences and this is a new phase for us.  This album is really about love, life, and new beginnings. Sometimes something has to end for something new to begin. 

We have already headed to the studio to start recording this new collection of songs, but we need your help to finish the recordings, press them, and market them. 

What We Need & What You Get

 We are trying to raise funds for this new album. Music like anything is a process that takes time, investment, and promotion.  We want to use the money to finish the studio time of course, but that's just a small part of the process.  After that, we want to get this album physically distributed in the form of CD's and Vinyl, as well as digitally - iTunes, Spotify, Pandora and more.  We'll also be trying to get this album some serious play and promotion including trying to get songs synced to film.  We've got loads of sweet perks and awesome rewards that we are looking forward to sharing with you as well.


The Impact

Music production, recording costs, distribution and promotion can all be pretty expensive and we are being very careful in how we spend every penny in making this album.  We also want to make a great product and our ultimate goal is to further our careers. As we said above, we are making an amazing album that we intend to license for TV and film. We've come a long way and it's time to take the next step.

•Supporting this projects means you support up and coming local music.

•Funding this project means you were a part of creating an amazing record with credit and a lifetime of satisfaction knowing you were part of the journey.

•Every dollar you give to this project goes directly toward costs for recording, physical/digital distribution, Marketing/PR and videos.

Risks & Challenges

 Any project like this has inherent risks and challenges.  For our debut album we are aiming for a bigger outcome and that requires a bigger budget.  It's possible that we could not make our goal.  But we can guarantee that this album will get made.  We've already laid down six tracks and are looking to finish the rest in the following months.

We are really trying to make a career as a band; being independent is difficult but doable.  We were so elated that you helped us all make our first record we wanted to ask you to join in with us on this journey. We want this record to stand out and be heard by more ears than we can imagine and making the best possible record, with the best possible songs is the first step.  We are approaching this project with blood, sweat, and tears and no lack of humility.  We need your help and we are confident we are making something special.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes it's hard financially to support such a big project but there are so many ways to help!  You could join our INDIEGOGO team and help share this campaign!

-You could also share this with every person you have an email for.

-You can share it on your Facebook or your twitter- let's not forget Instagram. 

-Help us spread the word - We will honestly be forever grateful.

A million thank you's and we hope you can lend support any way you can.

God bless.   - Billy & Jason

/

-Help us spread the word - We will honestly be forever grateful.
A million thank you's and we hope you can lend support any way you can.


God bless.   - Billy & Jason

/

story:
Hello friends, family and fans,

As you know, I've been playing shows touring on the road and beyond since April of 2015. In Colorado I was blessed with "Clarice" a 1985 ford E350 tour bus that had been customized into a cool RV vehicle perfect for getting to my shows and living in. When I got back from doing shows in Germany for three months, the muffler cylinder blew when I started her up. I was relieved to know this was only a minor repair.  So I picked up some rideshare people and headed to my next destination. I was on my way to Orcas Island, Washington for some shows and holiday rest. In Federal Way, Washington, funny noises from the engine started to appear, so I headed to nearest off ramp to check it out. When I got to the end of the off ramp something blew and Clarice stalled right there in the middle of traffic. I got her towed to the mechanic and got a ride from an angel to Orcas and waited for the diagnosis. Worst fears realized, Clarice needs a new engine and muffler fixed. 

This is the only place in a 300 mile radius that can do the job.

 

I know the total doesn't match the amount I'm asking for, but i'm choosing a realistic goal to raise and asking for miracles. My goal is to keep touring for the next 2 years, sharing my music all over the country and the world. I am also using Clarice as a mobile recording studio to provide my engineering and producing services for musicians in need to get there music out there. I'm am also providing a rideshare incentive to help share in gas expense and to help good souls  get to their destination.

If wish to know more about me, go to www.milomatthews.com or Facebook/Milo... an in depth look of what I am about.

I have also accepted the fact that if Clarice cannot be fixed, your funds would go to helping purchase a new vehicle which some say I should do already. I believe the universe gifted me Clarice to help fulfill my purpose in this life. That purpose is to share my music and life with the world, and to help others on the path to their dreams.  She is such a unique and special vehicle. No amount is too small and no dream is too big!!! Thank you very much for your time and your help. Many blessing to you all and lets get Clarice back on road to musical bliss.

story:
WHAT IS THE HUMAN EP

The making of Human began after the release of our first project "The Melody". The most received song off that EP was called "Beautiful Thing" which focused on the stories of the kiddos I (Myra) have had the opportunity to work with in the foster care system. Gabe and I knew -with the relatively small success of that song- that we had to go deeper with our songwriting and expose more than just the basics of love. We knew we had to give a voice to those who struggled to get their's heard. Over the past 7 years I have had the privilege of mentoring kiddos in the foster care system focusing on therapeutic treatment such as developing coping skills, Independent living skills and pro- social skills. I have listened to their stories, felt their burdens and ultimately have just let them cry in my car because that is what they needed. I knew I had to give them a voice, and that's when the collaboration between Gabes' melodies and the songwriting started to collide. 
5 songs are going to be on this EP that capture the heart of what it means to be Human.These kiddos have a need to feel accepted. They want to be viewed not just as a child in the foster care system, but as a human being, not defined by their past but by who they are and everything they are trying to be.  
Identity is what we as a society are constantly trying to find an answer for. These songs are universal to not only the kiddos I have worked with, but for anyone and everyone. We are all just trying to be Human. 

ACOUSTIC VERSION OF OUR FIRST SINGLE. "Human"



WHO IS STEREO RV?

Gabe and Myra Gleason make up the Percussive Soul/Pop duo Stereo RV. They recently changed their name from "Pending Black" due to the name not being rooted in who they are as a duo. Stereo RV is broken down into three categories. 1) Stereo is dual, you have your left and your right. 2) Beatbox used to be an old-school name for a stereo. 3) We have  been living in our 1989 Trendsetter RV for over 3 years now. It was our first home together after we got married and all our growth as artists has been developed in 250ft of space. WE still currently work full-time but that is about to change in September as we take a leap of faith and pursue music full-time in hopes of having some dreams come true.

With any goal or dream comes risk. We are done recording 5 of the songs for Human, however we are at the top of our budget and need help. Which is where you come in. WE STRIVE TO DO AS MUCH AS WE CAN BY OURSELVES, but we find ourselves asking for some help with the completion of this EP.  We are asking for $3,500 dollars that will get our album mixed and  mastered from engineers in the industry who understand the detail of making a "radio-ready" record. It also includes the copies of CD's we will need to be printed so you all can have one! Plus, we also have booked a full fledged tour that we embark on in October and goes until the end of November, So whatever we raise over the $3500 goes right back into the music and helps with tour expenses.  

AS A COLLABORATOR ON THIS PROJECT, YOU SHOULD KNOW HOW YOUR INVESTMENT IS BEING USED!

Gabe and I have written all the songs on this EP. We recorded 3 of songs at Fremont Recording with Justin Calhoun behind the production wheel.
We just got back from an amazing time in New York working with 2 time ASCAP award winning producer, John Degrazio with Watersound Entertainment where we recorded 2 more songs for the  EP. Because we recorded in different studios there is high importance that the mix and mastering be cohesive. John will be finishing the mixing and mastering for this project on all 5 songs.

Know where your investment is going! 

Here's the breakdown.

Mixing and Mastering will be 50% of the costs
PR and Marketing will be 35% of the costs - (Cause you guys want it to be a huge hit just as much as us right?!) We have hired Kaytea with XOpublicity to get these tunes out to industry and ears we could never reach. We're excited to have her on board!
Getting the CD's made and duplicated is about 15%

Protect your investment! So many ways to help reach our goal!



The Impact

We have been working on this EP for over 2 years and we are incredibly excited about it. The foster care community and it's impact on mine and Gabe's life in the Salem/Portland areas has influenced us in ways that aren't easy to express. The small lives I get to encounter on a daily basis have had a deep impact on the way I see humanity. This project is so important because of the affect it can potentially have on anyone who has been trying to discover who they are and what it means to just be a person on this earth. 
YOUR CONTRIBUTION makes you apart of our project. We are reaching out to you, OUR COMMUNITY, who has supported us, asking you to make a commitment to our music by sharing and supporting this campaign. WE do not take your kindness for granted and it will not go unnoticed. ( SEE PERKS).

WE can't thank you enough for the support we have received over the years. To those who have come out to our shows and been our "Woo" people, to the sharing of our videos and telling your friends, we thank you so deeply. 
NOW is the chance to help us fulfill our dreams a little more. Please consider giviving financially if you can or if you can't, would you consider sharing our campaign? Telling everyone about it. 
We are so excited for you all to hear these new songs!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help

SHARE SHARE SHARE this campaign.

Tell your friends. Come to a show. Spread the word. 

THANK YOU!!!!!!

story:
Short Summary

Why fund Octovox and our Christmas music video?

  • We've been singing for about 3 years and want to be able to share our music with a larger audience online
  • It's really important to us as a group and will give us a chance to put our talents as singers into a different environment - recording studios and filming locations.
  • In reaching our goal of £500 we will be able to put together an incredible music video and will be able to share this with the world online. It gives us a chance to sing for as many people as possible, with a professional image and sound.

Please donate now! Your support is greatly appreciated. If you would like more information, do keep reading.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need about £1000 to make the video. We have £500 in the bank for this so far and need help raising the other half.
  • We have some amazing perks for you if you donate. You could be in the music video as an extra, or we could send you a personalised Thank You video. A larger donation could mean we would come and sing for you at an event of your choosing! There are many more perks starting at just £1 so have a look now!
  • The money will be used to pay for hiring a film crew, paying fees for locations and equipment. We will also be needing to spend a day in a recording studio to make sure the audio for the video is perfect. 
  • If we don't reach our target we will still be able to make the video, but with the lower budget we may not be able to afford the snow machine or the reindeer, but the video would still go ahead and you would still be a part of the video and making it a reality.
  • If we exceed our target, then additional money will be able to go towards making the video even bigger and better with more props and effects being able to be used. We would also be able to make the official screening night a more glitzy and glamourous event. Some perks include a ticket to the VIP screening so donate now!
  • If we smash our target, we would be able to use the money to go towards future projects, other music videos or recordings, or put towards an education project which would bring Octovox into schools.

The Impact

  • A Cappella music is massive right now, thanks to TV shows like Glee and films like Pitch Perfect. We're not just jumping on the bandwagon, but are making our own important contribution.
  • Octovox is not a regular choir. We have always strived for great musical performances, but have also wanted to keep a sense of fun. Making this video will be a fun and uplifting thing for everyone to watch and could potentially bring joy to millions* of people.
  • By donating, you would be playing a huge part in the future of Octovox. This might just seem like another music video, but to us it is a massive part of our future and getting people to hear our music.
*or maybe just Paul's mum.

Risks & Challenges

A brand new project always comes with obstacles, and we are ready for these. Very few of us in Octovox have ever been filmed for a music video like this before, and some have never been inside a recording studio before.

  • Money raised will be able to provide funding for professional film crews and a director who will be guiding us through what we need to do.
  • Meetings between Octovox and the director of the video are and will be taking place to come up with the storyboard of the video as well as making sure things run smoothing from the filming day itself right up until the screening itself.
  • We will be able to hire a professional sound engineer who will be able to mix our vocals seamlessly when we are in a studio. It might be new to some of us, but with the proper guidance we will get an impressive finished product

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to donate, which is fine, or once you have donated you may want to do more:

  • Share our funding page with your friends and family and neighbours on Facebook or Twitter or on the street lamp outside your house. The more people who hear about our video, the easier it will be to achieve our goal.
  • We may need help with props or costumes. If you have access to anything like this, we would love to talk to you!
  • Likewise, we will be looking for locations to film in, if you have a roaring fireplace then get in touch!

And that's all there is to it. Thank you for your time reading this, please donate what you can.

Thank you

Octovox
xxx
story_txt:
Short Summary Why fund Octovox and our Christmas music video?  We've been singing for about 3 years and want to be able to share our music with a larger audience online It's really important to us as a group and will give us a chance to put our talents as singers into a different environment - recording studios and filming locations. In reaching our goal of £500 we will be able to put together an incredible music video and will be able to share this with the world online. It gives us a chance to sing for as many people as possible, with a professional image and sound.  Please donate now! Your support is greatly appreciated. If you would like more information, do keep reading.   What We Need & What You Get 
We need about £1000 to make the video. We have £500 in the bank for this so far and need help raising the other half. We have some amazing perks for you if you donate. You could be in the music video as an extra, or we could send you a personalised Thank You video. A larger donation could mean we would come and sing for you at an event of your choosing! There are many more perks starting at just £1 so have a look now! The money will be used to pay for hiring a film crew, paying fees for locations and equipment. We will also be needing to spend a day in a recording studio to make sure the audio for the video is perfect. 
If we don't reach our target we will still be able to make the video, but with the lower budget we may not be able to afford the snow machine or the reindeer, but the video would still go ahead and you would still be a part of the video and making it a reality.
If we exceed our target, then additional money will be able to go towards making the video even bigger and better with more props and effects being able to be used. We would also be able to make the official screening night a more glitzy and glamourous event. Some perks include a ticket to the VIP screening so donate now!
If we smash our target, we would be able to use the money to go towards future projects, other music videos or recordings, or put towards an education project which would bring Octovox into schools.    The Impact 
A Cappella music is massive right now, thanks to TV shows like Glee and films like Pitch Perfect. We're not just jumping on the bandwagon, but are making our own important contribution. Octovox is not a regular choir. We have always strived for great musical performances, but have also wanted to keep a sense of fun. Making this video will be a fun and uplifting thing for everyone to watch and could potentially bring joy to millions* of people.

By donating, you would be playing a huge part in the future of Octovox. This might just seem like another music video, but to us it is a massive part of our future and getting people to hear our music.
 
*or maybe just Paul's mum.   Risks & Challenges  A brand new project always comes with obstacles, and we are ready for these. Very few of us in Octovox have ever been filmed for a music video like this before, and some have never been inside a recording studio before.  Money raised will be able to provide funding for professional film crews and a director who will be guiding us through what we need to do.
Meetings between Octovox and the director of the video are and will be taking place to come up with the storyboard of the video as well as making sure things run smoothing from the filming day itself right up until the screening itself. We will be able to hire a professional sound engineer who will be able to mix our vocals seamlessly when we are in a studio. It might be new to some of us, but with the proper guidance we will get an impressive finished product    Other Ways You Can Help You might not be able to donate, which is fine, or once you have donated you may want to do more:  Share our funding page with your friends and family and neighbours on Facebook or Twitter or on the street lamp outside your house. The more people who hear about our video, the easier it will be to achieve our goal. We may need help with props or costumes. If you have access to anything like this, we would love to talk to you!
Likewise, we will be looking for locations to film in, if you have a roaring fireplace then get in touch!   And that's all there is to it. Thank you for your time reading this, please donate what you can.Thank youOctovoxxxx

story:
ENGLISH / ITALIANO a seguire

Hi everyone,

My name is Caramè and I'm a singer songwriter from Italy. A year ago I recorded and produced my first album and since then I've been sharing it with the world through performing many concerts, touring in Europe and playing in the street.

The way my music has been received is so incredible that I sold the 1000 copies I printed in little more than a year!!!

Encouraged by this success and inspired by many stories I decided to record in a new album the songs I've wrote during this journey.

This album should reflect the maturity I gained in life, in music and the inspiration I draw from the black american music. It is also coming from a desire to collaborate with some fantastic musicians I've met along the way. To make it more vibrant and colorful, I chose to record this new album entirely live.

Below you can find more details about why and how I'm doing this.

In this video I perform my song "Just a Smile" for 'SofarSound Milan' 

 

Where the Funds Will Go 

Making this project is not an easy, nor a cheap mission to complete.  
Here is a breakdown of the budget that will cover the cost of:

  • Recording, arranging, mixing, mastering
  • Artwork, Graphics, Website, Video and etc.
  • CD manufacturing and printing
  • Marketing, PR, promotion
  • Creating and posting your gifts (Perks)
  • IndieGoGo and Credit card fees

At This Stage

  • If you wish to Pre-order the album then check on the right side for the  list of perks and the amount you wish to choose >>

It is better If you can, do it straight away for 2 reasons:

1. It will help my crowd funding to take off by getting an early momentum.

2. Later on you might just forget. 

Also, I kindly invite you to share this project with your friends via social networks, email or the word of mouth.  This would help a lot to make this dream come true.

Find some more project info below

These videos were filmed during the recordings of my first album!

  

Special thanks to Alberto Zanini (Guitar), Giacomo Papetti (Bass), Marco Ravelli (Keys) and Filippo Sala (Drums)

Project Budget Breakdown

 

Risks & Challenges

The recording process of this album will start in January 2017 and I hope to complete it by the end of the month.

Regardless the success of this fund-raising campaign I am committed to complete this project and even if we don't reach the funding goal I will still get this album out. Your help will really help the financial aspect of it and validate my work as an emerging singer/song-writer.

It is also an opportunity to be part of a meaningful artistic project and to get my album before everyone else :)

Other Ways You Could Help

Spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends, your family or with anyone you think would enjoy the music and have interest for this project is another very helpful way to support me.

Here's some suggestion about how you can do it:

  • sharing the campaign video on your Facebook page
  • directing people to my IndieGoGo page or to my website
  • through "word of mouth"
  • sending emails
  • sharing the campaign on music websites, blogs, radio and magazines

Thank you for your support!

Stay tuned for many more updates are coming.

Do not hesitate to email me with any questions.

caramemusic@gmail.com    

ADDITIONAL LINKS:

FB: https://www.facebook.com/caramemusic/

SOUNDCLOUD: https://soundcloud.com/caramemusic

FULL VIDEO OF 'INSIDE OF ME': https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mDw0tE_5dVk

You can find me also on Spotify, iTunes, Amazon, Google play, Deezer, etc.etc.

 

ITALIANO

 

Ciao a tutti,

Il mio nome è Caramè e sono un cantautore d'origine italiana. Un anno fa ho registrato e prodotto il mio primo album, condividendolo fino ad ora con il mondo attraverso concerti, tour in Europa e suonando per strada.

La risposta ricevuta dalla gente nei confronti della mia musica è stata così incredibile che ho venduto le 1000 copie stampate in poco più di un anno!!!

Incoraggiato da questo successo e ispirato da tante altre vicissitudini ho deciso di registrare in un nuovo album le canzoni che ho scritto durante questo percorso.

L'album vuole riflettere la maturità da me acquisita fino d'ora sia nella vita tutti i giorni che nella musica, e trarre ispirazione dalla musica nera americana. Inoltre è frutto anche del desiderio di collaborare con fantastici musicisti che ho incontrato lungo il mio cammino, con i quali, per renderlo ancora più vibrante e colorato ho deciso di registrarlo completamente dal vivo!

Qui sotto trovate tutti i dettagli relativi al come supportare il progetto.

In questo video eseguo la mia canzone "Just a Smile" per 'SofarSound Milano' 

 

Come saranno investiti i fondi raccolti:

Affrontare un progetto del genere non e facile, soprattutto economicamente e quindi ho pensato di chiedere supporto anche alla rete di amici e conoscenti che in questi anni ho visto crescere intorno a me . Ecco qui la suddivisione del budget che coprirà i costi:

  • Marketing, PR, promozione
  • Studio di registrazione, arrangiamenti, mixaggio e musicisti
  • Lavori di grafica, Website, Video, etc..
  • Stampa e confezionamenoto dei CD
  • Creare ed inviare via posta le vostre 'ricompense' o 'Perks'
  • Spese dovute a "IndieGoGo" per la campagna fondi

A questo punto:

  • Se desideri Pre-ordinare l'album in questione dai un occhiata in alto a destra e troverai la lista con le "ricompense o perks" corrispondenti alla somma che desideri donare >>

È meglio se puoi farlo subito per 2 motivi:

1. Aiuti la mia campagna nel suo decollo!

2. Se rimandi va a finire che magari ti dimentichi! 

Inoltre, ti chiedo la cortesia di condividere questo progetto con i tuoi amici tramite i Social Networks, Email o semplicemente passando parola. Questo aiuterà molto al fine che il mio progetto diventi realtà.

Ecco altre info riguardanti il progetto

Questi video sono stati registrati in studio durante le registrazioni del mio primo cd!

                

     

Ringrazio Alberto Zanini (Guitar), Giacomo Papetti (Bass), Marco Ravelli (Keys) e Filippo Sala (Drums)

Suddivisione del Budget

Rischi & Sfide

Il processo di registrazione dell'album avrà inizio a Gennaio e spero si completerà per gli inizi di Febbraio 2017.

Il mio impegno è quello di portare a termine l'album anche se la raccolta fondi non raggiungerà la somma desiderata ed e per questo che il tuo supporto aiuterà molto il suo aspetto finanziario ed a valorizzare il mio emergere come cantautore. 

Altri modi per dare supporto

Spargere la voce e condividere questa campagna con i tuoi amici, i tuoi famigliari e con chiunque tu pensi possa apprezzare la mia musica ed essere interessato a questo progetto.

Ecco qui alcuni suggerimenti sul come farlo:

  • condividere il link della raccolta sulla tua pagina FB
  • reindirizzare amici e non alla mia pagina IndieGoGo 
  • spargere la voce 
  • mandare un'email 
  • fare pubblicità ad eventuali riviste musicali, blog o siti internet di tua conoscenza

Grazie per supportare questo progetto!

Rimani in contatto per eventuali aggiornamenti e non esitare a contattarmi per qualsiasi domanda e chiarimento riguardanti il progetto, la mia musica e le ricompense: caramemusic@gmail.com    

VARI LINK PER CONOSCERMI MEGLIO:

FB: https://www.facebook.com/caramemusic/

SOUNDCLOUD: https://soundcloud.com/caramemusic

FULL VIDEO OF 'INSIDE OF ME': https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mDw0tE_5dVk

Mi trovi anche su Spotify, iTunes, Amazon, Google play, Deezer, etc.etc.

story:
Hola soy David Gómez,

Compartir mi viaje con algunos de ustedes durante los últimos años ha sido una experiencia increíble, y les agradezco desde el fondo de mi corazón todo el cariño y apoyo que me han mostrado. Muchos de ustedes sabrán que he estado trabajando para este nuevo proyecto de álbum durante algún tiempo, y sin ustedes gran parte de lo planeado no podria realizarse.

Mi música siempre cuenta una historia y ahora todos y cada uno de ustedes pueden ser parte de mi historia: preencargando mi álbum, escogiendo una de las ventajas especiales creadas y compartiéndolo con su familia y amigos.

La cantidad generada por su generoso apoyo cubrirá todos los costes, y cualquier superávit se destinará a vídeos adicionales, marketing y promoción, ayudándonos así a llegar a un público internacional más amplio.

Si desea encargar previamente el álbum, compruebe en el lado derecho la cantidad que desea elegir y la lista correspondiente de ventajas.

• Ayude a promover mi página y vídeo de Indiegogo compartiéndolo en las redes sociales

• Envíe por correo electrónico a sus amigos y familia en todo el mundo mi enlace de Indiegogo.

• ¡Simplemente difunda la palabra de cualquier manera posible!

Espero de todo corazón que logremos nuestro objetivo ... ¡juntos podemos llevar a la vida 'Pianographie'!

 ¡Acompáñanos y participa en mi nuevo disco!

"Tenga en cuenta que, aunque las" ventajas "se enumeran en libras, su pago será procesado en la moneda de su país.

Por favor, visite  https://www.oanda.com/currency/converter/

para un convertidor de moneda en tiempo real que puede utilizar para calcular la cantidad que va a pagar".

Gracias por tu apoyo

David 

 

Hi my name is David Gómez,  

I am a pianist & composer... a musical storyteller and music is my life...it's why I am here! 

I want to invite you to join me on a journey of hope…to a place where dreams are made.

'The Island' was my debut album as a composer and was inspired by the solitary life that I lead travelling around the world giving concerts.  Recorded in 2011 at Riverfish Studios with record producer Joe Dworniak, in Penzance, Cornwall and released by Riverfish Records in 2013.

The success of ‘The Island’  and my concerts '1 Piano & 200 Candles' enabled me to continue to compose beautiful and passionate music to share.  Now almost four years on, I am once again collaborating with Joe Dworniak recording new compositions to release this year.

Come and join me in the realisation of my second album, 'Pianographie'. 

Sharing my journey with some of you over the past few years has been an incredible experience, and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for all the love and support you have shown me.  Many of you will know that I have been working towards this new album project for some time and without you much of what is planned cannot happen.

I have said before that "a piano is simply magical furniture" and with this magic and your help we will bring 'Pianographie' to life! 

My music always tells a story and now each and everyone of you can be part of my story by pre-ordering my album, contributing by taking up one of the special perks created and sharing with your family & friends.

Bringing 'Pianographie' to life is not an easy mission, and it is not cheap (please see below for a breakdown of the budget). 

The amount generated from your generous support will cover all costs and any surplus will go towards additional videos, marketing & promotion thus helping us to reach a wider international audience.

  • Recording, mixing, mastering, artwork creation, website update, manufacturing and distribution of the album.
  • 2-3 professional music videos/short films + other visual material needed to support the release.
  • A creative integrated PR & Marketing campaign to reach new territories and Piano music lovers around the world.
  • Indiegogo and credit card fees plus the creation and delivery of the special unique perks offered.
  • 3 Album launches – London, Berlin & Barcelona.
  • The support and input of my team at Riverfish Music. 

Its been said that there is nothing more powerful than ‘word of mouth’ so with your help we can share my dream around the world...You can make my heart smile by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family, asking them to share with their friends to spread the story far & wide, creating a ripple effect across Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Email.

For now I ask you to...

  • Please read the important information below
  • If you wish to pre-order the album, then check on the right side for the amount you wish to choose and the corresponding list of perks.

Gracias

David 

 

 

 
 
 
 

 

¡Colaborar y trabajar con un equipo tan apasionado y dedicado es una bendición!

Collaborating and Working with a team that is passionate & dedicated is a blessing!

 

Joe Dworniak - Arranger/Producer (Arrangements, Soundscapes, Recording & Mixing) 

Alyssa Lynch - Violin

Danny Jones - Cello

Poppy Weinberger - Riverfish Mastering 

Jean-Luke Epstein - Graphic Designer 

Fernando de France - Film Maker & Photographer

Maria de France - Video Production & Styling

Vicky Daniel - Project Director

Mandy Cronje - Project Manager (Campaign Film & Album Cover Photography)

Baylee McWilliams - Project Assistant

Rosa LLabrés - Spanish Translation

Meibel Castle - Assistant in Spain

Snoopy - Wellbeing Coordinator

*Special thanks to Yamaha UK for providing the ‘magical instrument’

(This album was recorded on a Yamaha N2 AvantGrand Piano)

 

 

 

 

The pie chart below illustrates where your generous support will go...

 

  • 25% Recording (Piano Hire & Musicians), Production, Mixing & Mastering - £12,000
  •   4% Artwork, Graphic Design, Website - £2,000
  •   6% CD & Vinyl Manufacturing - £3,000
  • 16%  Photography  and Video's - £8,000
  • 31%  Launch, Promotion, PR & Marketing Campaign - £15,000
  • 10%  Perks Production & Delivery - £5,000
  •   7%  Indiegogo & Credit Card Fees  - £3,600

 

 

 

•   Help promote my Indiegogo page & video by sharing it on social media 

•   Email your friends and family across the globe with my Indiegogo link.

•   Just simply spread the word in any way possible!  

 

 

 

We want to take this album onto the International stage to reach new audiences and that means working with an external PR company with offices in London, Berlin & New York.  If we do not achieve our financial goal, please don't worry!   We still aim to release 'Pianographie' no matter what, but naturally we will have to sacrifice some elements.  

I hope in my heart, that we will achieve our goal... together, we can bring 'Pianographie' to life!

 

 

 

"I project my emotions through the piano"

Born in Switzerland 1974, David Gómez was introduced to Music by Marta Christel at a very early age.  Inspired by his mothers love of music, he continued his musical education with Professor Emilio Muriscot and Claudie Desmeules (Professor at Geneva Conservatory).  He continued to develop his skills under the tutelage of Michael Davidson at The Rotterdam Conservatory (Netherlands).  He has undergone several specialisation courses with prestigious pianists such as; Roberto Bravo, Walter Hauzig and Ramón Coll.

David gave his first concert at the age of 14, and since then he has performed recitals as a soloist and chamber musician.  His remarkable rendition of Mozart's ‘Sonatas for Piano', is to be highlighted as well as many other successful appearances at International Festivals.

He recorded his first album 'A.Piazzolla. Tangos para Piano', which was successfully presented in a number of European capitals with his performances gaining international recognition.  As a virtuoso pianist, David has played in legendary theatres such as Concertgebouw in Amsterdam, National Concert Hall in Dublin, St Martin in The Fields, London, Cairo Opera House, Carnegie Hall New York and The Chicago Cultural Centre.  He has also played in many other countries and was specially invited by the President of Honduras to offer a recital in the Presidential House.

David Gómez has received awards in several national and international contests: First prize at II Piano Contest at Miquel Ballester I Serra, Second prize at the V International Piano Contest 'Pio Tur' and at the National contest at 'Antoni Torrandell'.

 

 

 ¡Acompáñanos y participa en mi nuevo disco!
story_txt:
Hola soy David Gómez,Compartir mi viaje con algunos de ustedes durante los últimos años ha sido una experiencia increíble, y les agradezco desde el fondo de mi corazón todo el cariño y apoyo que me han mostrado. Muchos de ustedes sabrán que he estado trabajando para este nuevo proyecto de álbum durante algún tiempo, y sin ustedes gran parte de lo planeado no podria realizarse.Mi música siempre cuenta una historia y ahora todos y cada uno de ustedes pueden ser parte de mi historia: preencargando mi álbum, escogiendo una de las ventajas especiales creadas y compartiéndolo con su familia y amigos.La cantidad generada por su generoso apoyo cubrirá todos los costes, y cualquier superávit se destinará a vídeos adicionales, marketing y promoción, ayudándonos así a llegar a un público internacional más amplio.Si desea encargar previamente el álbum, compruebe en el lado derecho la cantidad que desea elegir y la lista correspondiente de ventajas.• Ayude a promover mi página y vídeo de Indiegogo compartiéndolo en las redes sociales• Envíe por correo electrónico a sus amigos y familia en todo el mundo mi enlace de Indiegogo.• ¡Simplemente difunda la palabra de cualquier manera posible!Espero de todo corazón que logremos nuestro objetivo ... ¡juntos podemos llevar a la vida 'Pianographie'! ¡Acompáñanos y participa en mi nuevo disco!"Tenga en cuenta que, aunque las" ventajas "se enumeran en libras, su pago será procesado en la moneda de su país. Por favor, visite  https://www.oanda.com/currency/converter/para un convertidor de moneda en tiempo real que puede utilizar para calcular la cantidad que va a pagar".Gracias por tu apoyoDavid  Hi my name is David Gómez,  I am a pianist & composer... a musical storyteller and music is my life...it's why I am here! I want to invite you to join me on a journey of hope…to a place where dreams are made.'The Island' was my debut album as a composer and was inspired by the solitary life that I lead travelling around the world giving concerts.  Recorded in 2011 at Riverfish Studios with record producer Joe Dworniak, in Penzance, Cornwall and released by Riverfish Records in 2013.The success of ‘The Island’  and my concerts '1 Piano & 200 Candles' enabled me to continue to compose beautiful and passionate music to share.  Now almost four years on, I am once again collaborating with Joe Dworniak recording new compositions to release this year.Come and join me in the realisation of my second album, 'Pianographie'. Sharing my journey with some of you over the past few years has been an incredible experience, and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for all the love and support you have shown me.  Many of you will know that I have been working towards this new album project for some time and without you much of what is planned cannot happen.I have said before that "a piano is simply magical furniture" and with this magic and your help we will bring 'Pianographie' to life! My music always tells a story and now each and everyone of you can be part of my story by pre-ordering my album, contributing by taking up one of the special perks created and sharing with your family & friends.Bringing 'Pianographie' to life is not an easy mission, and it is not cheap (please see below for a breakdown of the budget). The amount generated from your generous support will cover all costs and any surplus will go towards additional videos, marketing & promotion thus helping us to reach a wider international audience.
Recording, mixing, mastering, artwork creation, website update, manufacturing and distribution of the album.
2-3 professional music videos/short films + other visual material needed to support the release.
A creative integrated PR & Marketing campaign to reach new territories and Piano music lovers around the world.
Indiegogo and credit card fees plus the creation and delivery of the special unique perks offered.
3 Album launches – London, Berlin & Barcelona.
The support and input of my team at Riverfish Music. 
Its been said that there is nothing more powerful than ‘word of mouth’ so with your help we can share my dream around the world...You can make my heart smile by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family, asking them to share with their friends to spread the story far & wide, creating a ripple effect across Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Email.For now I ask you to...
Please read the important information below
If you wish to pre-order the album, then check on the right side for the amount you wish to choose and the corresponding list of perks.
GraciasDavid        ¡Colaborar y trabajar con un equipo tan apasionado y dedicado es una bendición!Collaborating and Working with a team that is passionate & dedicated is a blessing! Joe Dworniak - Arranger/Producer (Arrangements, Soundscapes, Recording & Mixing) Alyssa Lynch - ViolinDanny Jones - CelloPoppy Weinberger - Riverfish Mastering Jean-Luke Epstein - Graphic Designer Fernando de France - Film Maker & PhotographerMaria de France - Video Production & StylingVicky Daniel - Project DirectorMandy Cronje - Project Manager (Campaign Film & Album Cover Photography)Baylee McWilliams - Project AssistantRosa LLabrés - Spanish TranslationMeibel Castle - Assistant in SpainSnoopy - Wellbeing Coordinator*Special thanks to Yamaha UK for providing the ‘magical instrument’ (This album was recorded on a Yamaha N2 AvantGrand Piano)    The pie chart below illustrates where your generous support will go... 
25% Recording (Piano Hire & Musicians), Production, Mixing & Mastering - £12,000
  4% Artwork, Graphic Design, Website - £2,000
  6% CD & Vinyl Manufacturing - £3,000
16%  Photography  and Video's - £8,000
31%  Launch, Promotion, PR & Marketing Campaign - £15,000
10%  Perks Production & Delivery - £5,000
  7%  Indiegogo & Credit Card Fees  - £3,600
   •   Help promote my Indiegogo page & video by sharing it on social media •   Email your friends and family across the globe with my Indiegogo link.•   Just simply spread the word in any way possible!     We want to take this album onto the International stage to reach new audiences and that means working with an external PR company with offices in London, Berlin & New York.  If we do not achieve our financial goal, please don't worry!   We still aim to release 'Pianographie' no matter what, but naturally we will have to sacrifice some elements.  I hope in my heart, that we will achieve our goal... together, we can bring 'Pianographie' to life!   "I project my emotions through the piano"Born in Switzerland 1974, David Gómez was introduced to Music by Marta Christel at a very early age.  Inspired by his mothers love of music, he continued his musical education with Professor Emilio Muriscot and Claudie Desmeules (Professor at Geneva Conservatory).  He continued to develop his skills under the tutelage of Michael Davidson at The Rotterdam Conservatory (Netherlands).  He has undergone several specialisation courses with prestigious pianists such as; Roberto Bravo, Walter Hauzig and Ramón Coll.David gave his first concert at the age of 14, and since then he has performed recitals as a soloist and chamber musician.  His remarkable rendition of Mozart's ‘Sonatas for Piano', is to be highlighted as well as many other successful appearances at International Festivals.He recorded his first album 'A.Piazzolla. Tangos para Piano', which was successfully presented in a number of European capitals with his performances gaining international recognition.  As a virtuoso pianist, David has played in legendary theatres such as Concertgebouw in Amsterdam, National Concert Hall in Dublin, St Martin in The Fields, London, Cairo Opera House, Carnegie Hall New York and The Chicago Cultural Centre.  He has also played in many other countries and was specially invited by the President of Honduras to offer a recital in the Presidential House.David Gómez has received awards in several national and international contests: First prize at II Piano Contest at Miquel Ballester I Serra, Second prize at the V International Piano Contest 'Pio Tur' and at the National contest at 'Antoni Torrandell'.   ¡Acompáñanos y participa en mi nuevo disco!

story:
I am a poet and singer-songwriter, originally from Hobart, Tasmania, now making my life and art in Phnom Penh.  I write about many things: life, love, destiny, Cambodia and water.  Lots of songs about water.  

In launching this campaign, I am essentially asking those who enjoy my songs to pre-order an album that I will be recording in the first quarter of 2017 with some of my favourite Phnom Penh musicians.  Funds will be used for recording, mixing, mastering, creating a music video, and managing the perks. 

The album will be available as a downloadable digipak (no CDs will be burned), with both digital and physical paraphernalia (formerly known as album art) to satisfy what Frank Zappa called "the rumple and fetish factor".

I am making available some specially designed tee-shirts, and a limited edition book of annotated selected lyrics, On the wind, in the night, I recall , for those who would like to contribute a little more.  There is also a Mentor Special package that includes a free Phnom Penh performance of the Scoddy Acoustic Trio.  

NOTE THAT SHIPPING IS NOT REQUIRED FOR CAMBODIA, ONLY OUTSIDE.

story:
All I've Left Behind Digital Release

"All I've Left Behind" is the follow up project to my debut EP "Beautiful Life".  For my second project, I wanted to reach into the depths of who I was as a songwriter, and show the shadow side of a "Beautiful Life", so although there are some fun, lighthearted songs,  there are also songs of heartache, change, and loss. As everyone knows, mountain top experiences are fun, but the valley is the sustainable place where growth occurs and life is truly lived. As a human being, and an artist, I'm learning to be fully present in the valleys and not just wish them away for the next mountain top which has brought a depth to me as a husband, father, and artist that wasn't realised before. As you journey through life, sometimes the only way to know what truly has value is to leave it behind for a time. This album is part of that story. And I need YOUR help to share that story!

What We Need & What You Get

We would LOVE to produce some beautiful film clips to coincide with the release of this album. The goal is to sync up our video and radio releases to maximise our exposure with the goal of seeing the album charting on Australian country music radio, and Australian Country Music Television.  To accomplish this, we are sending you PRE RELEASE, physical copies of this album in exchange for your contribution to our digital campaign. So you RECEIVE THIS ALBUM BEFORE THE REST OF THE WORLD, and get to help create some beautiful pieces of art!

We need to raise $10,000 to produce 3 film clips. 

  • In addition to the pre release album, other perks include:
    • Social Media Follow/Shoutout
    • Personalised social media song dedications
    • Opportunity to appear IN one of the music videos
    • Live performance house concerts 

The Art

What I enjoy most about my life in music is the opportunity to create something that moves people. It can be a smile, a tear, or just a second thought.  With my first EP, producing the film clips for the songs was my favourite part of the whole process, and has produced the most feedback from you.  They say a picture is worth a thousand words, and alongside Scott Christian from Radiant Media, we are ready to produce some beautiful pictures, moving in all their 4K glory.

The Challenges 

To really make an impact in the industry, we need to string of film clip releases alongside the radio release. The amount we raise determines the number of clips we can produce. We have a solid concept for 4 clips, we just need the financial support to see them come to life. If we only raise enough for 1 clip, thats where this journey will end. If we reach our goal of $10,000, we will be able to see 3 possibly all 4 of those ideas come to life! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We want you to contribute to one of the perk packages, but we also want to you share this campaign with your friends! Thanks for making the digital release of "All I've Left Behind" a reality!

story:
Hello all! I’m a singer-songwriter from Dunboyne, Co. Meath, Ireland. The first half of that term (the “singer” part) has always come very easily to me. I love the sound of my own voice and most people seem to be in agreement with me, which is lucky :) I had to work at the “songwriter” part - it didn’t really take hold fully until I was 24 and living in Seoul, South Korea. There, I met a really fun and supportive gang of friends - we inspired each other and played a lot of music together.

 

Unfortunately, the last time we were all together in the same place was in Ireland, just before I was taken into a psychiatric hospital, because I was having a manic episode. It’s a long story, but the upshot of it is that I have been searching for a band of like-minded musicians ever since but it has never really come together.

 

And I know in my heart (and my ears) that I do not have the musical talent to provide the accompaniment that would do these songs justice. I started playing the guitar when I was about 12 and I got to the level that I am at now when I was about 12 and a half. That’s not a good thing.

 

However, Rohan and Al from Beardfire Music do not suffer in this way, thankfully. They are great musicians and they have really shown a knack for finding ways to support and enhance the lyrics and basic melody of the songs. I think the album has turned out great - it’s really varied and interesting and most of that is down to the work that they have put in.

 

Usually in these campaigns, the first item on the list of where the money will go is towards recording costs but I’ve actually already paid that out of my own pocket. So, moving on, a good chunk will have to be spent on manufacturing the actual CDs themselves (as well as the packaging - I’m going for cardboard wallets) - and the more money that is raised, the more CDs I can order in one go, which will actually work out cheaper - yay!

 

I will also need to pay Lukas, who will be providing the artwork for the album cover and Ursula who is going to draw a beautiful hummingbird for the CD itself. Some funds will go to covering the cost of providing the perks for all you generous donors. Also, Indiegogo take a percentage of the funds raised which is how they keep going, I suppose. Finally, the remainder will go to promoting the album as best I can - again, the more money raised, the better this can be done.

 

I would love for you to get on board and support this project - and not for the obvious money reasons! Instead, I am reaching out to you now to make a connection and to forge a relationship - because I really want to share this music with you. If you have ever heard me sing and been moved by my voice or my words or my passion, I would love to build a lasting bond between us and allow you to feel that you’ve helped me on my way.

 

Now, if I don’t meet my target, it won't be the end of the world - any contribution will help and I have chosen Flexible Funding, which means I get to keep whatever I earn even if I don’t reach my target. And, as I said, the album is finished so it’s coming down the road in some format or another. But I would really like to promote it well and make a real effort to get it out there. For example, I am planning a 100-town-tour of Ireland for early 2018 and it would be an awful shame if I had to knock that on the head and settle down and get a proper job - no!!!

 

Finally, a quick word about sharing. If you feel you can't help or it's not really your cup of tea for whatever reason, but you think you might know some people who would be into it, please take a moment to share this page with your friends - you can also do this if you really love the idea!! The usual social network buttons are next to the BACK IT button near the top of the page or you can copy and paste the website address - oldschool-like :) There’s also the option of talking to people in real life, if that sort of thing still goes on.

 

And, if you have any questions - if you're confused about anything or you would like some more information, please feel free to contact me at marie@marieconniffe.com 

 

Thanks for reading,

 

Hope you have/have had a lovely Christmas,

 

Barróga agus póga,

 

Marie x

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! We’re Nina Noir (Frederica Mercury), Lindy Day (Brianna May), Diana Rey (Joan Deacon), Nichole Boaz (Spike Edna), and Karla Downey (Regina Taylor), and together we are The Killer Queens. It’s not an easy task bringing the work of true musical pioneers and one of the most charismatic rock singers in history to life, but we’ve committed every fiber of our technique and talent to conjuring a thrilling tribute to the Queen legacy.

For a long time, we’ve had an idea for a big project—a music video for Bohemian Rhapsody that pays homage to both Queen and a classic ‘90s film. Learning the music of Queen is hard work, and making this music video won’t be easy either. But as a band, we are always trying to push ourselves to take on new challenges and continue Queen’s legacy. We want to pay homage to the fans that have supported Queen throughout the decades. This video is a thank-you to all the fans that have made Queen a legend. We also hope that we can set an example for all the aspiring female rockers out there, showing that girls can “party on” too!

As a band, we’ve been through a lot together. But one of the great things about being in a band is that we come together and support one another. This music video is one of our biggest goals, and we’re eager to take on this new challenge. Now, with your help, we’re ready to finally make our dreams a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

Making a music video is a long process with a lot of different steps. Here’s some of the nitty-gritty details:

  • $6,000 – Car. The first big expense of this video is getting ahold of our biggest and most important prop: a car! Because of the classic film we’re recreating, we need a very specific make and model of car. Getting the car has been quite an adventure, and in addition to the cost of the vehicle itself, we also have transport and repair expenses.
  • $5,000 – Videographer and film crew. We need a videographer and crew who truly understand the classic look of such an iconic piece. These won’t be your run of the mill local crew. We will be working with one of the best in the business who have created music videos for bands such as Garbage and Chainsmokers. We want to do this right.
  • $2,750 – Studio. Because of the nature of this video, we can’t film on location. We need to film in a studio, with a green screen and everything else a studio has to offer.
  • $1,000 – Post-production/editing. Just like mastering an album, we need a team dedicated to lining up each shot to make an impact. This work takes long hours and the best software, but it also needs the intuition of an artist.
  • $250 – Costumes and makeup. Lucky for us the costumes are simple for most of it, and the other scene will include many of the same costumes we wear on stage! We do need a few things to make it pop and none of it will go to waste.

The Impact

One of the main reasons we are creating this video, aside from our intense fangirling, is to grab the attention of promoters across the nation and the world. We are hoping to turn the momentum behind our video into a nationwide and international tour. We want to find the Queen fans of every city and nation. We want to inspire young women to embrace rock and roll. We want the world to get on your bikes and ride!!

Queen has inspired generations to be themselves and not worry what everyone else thinks. We chose to tribute Queen because the world needs this music. We are entering a time full of fear and hate. The world is a very different place now, and we want to bring a smile to those who need it most.

Risks & Challenges

In the music industry, you must always expect the unexpected. While we don’t anticipate any major bumps or hurdles, we know from experience that things can go wrong, and we’re prepared to modify our plan as we go to fit any changing circumstances.

The most obvious concern is that we won’t reach our funding goal. We have every intention of making this video happen with whatever funds we receive. However, certain aspects of the video would be need to be scaled back if we don’t meet our goal. Operating on a lower budget would likely force us to rethink our choices regarding the studio, videographer, and post-production.

Essentially, we plan to make the video we have the budget for. There is an upside to this plan: if we were to exceed our funding goal, it means we have some “wiggle room” to make the video even more amazing!

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way that you can help us is to share this campaign and let the world know that we exist. Every musical endeavor needs eyes on it. Sometimes that’s not easy for the musicians themselves to do. Our die-hard fans are some of the greatest people in our lives. They help pick us up when the limelight blinds us. Tributing one of the greatest rock bands in the world can be overwhelming and intimidating, but we always rise to the challenge. We want to share that hard work with the world and celebrate the greatest music ever written!

This music video is one of our biggest goals, and we’re eager to take on this new challenge. Now, with your help, we’re ready to finally make our dreams a reality!
What We Need & What You Get
Making a music video is a long process with a lot of different steps. Here’s some of the nitty-gritty details:


$6,000 – Car. The first big expense of this video is getting ahold of our biggest and most important prop: a car! Because of the classic film we’re recreating, we need a very specific make and model of car. Getting the car has been quite an adventure, and in addition to the cost of the vehicle itself, we also have transport and repair expenses.

$5,000 – Videographer and film crew. We need a videographer and crew who truly understand the classic look of such an iconic piece. These won’t be your run of the mill local crew. We will be working with one of the best in the business who have created music videos for bands such as Garbage and Chainsmokers. We want to do this right.

$2,750 – Studio. Because of the nature of this video, we can’t film on location. We need to film in a studio, with a green screen and everything else a studio has to offer.

$1,000 – Post-production/editing. Just like mastering an album, we need a team dedicated to lining up each shot to make an impact. This work takes long hours and the best software, but it also needs the intuition of an artist.

$250 – Costumes and makeup. Lucky for us the costumes are simple for most of it, and the other scene will include many of the same costumes we wear on stage! We do need a few things to make it pop and none of it will go to waste.

The Impact
One of the main reasons we are creating this video, aside from our intense fangirling, is to grab the attention of promoters across the nation and the world. We are hoping to turn the momentum behind our video into a nationwide and international tour. We want to find the Queen fans of every city and nation. We want to inspire young women to embrace rock and roll. We want the world to get on your bikes and ride!!
Queen has inspired generations to be themselves and not worry what everyone else thinks. We chose to tribute Queen because the world needs this music. We are entering a time full of fear and hate. The world is a very different place now, and we want to bring a smile to those who need it most.
Risks & Challenges
In the music industry, you must always expect the unexpected. While we don’t anticipate any major bumps or hurdles, we know from experience that things can go wrong, and we’re prepared to modify our plan as we go to fit any changing circumstances.
The most obvious concern is that we won’t reach our funding goal. We have every intention of making this video happen with whatever funds we receive. However, certain aspects of the video would be need to be scaled back if we don’t meet our goal. Operating on a lower budget would likely force us to rethink our choices regarding the studio, videographer, and post-production.
Essentially, we plan to make the video we have the budget for. There is an upside to this plan: if we were to exceed our funding goal, it means we have some “wiggle room” to make the video even more amazing!
Other Ways You Can Help
The best way that you can help us is to share this campaign and let the world know that we exist. Every musical endeavor needs eyes on it. Sometimes that’s not easy for the musicians themselves to do. Our die-hard fans are some of the greatest people in our lives. They help pick us up when the limelight blinds us. Tributing one of the greatest rock bands in the world can be overwhelming and intimidating, but we always rise to the challenge. We want to share that hard work with the world and celebrate the greatest music ever written!

story:
UPDATE: I no longer need to raise over $3000, but I can make do with a $1000 minimum.


Say goodbye to accidentally pulling out guitar and bass cables!


Hi, my name is Jess Chan and I am the inventor of Stay-Wrapped. The Stay-Wrapped device is an easy-to-use and effective means of keeping guitar and bass cables in place while facilitating instrument switches. I'm sure every guitarist or bassist has accidentally stepped (or had someone else step) on their cable and pull it out at least once in their life. There are conventional ways in which many have tried to solve the problem, but those means all have their drawbacks. Prior to inventing the Stay-Wrapped, I was just another frustrated musician sick of stepping on my cables at the worst possible moment. To come up with the Stay-Wrapped device, I examined all the drawbacks with conventional solutions to the cable problem and went through a few prototypes before settling on my most recent design.


The Stay-Wrapped not only prevents cables from being pulled out of your instrument, but also keeps cables from being tangled on stage. Conventional cable management methods tend to kink cables at the plug overtime, which increases the potential for damaged cables. Aside from providing strain relief and keeping instrument cables in place, Stay-Wrapped allows for easier instrument switching when compared to conventional methods. To switch instruments, the musician only needs to release the device with one hand, switch instruments, and reattach the device.



Some of you reading this may have already tried the device or seen it in person. Unfortunately, the metal clip is the weakest link. For those of you who haven't seen the device before, the clip that attaches the device bends out of shape easily and has the potential to scratch the finish on our prized instruments. To solve the problem, I looked into different materials and manufacturers and found a plastic molding company that would be able to help. The majority of the funding will go towards producing the device via a manufacturer. The rest will go towards marketing, potential packaging design, and research and development.



Thanks for your support in making my product design dreams a reality. In the meantime, don't step on your cables!

story:
Me:

I am a singer-songwriter based in Sydney. Over the years I have made my way from being a bedroom-poet listening to Britney Spears, to a performing singer-songwriter. I started performing shortly after having studied in Berkeley, California and being inspired by local street musicians. 


After only about a year of performing around Sydney, I released Orderves in 2013 with my band at the time Fleur Wiber and the Apparitions (featuring Alex Stokes, Dylan Hoelzl, Catherine Smith & Mick Oereck). The EP received airplay on numerous community radio stations including FBI & 2SER and allowed me to tour around the UK and perform at Singer-songwriter Cape May in New Jersey, USA.

In 2015 I performed as a feature artist at the Dungog Festival, the ArtsHub Annual Conference and Live'nLounging. I also was songwriter-in-residence at the Broken Hill Art Exchange.


After hard work, some challenging circumstances and years of writing, I am now ready to record  my new album. I want it to be the best possible quality so I can share it with the world. I have the full album ready to record in the studio: the songs are written: instrumentalists are organised: the studio where the recording, mixing, mastering and cd production will take place is sorted: the album art is decided with a talented emerging visual artist: all I need is to raise the money, and this is where I really need your support to make it happen.

I am interested in exploring music which is characteristically feminine. I have cultivated my own voice as a songwriter which represents the female as vulnerable yet powerful. The writing references old folk songs as well as romantic poetry. I love how music can enhance human connection in a world which has become increasingly solitary and technology-driven. This is why I love small, intimate and acoustic gigs. I imagine connecting with a listener through music so that we experience together a moment of vulnerability, uncertainty and acceptance of the foibles of our human condition.


Along with he benefits and amazing opportunities that can come about, there are many challenges facing being an independent artist. Hiring  a studio and the professional experts required is understandably costly. It involves using high quality equipment and highly skilled professionals to work with i.e. engineers to help you get the best possible result. 

Some of you may have seen my DEMOS 2015 album which is the "draft copy" of this album. I am really inspired by new folk and alt country artists like Bonnie prince Billy, Cat Power, Sharon van Etten and Wilco who have released demos and lofi recordings. I find this aesthetic interesting because it shows the work-in-progress and can often have more emotive and creative characteristics that come about through improvisation and jamming. 

Check it out here: https://soundcloud.com/fleurwiber 

But as my friend Glen Prins from Jungle Bird music says "there is nothing like having your voice, instrument and music heard - all the small details you can't pick up in home recording." Recording the DEMOS 2015 cd has prepared me well to use this material in a studio album and make it as close to perfecto as possible.

Professional studio recording also makes it possible for the music to be played on the radio and sound good on any stereo. This expertise is just purely beyond my skill-set and having the opportunity to work with talented and hard working people is such a great opportunity and will make this projects all the more worthwhile.



Costs:

  • Studio recording, CD production, mixing, mastering & consultation at Damien Gerard recording studios will cost $5,000
  • Paying instrumentalists & visual artist for album cover $1,000
  • Marketing and promotional costs $1,000
  • Admin fees $700 (including IndieGogo campaign fee, credit cards & Paypal fees)

Any donation over $50 will receive a signed copy of the album when it is released!

Other ways you can help:

If you can't afford to donate - 

  • Share this campaign on your social media or via email to people who support the arts
  • There are share buttons in this campaign you can easily click

If the goal figure is not reached, I will use the money for recording, mixing, mastering and releasing the songs the amount covers. 

This project is going to be great, but I really need your help to make it happen. Thank you!
