story:
My Story

My real name is Andre' Collins, but I go by the stage name of Trump Tight.  I am a writer/producer/artist that composes music of all genres.  I have written everything from love ballads, to gospel songs, to hip-hop and everything in between.  I firmly believe that good music is good music; it does not need to be defined by a genre.  

I have always been a writer and performer locally, but I got my TRUE industry start by working at a demo studio in Nashville, TN where writers would come in with their songs to be recorded with the hopes of pitching their songs to major labels. We would record those songs and I would produce and sometimes co-arrange their songs to provide the best sounding song possible for them to pitch.  The studio primarily recorded live instruments and sounds, so that is where I honed my skills and fell in love with the art of arranging and layering songs.

I am now preparing to release my sophomore album entitled, "Eclectic Soul".  It is a hip-hop album, infused with many elements of other sectors of music.  In the truest sense of being eclectic, there will be songs with elements of R & B, pop, gospel, and techno all molded together into a wonderful arrangement of artistry.  I have been told that I make "hip-hop for grown people".  All of the songs have been recorded and we are in the mixing and mastering stages. I am teaming up with multi-platinum mixer Marc Frigo to provide the best sound yet!  I have worked with Marc on a few other songs in various styles and each time he has delivered a phenomenal sound that really brought the songs to life.  I think he is going to really add the final element to push this project to the next level.  The versatility and content of this album truly have the ability to make a MAJOR impact and is sure to please whoever listens.

What We Need & What You Get

The recording of the album has been completed so the funding of this project is solely for the purpose of paying for the mixing, mastering, and launching of the album.  The goal of the campaign is to generate enough pre-orders to pay for the album and the second music video to officially launch the album.  Because myself and a partner shoot and edit our own music videos, we are able to operate off of a smaller budget than most, but our quality does not suffer as you can see by the first music video from this album, "Good Morning Amerikkka".  


I have come up with some great perks for all of you, so I can thank you for your contribution:

  • $10 Contribution: digital download
  • $25 Contribution: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD.
  • $50 Contribution:  digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), and a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album.
  • $100 Contribution: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything" and  a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note.
  • $250 Contribution: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything", a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, and one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music and my other musical interests.
  • $500 Contribution: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything", a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music and my other musical interests, a behind the scenes video of the creation of my next music video and an advanced copy of the music video.
  • $1000 Contribution: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything", a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music and my other musical interests, a behind the scenes video of the creation of my next music video, an advanced copy of the music video and 2 hard copies of signed scores and session lyric sheets.
  • $ 1500: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything", a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music and my other musical interests, a behind the scenes video of the creation of my next music video, an advanced copy of the music video 2 hard copies of signed scores and session lyric sheets, an Executive Producer credit on the album cover, and a private Skype session of a live studio session on a future project.
  • $ 2000: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything", a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music and my other musical interests, a behind the scenes video of the creation of my next music video, an advanced copy of the music video 2 hard copies of signed scores and session lyric sheets, an Executive Producer credit on the album cover, and a private Skype session of a live studio session on a future project an invitation to a writing and recording session (travel not included).
  • $ 3000: digital download, autographed hard copy of CD, an "Eclectic Soul" t-shirt (traditional and baby doll t-shirt styles will be available), a 'thank you' in the liner notes of the album, an autographed "Eclectic Soul" poster, a copy of my previous album "Timing Is Everything", a personalized hand-written 'thank you' note, one 30-45 minute 'meet & greet' Skype session about my music and my other musical interests, a behind the scenes video of the creation of my next music video, an advanced copy of the music video 2 hard copies of signed scores and session lyric sheets, an Executive Producer credit on the album cover, a private Skype session of a live studio session on a future project an invitation to a writing and recording session (travel not included). And a feature role in my next music video (travel not included)

The Impact

I make music with the intent to make an impact on the music industry and people's lives.  I have songs on this album dealing with race relations in America (Good Morning Amerikkka), abuse and bullying (Beauty Queen), a song dedicated to the brave men and women in the Armed Forces (Till I Get Home), and other impactful songs musically.  With your support, I will do my best to spread this music around the globe.  You will have contributed to one of the most original hip-hop albums to date.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are oftentimes the same for indie artists.  With no major label funding the project, sales are often times the only way to make up the gap in finances.  I work a full time job and have a family but I still have a dream.  In order to accomplish this dream, I will need to rely on the kindness of others and my fans to release this album.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out all of the perks that are listed on my campaign site. Contributing to this campaign will make my dream a reality.  Words cannot truly describe the appreciation I have for your support.  I promise to no end, I will do my best to make great music, push the envelope, and to make an impact.  Even if you are unable to contribute financially to this album at this time, I encourage you to share my campaign with all of your friends.  I will not let you down. Thank you!

the most original hip-hop albums to date.
Risks & Challenges
The risks and challenges
are oftentimes the same for indie artists.  With no major label funding
the project, sales are often times the only way to make up the gap in finances.
 I work a full time job and have a family but I still have a dream.  In
order to accomplish this dream, I will need to rely on the kindness of others
and my fans to release this album.  
Other Ways You Can Help
Please check out all of the perks that are
listed on my campaign site. Contributing to this campaign will make my dream a
reality.  Words cannot truly describe the appreciation I have for your
support.  I promise to no end, I will do my best to make great music, push
the envelope, and to make an impact.  Even if you are unable to contribute
financially to this album at this time, I encourage you to share my campaign
with all of your friends.  I will not let you down. Thank you!

story:
Valley Cat & Our Campaign

Valley Cat is a music venue and recording studio in Winchester, VA. We have been in business for 1 year as of April 1st. We've done some amazing things so far and will continue to do so. 

Our goal with this campaign is to strengthen our ability to continue developing and supporting our local music scene. We've been bringing bands of all sorts to Winchester every week and giving this town somewhere they know that they can always enjoy live music. Bands love playing here because we treat them well and ensure they know that they are a priceless and integral part of the music scene. Listeners love coming to Valley Cat because you can't find the type of music or atmosphere anywhere else in town or near by. This campaign is to help us continue to create the most excellent experience for all and nurture our music scene.

We know we are headed in the right direction and will continue to hurdle any obstacles we encounter in our growth. This campaign and those who contribute will allow us to reach more people, bring more popular acts to play and so much more. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $3,000 to accomplish the following:

1. We are moving to a new building this spring and will be kicking into overdrive. This means we will be back with WAY more shows, WAY more videos and WAY more Valley Cat. We will need help to obtain a more professional PA system to provide a listening experience that is more comfortable and clear for both bands & patrons.

2. We will be launching a live streaming video service so that you can experience great music from bands at Valley Cat anywhere you want... LIVE! We'd like some help to get the right equipment, an encoder, bigger board & more.

For being the awesome person that you are and contributing, we have a lot of great perks to choose from. With small contribution rewards like a Valley Cat bumper sticker or a T-Shirt, middle-tier options like a live show pass to get into shows for free for a given time frame, high-tier options with combinations of the smaller tiers and adviser roles, there's something for everyone! 

Funding will go to obtaining the upgraded live sound equipment and live room treatments first if we do not reach our goal.

The Impact

Your contribution to Valley Cat allows us to continue to be the best place to hear local music in Winchester & it's surrounding areas. Our goal is to be the #1 place to find new music and music you love for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, you can still support us by sharing our campaign with friends and family. You can also follow us on Facebook for updates,  subscribe to and enjoy videos from live shows and studio sessions on our YouTube channel more!

story:
IT IS THAT TIME!

So, I've spent the last few months talking about the EP, playing the songs at different venues, I've gotten new likes to my artist page on Facebook all leading up to #thismoment where I get to share my heart and my artistry with you. 

Who am I?

I'm Del-Amina. I'm a native to Oakland, CA and a current local to Nashville, TN. I am a singer, songwriter and classical composer (currently pursuing a masters in classical composition at Belmont University) and I'm the sole owner of a confection catering company called Cakes & Cardamom Catering and Confectionery! WHOOP! 

...And The Project?

This Moment the EP is my first project as an independent artist. I am blessed to have been able to fully fund the recording of this project myself AND NOW it's time to mix and master and get it ready for distribution. 

SHARE A MOMENT?

I write great songs and the singing is pleasant, but this miracle of a masterpiece would not be anywhere near as amazing as it is without the collaborative efforts of all involved parties. I have indeed learned the art of a team through this process, and I'm now inviting you to be a part of this team! I think I can speak for all parties involved when I say our goal is to live passionately and to share beauty with the world through our music and through our lives and we just want an opportunity to do that. That's where you come in. Your monetary contribution will help get this music out into the world.


$3500  

That's all. That'll get this 5 song EP mixed and mastered and it will get a few hard copies of the album ready for distribution. I've invested $3000 already just to get this project off the ground. Just need a tiny shove over the finish line.
Mixing and Mastering
All of your favorite recorded works have gone through this process. This is the magic. This is the sparkle. A good ass mix and master is what makes you turn your windows down and your stereo up on a beautiful summer day. The way you feel the kick drum in your chest as you cruise down the block... The shimmer in the background you hear that soothes you as you listen to your favorite tune to a cup of tea or a glass of wine while burning incense or a candle... That's the magic in the mix. We've all heard a bad mix/master as well. That song that no matter how loud you turn it up will never sound quite clear enough. Or the feel like the voice sounds too far away and the piano is right in your face in a way that is not satisfactory. So yes, this process is important and worth every dime! 

PERKS!!!

No contribution goes unnoticed. As a part of the team, you reap the benefits on your investment. Your level of involvement determines the level of return! My goal is to make this worthwhile for EVERYONE! So let's do this! 
Unreleased music made exclusively available to you? YES!
Your name in the Thank You's on my EP? YES!
Free Tickets to my Album Release Party? YES!
Free treats from my bakery? OH HELL YES!
A song dedicated to you/written for you on my next album? YUP!
All of this and more is available to team members. 

Finally...

I don't want to create the contingency that I don't fully fund this project, because I believe in the power of the word, but apparently I have to cover my bases just for the sake of transparency. If perchance my word does not achieve it's goal and I am not fully funded, all monies contributed will still go toward this project and I will pay for the rest out of pocket. That just means it'll take longer to complete. You will still be able to experience #thismoment... Just might be in a later iteration of it. :) I do speak the possibility of being overfunded. Should that happen, all monies will go to funding my EP release party and promotion and distribution of this EP. Also keep in mind that your support means more than anything. Even if you can't contribute, it'd mean the world to me if you simply share the campaign with your friends and your family.
Much Love
~M~

story:
Who are Crojayn? 


We are a young, self managed, Irish Blues-Rock band founded on the streets of Cork City. Over three arduous years, hundreds of broken strings, soggy equipment and bloodied fingers - we finally managed to save for our first EP - released in the Summer of 2015. Every penny was raised through busking and busking alone. 

 As proud as we are of our self financed debut EP (#1), we no longer feel that the standard of the recordings are good enough. So with that said, we think it's finally time to get our material recorded professionally! 

We aim to record 5 original songs which will be mixed, mastered and formatted by professionals. Our aim is to release this EP (#2) digitally before the Summer of 2016. 

Sounds simple right?...

Well sadly, that's not the case.

The process of producing a great sounding record is costly and in order to fund this project we need more than just loose coins made on the streets. Your contribution, no matter how big or small, would mean the world to us and it would give us the tools to produce a record that we can stand by...and hopefully, one that you would thoroughly enjoy!


What do we need to make this happen? Here's the breakdown:

1) Rehearsal Space - €75
2) Recording - €1000
3) Mixing - €175
4) Mastering - €250
5) Indie Go Go 5% service fee -  €75

In addition to helping us reach our goal, you will be rewarded with the many perks we have to offer!

1) €5 ~ Code for digital release of our new EP (#2)

2) €20 ~ Code for digital release of our new EP (#2) + A copy of our debut EP (#1)

3) €30 ~ Code for digital release of our new EP (#2) + A SIGNED copy of our debut EP  (#1)

4) €50 ~ All of the above + limited edition Crojayn poster!

5) €100 ~ All of the above + Original lyric sheets! 

And more!!

Where do your generous contributions go if we don't fully reach our goal? 

Well if we don't necessarily reach our target goal, we will continue the project! We have set out a schedule in which we are confident we will have the 5 song original EP (#2) ready for release before the Summer of 2016. However, the EP's release will be delayed indefinitely in the event that our target goal is not reached.

That's why we badly need your help! We'd absolutely love to raise the funds needed with this campaign so that we can release the EP (#2) for you as soon as possible! The doors it would open for us would be boundless and it would give us the much sought after credibility that every band strives for. 




There is no way of expressing how thankful we would be if we were to reach this goal. We will do everything in our power to make sure that we get this EP (#2) right and will put our (only partially metaphorical) blood, sweat and tears into it...that you can be sure of!

If you are still reading this - then any contribution you make will matter. 

If you still want to help us on our journey to professionalism and you are unable to     contribute, then don't worry - a simple sharing of our message is all we ask for. 


Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign! 

Go raibh míle mhaith agat - go dtí go mbuailimíd arís




Media Quotes

"It's gutsy music (they play), intuitive and full of earnest abandon. In short it's young" - Irish Examiner (1st of September 2015)

"Bitta Rory Gallagher influence going on there? I love it, I love it" - Colm O'Sullivan - Today FM (26th of August 2015)

story:
The Need

The ability to use one's hands and feet independently while performing is one of the benchmarks of good set drummers. A driving bass drum is often another one, depending on musical style. I developed an electro-mechanically assisted ("EMA") bass drum pedal with older drummers in mind, whose legs have lost their speed and/or endurance (like me). For drummers who want to execute repetitively fast beats, this pedal also frees their other foot, e.g. to operate their high-hat.

However, through accident or illness many drummers have lost the use of one or both legs. Friends who are handicapped are the catalyst for modifying the EMA so that disabled or handicapped drummers can add the bass drum back to their playing using head motion.

Objectives

The objectives of this campaign are to:

1)  Refine existing prototype electronics and software to improve the consistency with which the bass drum is struck and to eliminate unintentional false positives ("artifacts").

2)  Make it easier for the drummer to program-in functions, e.g. change and set a different tempo on the fly; change the dynamic range; actuate an auxiliary device; etc.

3)  Develop a Graphic User Interface ("GUI") to facilitate selection of performance parameters.

4)  Improve the beater mounting system.

5)  Produce 5 prototypes to enable select drummers to evaluate the design and provide their comments toward making the design more useful.

a.  Via local contacts, and

b.  Trips to Georgia, Florida, and California

6)  Incorporate design changes and improvements.

7)  Produce 20 systems to distribute at no charge to handicapped drummers and to select music therapy schools and centers.

The Story

I’m 69 and have played drums since I was 9. While it helped to pay my way through college playing in a soul band, after college I mainly focused on playing timpani in orchestras. But being an active drummer, I have also played in a bagpipe band (competing in the World Championships in Glasgow), concert bands and brass ensembles. As I got older and further away from playing set with any regularity, I found my foot coordination lacking and my leg tiring. Hence the idea for the EMA bass drum pedal to avoid embarrassing myself.

The EMA system consists of a pedal, electronics box, and solenoid assembly.  A sensor mounted to the pedal starts the solenoid striking the bass drum head at whatever tempo the drummer selects. Pressing the pedal further causes the solenoid to strike the head harder. The solenoid stops striking the bass head once foot pressure is released. This lets a drummer produce complex patterns on the fly, at faster speeds than would be typically possible and with much less leg fatigue.

Professional, name drummers who have seen the EMA system have been enthusiastic and encouraging. I have not taken it to market because with the exception of replacing sticks, most older drummers simply don’t buy new equipment.

My last full time job involved the international marketing and sale of airborne imaging systems, primarily to governments for use in environmental monitoring as a means of linking satellite data with ground-truthed data. These systems were line scanners. Just as old TVs produced images by sweeping a series of lines across a CRT, the line scanners collected data line by line usually from a small twin engine plane. Since changes of air pressure due to winds or thermals bounce small planes around, virtually no two lines were parallel. Therefore the collected data had to be corrected for aircraft motion (roll, pitch and yaw).

I hold the following patents and patent applications in connection with this project:

·  U.S. Patent Number 8,389,848 that covers the EMA bass drum pedal and method of use (as shown in the YouTube clip).

·  U.S. Patent Number 9,190,036 covers improvements to the designs described in the first patent.

·  One additional patent has been applied for (62/248,556) that describes the use of multiple motion sensors used to actuate the bass drum beater independent of a foot pedal.

The engineer now working on the electronics and software for this project was responsible for the system that effectively corrected the images, enabling them to be laid over GIS bases (Geographic Information Systems, effectively maps with other features indicated). He is using similar motion sensors to translate head motion into intention, e.g. strike the drum now; keep striking it; hit an accent; stop striking it.

What Do I Need?

I have personally invested approximately $66,920.00 in this project so far and am tapped out. I am seeking to raise about $36,860 in this campaign to be used as follows:

Software Development    $10,000.

Prototype Design-

  Electronics modifications  1,280.

  Gyro Sensor Packaging  1,280.

  Travel  1,600.

5 units

  Hardware  1,100 

  Displays      480.

  Assembly  1,500.

  Travel  3,800.

20 units

  Hardware    4,400.

  Software modifications    1,200. 

  Displays        1,520.

  Assembly  4,500.

  Travel    4,200.

Total    $36,860.

Any money donated above the target campaign amount would first be applied to engineering that would improve the performance and/or the reliability of the devices, and develop a phone app to replace the GUI. They would next be applied to producing more units for donation.

Risks

Although the artifacts of aircraft motion were thoroughly resolved, affixing a sensor assembly to one’s head and eliminating motion artifacts while drummers are moving have introduced unexpected difficulties. Making head motion independent of body motion is key to proceeding. The sensor package itself is small (roughly a cube less than ½” on a side) and light (no more than a few ounces). It can be readily attached e.g. to a pair of glasses or a hat. 

Step one is to achieve motion independence. Step two depends on the successful outcome of step one and would be is produce the 5 prototype for field evaluations. Step three depends on the success of step two and would produce the 20 units to be donated.

Group Contacts

·  Disabled Drummers Association (400+ members) www.disableddrummers.org

·  Coalition for Disabled Musicians, Inc. www.disabledmusicians.org

·  Georgia Tech Center for Music Technologies www.gtcmt.gatech.edu

·  University departments teaching music therapy

·  Independent facilities teaching handicapped students

In addition to requesting funding to accomplish the above goals, I would appreciate any input that you could provide, especially the names of drummers you know who would benefit from the pedal, contacts within schools or institutions that deal with handicapped musicians, alternate technologies that might be combined with our device that would further improve its utility, or any ideas you might have to make the device either more useful or via modifications useful to others with handicaps.

What Do You Get?

In addition to positive karma, all donors will receive a certificate of appreciation, be acknowledged by name and digital photo (if you provide) on any subsequent website and in all donations of the final gyro-based drum systems to handicapped drummers, etc. In addition, any donor contributing $100 or more who wishes to purchase an EMA bass drum pedal or a gyro-based drum system will receive a ten percent (10%) discount.

  Travel  1,600.
5
units
  Hardware  1,100  
  Displays   
  480.
  Assembly  1,500.
  Travel  3,800.
20 units
  Hardware    4,400.
  Software modifications    1,200.  
  Displays        1,520.
  Assembly   4,500.
  Travel    4,200.
Total    $36,860.

Any money
donated above the target campaign amount would first be applied to engineering
that would improve the performance and/or the reliability of the devices, and
develop a phone app to replace the GUI. They would next be applied to producing
more units for donation.
Risks
Although the
artifacts of aircraft motion were thoroughly resolved, affixing a sensor assembly
to one’s head and eliminating motion artifacts while drummers are moving have introduced unexpected
difficulties. Making head motion independent of body motion is key to proceeding. The sensor package itself is small (roughly a cube less than ½”
on a side) and light (no more than a few ounces). It can be
readily attached e.g. to a pair of glasses or a hat. 
Step one is to achieve motion independence. Step two depends on the successful outcome of step one and would be is produce the 5
prototype for field evaluations. Step three depends on the success of step two and would produce the 20 units to be donated.
Group Contacts
· 
Disabled Drummers Association (400+
members) www.disableddrummers.org
· 
Coalition for Disabled Musicians, Inc. www.disabledmusicians.org
· 
Georgia Tech Center for Music Technologies
www.gtcmt.gatech.edu
· 
University departments teaching music
therapy
· 
Independent facilities teaching
handicapped students
In addition to requesting funding to
accomplish the above goals, I would appreciate any input that you could
provide, especially the names of drummers you know who would benefit from the
pedal, contacts within schools or institutions that deal with handicapped
musicians, alternate technologies that might be combined with our device that
would further improve its utility, or any ideas you might have to make the
device either more useful or via modifications useful to others with handicaps.
What Do You Get?

In addition to positive karma, all donors
will receive a certificate of appreciation, be acknowledged by name and digital
photo (if you provide) on any subsequent website and in all donations of the
final gyro-based
drum systems to handicapped
drummers, etc. In addition, any donor contributing $100 or more who wishes to purchase an EMA bass drum
pedal or a gyro-based drum system will receive a
ten percent (10%) discount.

story:
When we started

For 20 years, Plena Libre have been pioneers of Puerto Rican popular music. Like the iconic musicians Rafael Cortijo and Ismael Rivera before them, the group has played a major role in preserving and popularizing the traditional Afro-Puerto Rican rhythms of Bomba and Plena in Puerto Rico and spreading them around the world, while modernizing them and infusing them with other influences.

Ya estamos en el estudio, el sencillo nuevo sale en varios días.    Continuamos grabando el CD "Rutas y Raíces" y su pre-orden  nos ayuda a sufragar los costos de estudio, impresion y todo lo relacionado a lo que falta.   Solo nos faltan $10,000.

We are already in the studio and will be releasing our new single in a few days.  As we continue to record, your contributions will help us cover the  studio expenses of the remaining songs, mastering, printing of the album and filming a video with one of the new songs, that will show how the panderos (handrums) are played.  For this we need $10,000.


These four-time GRAMMY Award nominees combine a hard-hitting horn section, master hand drummers, and lush three-part vocal harmonies into a modern blend.  With their latest project, Roots and Routes, Plena Libre dig still deeper into the African origins of the music of their island nation. Featuring compositions by some of the band’s newer members, Roots and Routes brings the unique music of Puerto Rico to new territories and new generations with a perspective that respects tradition while embracing innovation. Featuring a contemporary sound and lyrics that reflect Puerto Rico's contemporary experiences, this project will break new ground in exploring the richness and enormous expressive possibilities of Bomba and Plena. 

Why we need you

Your contribution to this independent production will make it possible for Plena Libre to record, manufacture and distribute the CD, and to make a video that will share the beautiful music of our island with the world.


Pre-ordena el CD Rutas & Raices (Roots & Routes).  Tu contribución a este proyecto hace posible que podamos terminar el CD, imprimirlo, distribuirlo y entregarles lo mejor que tenemos, nuestra musica. 





The soul of Puerto Rico in three-part harmony

Plena and bomba are distinctive musical styles of Puerto Rico, and the virtuoso musicians of Plena Libre are their contemporary masters.

Bandleader Gary Nunez and his orchestra have revived the once-dormant plena sound for a new generation, electrifying audiences with a dazzling spectacle of horns, drums, and dance.

 

Todos los arreglos están terminados, algunos temas ya grabados.  Tu contribución nos permitirá terminar el CD, imprimirlo, distribuirlo y grabar el video.  

Why now?

  • Our first single, "Como te Quiero yo"   has received a strong listener response in its first month of rotation on five stations. This response has come in the form of heavy listener requests and tune-ins. With a note that we have a potential hit on your hands.  

We give you our word that we will not settle for “good enough” - we  won't take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise will be reflected in the final product.  

Here's to making our best album yet!  



And that's not all! Proceeds benefit Rabito Kontento Organization.  

After production expenses are met, 100% of your contributions to  Roots and Routes CD and video will go the Rabito Kontento organization, a non-profit, all volunteer organization dedicated to easing the suffering of Puerto Rico's homeless and abused animals. "Sato" is slang for street dog. They rescue Satos from the streets and beaches, give them medical care, food and shelter, and plenty of love. When they are healthy, send them to a Forever Home.

If you can't afford $20 for a CD, we understand. If you'd like to support our campaign, we'll take anything you can afford. Whether or not you can contribute financially, please help us get the word out about this project. Share this with anyone you think might be interested. THANKS!

Cualquier contribución es buena.  Una vez lleguemos a la meta, el restante recaudado será donado a la organización Rabito Kontento quienes ayudan a los animales abandonados en la calle, consiguiendo para ellos servicios veterinarios, comida y hogares. 
Gracias por tu apoyo.

story:
A Letter from Caroline

Friends, Family, and Supporters of Music,

Caroline here! I am a singer/songwriter from San Diego, California and have been studying in Boston at the Berklee College of Music since I arrived in 2015. When I first came to Berklee, I was extremely shy about sharing my music, but knew that it was just something I had to do. I rounded up a group of extremely talented musicians who helped me create CC’s sound and finished compositions. We hired a fantastic manager, Kate Rancka, recorded our first five singles to be released in 2017, and started playing live shows all over Boston. We managed to accomplish all of this in a matter of months due to the hard work of many people that sacrificed their time to be a part of my artistic vision. I can’t tell you how grateful I am to be working with such gracious and talented individuals. 

When our first single, “Blow,” was released last March, we received an overwhelming response. In the first week of its release, the song had accumulated over 10,000 views, plays, and shares. This was a wonderful shock and even more motivation to put out new music. Writing, collaborating with things that I’m not sure we’ll ever be able to stop doing - we certainly don’t want to. Yes, being the bandleader of ten musicians has been exhausting, and yes, I am crazy, but this has been extremely rewarding and the greatest learning experience I’ve ever endured. 

 

Where Your Funds Go

This campaign was established in order to reimburse the musicians who financially contributed to the creation of our first five singles. Creating recorded music involves many bodies: the mixer, masterer, sound engineer, tuner, videographer, etc. In addition to reimbursing for current projects, we would like to invest the exceeding funds in our future endeavors. Creating an Indiegogo campaign was a great avenue to allow us to continue to share music and our artistic vision. 

New music to be released in Fall has already been written and is in the arranging stage. We plan on recording our next set of songs outside of Berklee’s studios. This process is more expensive than recording on-campus at Berklee, however we need to do so in order to retain full copyrights of our music. With this in mind, your funds would also be supporting our effort to retain all rights to our sound recordings! 

 

Gifts for Your Generosity

Your contributions to our artistic vision are precious to us and we cannot thank you enough for your generosity. We would like to offer your gifts at all levels of donation. In order to view these gifts and their descriptions, please view the “Perks” bar on the right hand side of the page. Thank you again from everyone here at CC & The Catastrophe!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michael Rosado. I currently work in full time ministry with a youth group in Central FL. I am married to my incredible wife, Kati. We have a sleepy Shiba Inu and a love for finding "home" on our travels with those that we meet. Coffee and surfing are truly passions of mine. Let’s have a conversation.

I’ve seen and met many in the midst of their journey that have watched the days go by while they remain in their regrets, the fear of failure that holds them back from dreams and joy. I was 18 when I knew a specific calling on my life was to share poetry- not only the words but the songs that also have come from them.

A few years later, Wind Words became the vehicle by which I would travel and share in hopes that life would be spoken through my songs. The incredible support and friendships gained from show-goers, listeners and other artists have kept me encouraged to say the least. I’ve continued to be inspired by the stories and memories that have been shared with me. This year I have been given a burden to share a few of those stories with the world.

I’ve decided to take this poetry project into a studio with Mark Nicks and Brandon Shattuck and to have these songs professionally recorded and produced at Parafonic Recording Studio in Orlando FL.

This Indiegogo Campaign is a new step toward this direction. I am opening my efforts as an invitation to partner with friends and family to see this full length record become all that it can be.

What We Need & What You Get

3500 is the cost of recording this project (Tracking+Mixing+Mastering)

100+ is the cost of having World Wide Distribution: music copy-written and then distributed onto all major platforms (such as Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube.. ect)

The rest will cover new merch and perk supplies to gift you with media and souvenirs in the production of this album.

Perks for backers will include Digital Downloads of 2 Pre-released singles, Full Length Digital Download,  New shirts, Posters, Stickers, Physical Cds, Merch Bundles, Hand Written Lyrics to 1 song of your choice, House Shows… +more

This is a "Flexible Funding" project which means that all funds will help support the project no matter how much is raised even if the goal is not met.

THE HEART

These are uncharted waters for me but I can assure you that this project will be met with my utmost diligence and energy no matter how much is raised. These songs must be shared and this album must be made. My promise to you is this: “I will creatively communicate hope and unconditional love and life through this project with all that I can give.”

There is enough content out there that consumes our lives and fills our news feeds. But what about that which stirs contentment? "Digging Up Earth" is an album that shares of seasons and perspectives that may connect or may introduce the listener to matters of pain, doubt, holiness, faith and transparency. Everyone is worth a conversation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Financially backing this project is just amazing and I am sincerely grateful for those who can... but this is not the only way to show your support. I would like to encourage you to get the word out about this campaign even if you cannot physically give. Also take advantage of Indiegogo’s share tools that make it incredibly easy for you to use your social media influence. Thoughts and prayers are always asked for and welcomed. Gracias!

story:
On tour now! Come find me this month, America!
 
 

Who is "Freedom Girl?"

I’m Liv Lombardi. I’m a singer, songwriter, storyteller and touring musician. I write music and perform to share a message of love. I have been forging this project since I began my travels and tours eight years ago. I want you to be a part of this journey with me.

I am planning to record the 'Freedom Girl' EP this July. The EP will consist of five songs that tell the story of my world travels, as well as a journey back home and into my own own heart. These five songs serve as a prelude to a larger body work that will be released in the upcoming year.

Rooftop Session, Guangzhou, China - October 2016

The Dirty Details...

The total budget for this project is $10,450. Your contributions will help cover expenses for:

• Paying musicians & Engineers and Studio Fees: Five days of tracking in the studio + mixing and mastering, and paying all the musicians and techs

• CD Production & Merchandise: T-shirts, Buttons, stickers. How else will we know who the true Liv-bians are?

• Music Video & Content Production: In today's dynamic music industry, music videos are a must. I am set to collaborate with filmmakers on the East Coast and the Southwest. New content is on the way and I'm psyched to bring it to you! 

• Publicity and PR: I did not come here to play small. What's the point of making a record if not many will hear it?

• Touring: There are already two tours in the works and gas is not free. Help me bring these tunes to your town/city!

If the goal isn't reached...Well, it must be reached. And, it will! That is where you come in. Let's make it happen, people!

My muse and twin sister, circa 1993!

My muse & sister - playing together in China! circa 2016

The Impact

Storytelling builds community. Music brings people together. These two things offer people something to identify with. From community grows truth and connection. There is power in this. When I began to share my songs and stories, audiences, friends, strangers, the world around me showed up to say "You are not alone.”This is a powerful tool. We need more of this in today’s world.

My message is one of love. Help me to share it with the world. Change begins with each of us, imagine what we can do together?

On a business side of things, the funding this campaign would bring will help me to take the next step into the industry. I am working with a PR company to help promote the release, tour it extensively and keep growing as an artist.

 

Amsterdam, Netherlands, September 2013

Nicosia, Cyprus, May 2013

 

Risks & Challenges

I am taking a huge leap of faith to make this record. I will be uprooting my life for an open ended tour. Quitting my job, getting in the car and hitting the road. I have faith that I will be successful in this adventure. Do you?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a contribution, that's okay! There are so many things you can still do to help. Share a link on Facebook and Twitter! Tag your friends! Tell your family about the project! Come out to a show when I pass through your town! The more people I can reach, the better.

story:
Felabration 20 Years On: Promoting, preserving & protecting the Legacy of Fela Anikulapo- Kuti

Supporting Felabration 2017 the Festival & Archive

The last several years have been a challenge financially as festival related costs have increased.  As the year has gone on, we have continued to plan for the festival, however, it’s become apparent that we will be unable to achieve this without the help and support of Fela’s global community. We are confident that within this global community there are at least 1000 people who would be willing and able to donate $20 to keep the festival going.  No donation is too small or too large all support is welcomed.  Your donation will help defray the costs associated with artists’ travel, lodging, sound, security, and all other festival associated expenses. 

Fela Ankulapo Kuti is a global icon whose words still resonate, thus the theme for the 20th Felabration is “The Prophecy”.  Starting as a day of celebration; Felabration has evolved into a week long Festival.  Over 20 years it has grown from music and dance to become a custodian of the African culture, history, entertainment and education.  It was endorsed in 2011 and incorporated into the Lagos State events calendar. It hosts an audience of over 1 million people across the globe (With over 30,000 in Nigeria).  Since 1999, Felabration Musical Concert has hosted more than a 100 Artistes on a yearly basis including:

  • Hugh Masekela
  • Third World
  • Tuface Idibia
  • D Banj
  • Whiz Kid
  • Kwam 1
  • King Sunny Ade
  • Chocolate City Boiz (MI, Jessy Jagz, Ice Prince)
  • Flea (Red Hot Chilli Peppers
  • Olamide
  • Tekno
  • Oritshefemi
  • Mavin All Stars
  • Mr Eazi
  • Patoranking

This year is 20 years since Fela passed and we want to make 2017 the very best Felabration yet to truly honour his legacy. 

Your donation will also ensure the preservation of the existing Fela Anikulapo-Kuti archive, which is currently held at The New Afrika Shrine and The Kalakuta Museum both based in Ikeja, Lagos, Nigeria.  His collection includes, photographs of family members pre-dating his musical career, charting his musical career at home and abroad, a variety of musical ephemera including recordings and album art, personal correspondence and hand written/typed lyrics, clothing and musical instruments.

Your support will enable the delivery of a, much needed assessment, that identifies preservation priorities of the Fela Anikulapo-Kuti collection.  Addressing the urgent issues the collection currently faces, as it deteriorates under a number of factors including weather, limited intervention and collection management.

Thank you for taking time to read about our campaign for Felabration 2017

Please help us spread the word, 'Everybody say YEAH YEAH!!'. 

http://www.felabration.net/

Festival Elements 2017 include:

  • Street carnival (1 day) - music, DJ's, decorated floats, parades by Lagos State Troupes
  • Musical concerts (7 days)- venues include New Africa Shrine, Freedom Park
  • Musical concerts (1 day) - venue Teslim Balogun Stadium (TBS)
  • Fela week Partners (7 days)- exhibitions, film festivals, book reviews, performance
  • Syposium (1 day)
  • Senior Secondary Schools Debate (1 day)

 

The Team

This crowdfunding campaign is being headed by our Project Historian Kiera Adegbite, a long time friend of the Kuti familyProject  and Archivist Ego Ahaiwe Sowinski.

Our campaign is supported by the Felabration Organising Committee (FOC), the New Afrika Shrine, Kalakuta Museum, Freedom Park and the estate of Fela Anikulapo-Kuti, alongside Trace magazine Nigeria.

you can email crowdfundfela@gmail.com with any further questions or comments.
story_txt:
Felabration 20 Years On: Promoting, preserving & protecting the Legacy of Fela Anikulapo- KutiSupporting Felabration 2017 the Festival & ArchiveThe last several years have been a challenge financially as festival related costs have increased.  As the year has gone on, we have continued to plan for the festival, however, it’s become apparent that we will be unable to achieve this without the help and support of Fela’s global community. We are confident that within this global community there are at least 1000 people who would be willing and able to donate $20 to keep the festival going.  No donation is too small or too large all support is welcomed.  Your donation will help defray the costs associated with artists’ travel, lodging, sound, security, and all other festival associated expenses. Fela Ankulapo Kuti is a global icon whose words still resonate, thus the theme for the 20th Felabration is “The Prophecy”.  Starting as a day of celebration; Felabration has evolved into a week long Festival.  Over 20 years it has grown from music and dance to become a custodian of the African culture, history, entertainment and education.  It was endorsed in 2011 and incorporated into the Lagos State events calendar. It hosts an audience of over 1 million people across the globe (With over 30,000 in Nigeria).  Since 1999, Felabration Musical Concert has hosted more than a 100 Artistes on a yearly basis including:
Hugh Masekela
Third World
Tuface Idibia
D Banj
Whiz Kid
Kwam 1
King Sunny Ade
Chocolate City Boiz (MI, Jessy Jagz, Ice Prince)
Flea (Red Hot Chilli Peppers
Olamide
Tekno
Oritshefemi
Mavin All Stars
Mr Eazi
Patoranking
This year is 20 years since Fela passed and we want to make 2017 the very best Felabration yet to truly honour his legacy. Your donation will also ensure the preservation of the existing Fela Anikulapo-Kuti archive, which is currently held at The New Afrika Shrine and The Kalakuta Museum both based in Ikeja, Lagos, Nigeria.  His collection includes, photographs of family members pre-dating his musical career, charting his musical career at home and abroad, a variety of musical ephemera including recordings and album art, personal correspondence and hand written/typed lyrics, clothing and musical instruments.Your support will enable the delivery of a, much needed assessment, that identifies preservation priorities of the Fela Anikulapo-Kuti collection.  Addressing the urgent issues the collection currently faces, as it deteriorates under a number of factors including weather, limited intervention and collection management.Thank you for taking time to read about our campaign for Felabration 2017Please help us spread the word, 'Everybody say YEAH YEAH!!'. http://www.felabration.net/Festival Elements 2017 include:
Street carnival (1 day) - music, DJ's, decorated floats, parades by Lagos State Troupes
Musical concerts (7 days)- venues include New Africa Shrine, Freedom Park
Musical concerts (1 day) - venue Teslim Balogun Stadium (TBS)
Fela week Partners (7 days)- exhibitions, film festivals, book reviews, performance
Syposium (1 day)
Senior Secondary Schools Debate (1 day)
 The TeamThis crowdfunding campaign is being headed by our Project Historian Kiera Adegbite, a long time friend of the Kuti familyProject  and Archivist Ego Ahaiwe Sowinski.Our campaign is supported by the Felabration Organising Committee (FOC), the New Afrika Shrine, Kalakuta Museum, Freedom Park and the estate of Fela Anikulapo-Kuti, alongside Trace magazine Nigeria.you can email crowdfundfela@gmail.com with any further questions or comments.

story:
Under The Same Sun

Under the Same Sun is an album that with your help I will record in the Songkites Studio, Cambodia. Songkites is a Therapeutic Music Project created together with Euan Gray that aims to nurture creative expression, leadership and community through songwriting, production and performance with young people in Cambodia and post-conflict contexts around the world.

I believe music and songwriting is a powerful way of expressing, communicating and making sense of the difficult things we face in this world.

For the past 15 years, I have been working in conflict and post-conflict zones as a Creative Arts Therapist and had the privilege to journey with people who face all kinds of traumas and challenges. I have found that each of these people have within them the capacity to transform these experiences into beauty and powerful art. It is their stories, my stories and the collective stories of this world that I want to give voice to through the art of songwriting.

I have written an album of songs on issues such as: refugees and forced migration, human trafficking and abuse, relationships, loss, managing change and transition. 

The songs are ready! I am now building a community of supporters to help me to make this project possible. I have an amazing band and producer already onboard. All I need is YOU!

With your support I will be able to: record the album with an amazing band and our Songkites producer, Euan Gray; make a music video involving people around the world; bring the music to you through live gigs, presentations and therapeutic songwriting workshops. It will help the research and development of therapeutic songwriting processes that all feeds into our therapeutic songwriting project, Songkites here in Cambodia. You can be part of making this possible. You might even want to have a song written especially for you, or for a situation or person you deeply care about. I love taking photographs of our beautiful world and am sharing a collection of sunset photos as posters and canvas prints – you might want to bring the warmth of the sun into your home or office, or give as a gift to someone special in your life.

What We Need & What You Get

It matters to me that people know where their funding and support is going. I want to be transparent about the budget and who is involved. 

I need to raise $10,000 This will be used for Session Musicians, Music Production, Mixing & Mastering, Studio Hire & Overheads, Video Production, Design and Artwork. 

There are lots of ways you can contribute, and here through this campaign you can:

  • Join a community to support the development of Therapeutic Songwriting,
  • Pre-purchase the album and receive it before anyone else through a digital download,
  • Receive a poster or canvas print of a sunset image of your choice, 
  • Invest in the first music video I have ever created that will also involve many people around the world in its production,
  • Host a gig* in your home town (this can be a living room gig, one in your organisation or community, or in a cafe or music venue),
  • Host a presentation* about therapeutic songwriting.
  • Host a therapeutic songwriting workshop* for your community or organisation,
  • Commission a therapeutic song to be written for a person or a cause that matters to you
  • Everyone who contributes will be thanked in the album credits and on social media. 

 

If we don't reach the entire goal we will do a smaller version of the Album as I committed to making as much of this happen as possible.

*For all gigs, presentations and workshops – I am planning to travel over the next year on a work and research sabbatical – I will endeavor to honour as many requests as is possible and may need some support with practical overheads in some contexts (please feel free to contact me to discuss if you are interested in any of these perks and are not in my usual travel route (South Asia, Europe)!).

The Impact

  • The opportunity to do this project is so valuable to me and the development of our therapeutic songwriting project Songkites in Cambodia and other post conflict areas around the world. 
  • I have made a small EP before and this will be my first studio album and music video.
  • It will give me opportunity to bring these songs and the issues raised to a much wider audience.
  • It will build a community of people interested in supporting therapeutic songwriting initiatives around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this Campaign with your family, friends and community
  • Feel free to contact me if you want to know more about this project or Songkites - our Therapeutic Songwriting project. Or Ragamuffin International our Creative Arts Therapy Services.

I hope you will consider joining me on this journey and I hope to see you somewhere under the same sun ! 

Thanks for taking time to read this.

Carrie 

 

Video Credits: Thanks to Euan Gray for making it possible for the crowdfunder video to be created. Recorded live at Songkites Studio, Phnom Penh, Thanks to Larry for the beautiful piano playing. Artwork by Nataly Lee. Refugee Photos by Ververidis Vasilis.

story:
My Story


My name is Meredith Joi and I need your help.

I am an Americana-pop artist living outside of Nashville, Tennessee and have been submerged in music since I could talk.  Recently, I decided to take the leap to be a full-time artist.

Some of my influences include many female vocalists of the 90's including Jewel, Sixpence None the Richer, The Cranberries, and Alanis Morissette.  I have vivid memories of sitting in my car-seat and singing their songs at the top of my lungs.  After spending months interning and working in a publishing company, a music venue and earning a degree in Commercial Songwriting, I learned that the business aspect of sitting in a room writing the same song over and over wasn't for me.

As an artist, I need to sing and write when it is creatively productive for me; to play those songs for people whether or not it ever amounts to more.

I have waited so long to do this and knowing that it's about to happen feels awesome!  I can't wait to see this dream come true.  I hope you'll see it through with me!

Your investment in this campaign will help with the EP, a new website, a music video, artwork, photography, merchandise and more.
 

Thank you so much for helping me!

Love ya,
Meredith Joi

 

EXCLUSIVE CONTENT

Every person who donates $5 or more will receive priority access to exclusive footage of a live performance/interview with MEREDITH JOI!  The video will be online at the end of the campaign and YOU will be able to see before the rest of WORLD!

Be sure to follow me on Instagram and Facebook!

Instagram @meredith_joi

facebook.com/meredithjoi


God bless and have Joi.

story:
Dear friends:

On June 23-25 I will be finally producing a long-cherished project: Pieces of CANE/ KABNIS! - a musical and interdisciplinary adaptation of Jean Toomer’s Harlem Renaissance masterpiece. Developed in collaboration with director Jacqui Parker and video artist Kate Matson, KABNIS! brings this radical (and timely) text into the 21st century.

I have worked with the CANE for more than three decades as both an educator and as a creative musician. “Kabnis” - the third and final section of Jean Toomer’s 1923 experimental novel – is a long short story which tells the story of a Northern black “intellectual” who is about to end his troubled sojourn as a teacher at a rural, segregated Georgia school for black children. Jean Toomer’s attempts to reconstruct the meanings of race and the consequences of racial identity formation at the beginning of a post-Reconstruction early 20th century really does resonate in our 21st century of global mass communication and international Hip-Hop nation. The gothic horror of the ways in which fear of lynching insinuates itself into the mundane and social and sexual relations of a community of black men and women in the rural south in the 1920’s is the dramatic engine that drives the narrative. And this gothic horror narrative feels ever more relevant today. We must provide the next generation with the tools to create positive articulations about the negative energies and histories that created the complex world in which we live.

This project is about creative choices and positive manipulations of an existing textual masterpiece. Those poems which call for rendering as songs will be so treated. Likewise, the longer, narrative poems are to be performed as dance pieces with the evocation of the poem in duet with instrumental music. The cast features nine brilliant actors: Born Bikim, Bill Bruce, Jermaine Hamilton, Candis Hilton, Anthony  Hinds, Jorge Lopes, Myisha  Rodrigues-Scott, Brian Savage, and Andrea Whitfield. The music is performed by my own eight-piece Signifyin’ Natives Ensemble, including Wesley Brown (bass), Taylor Ho Bynum (cornet), John Kordalewski (piano), Ron Mahdi (bass), Jason Robinson (saxophones), Warren Smith (percussion), and Patrice Williamson (vocals). The core musicians are all master improvisers and long-time collaborators, so we get the full “Ellington” effect: not of Ellington’s unique sound but Ellington’s unique understanding of improvisation and personality as a compositional tool. I also share long collaborative histories with director Jacqui Parker and animator Kate Matson in a wide variety of productions and venues. This is my core creative team. The creation of Pieces of CANE/KABNIS! is a gathering of forces and a focus of my life’s work in music, theater and literature.

If you share my reverence for this extraordinary text, if you share my enthusiasm for these wonderful collaborators, if you share my belief that we need to keep reexamining and reimagining the classics to find their contemporary resonances - please consider supporting this project. This is truly a culminating work of my own artistic journey; something I feel I’ve been working towards for decades. The donor perks include some fun musical treats and thank yous – but also some great chances to engage with the artists. We want you to be part of the team, part of the process, and part of the conversation. Please support us and/or come join us Friday, Saturday or Sunday, June 23, 24 and 25, in Boston, as we coax Toomer’s characters to come to life on the Hibernian stage, 184 Dudley Street in Roxbury. (All performances begin promptly at 8:00 pm.)

Thanks for reading, and please spread the word! Peace,

Bill Lowe

story:
Music has been part of me for as long as I can remember. As a little kid, my Dad had nick names for me like Tune Bug and Tune Tune. I’ve been playing music ever since but never on my own like I have been doing in recent years.



I’m lucky to be able to play music for a living, but when my Dad died unexpectedly, I stopped writing music entirely. I felt completely lost and alone. If it weren’t for my need to provide for my kids with my music, I might have forgotten the healing powers of music.
As a single Mom of two, it’s financially difficult to get a whole album recorded and released, so I am hoping that all my fans and supporters can help to make this happen.
I’ve had so many people at my shows ask where they can get my music or T-shirt so I am reaching out to those who have following me and who have been there continually showing love and support. And of course to new friends who enjoy my music I’m excited to have you listen to my new album!

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise enough money to have physical CDs and T-shirts to sell at my shows, not to mention to pay for the cost of recording in the studio, paying the engineer as well as the musicians who played on it!  As you can imagine the costs add up quickly. The more money we make here the better since I want to deliver the best possible product for you! 

The Impact

I’ve been playing music in the Southern California area for a while now but only on my own in the last few years, so your support means more then you can imagine! I’ve seen tremendous things happen for me personally and musically as I find the courage to take bolder and bolder steps, this fundraiser being the boldest! I sincerely appreciate any and all help you can afford. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends on any social media you can! It all helps a bunch!

story:
YOU CAN STILL CONTRIBUTE AND GET PERKS!

Click here: https://paypal.me/MusicManMarkArnold and tell me what PERK you want in the note section.

Summary

I’m Mark Arnold and I’ve got a story to tell.  The story seems like it’s all about me, but it’s really all about all of us.  It’s a story about evolution, my evolution and yours.  I have been writing and performing music pretty much my whole life.  No matter where I’ve gone, music has gone with me.

Now we have entered new territory, a land rich with fertile soil to grow us in profound, spiritual ways.  My music has changed to fit this new landscape.  And I like where it’s headed.

“Dare To Be Yourself” is my first professionally recorded CD.  It reflects my journey (and yours, too) as I have awakened from my spiritual slumber and begun a voyage of personal growth and expansion that I’m hopeful will inspire you on your own voyage.

I have written more than enough music to fill a CD.  The purpose of recording this CD is to spread the notion that we are not victims of our circumstances, but the creators.  It is an expression of my own joy and excitement about my personal growth, a celebration of my own freedom, and AN INVITATION FOR YOU TO CLAIM YOURS!

What We Need & What You Get

It will cost $10,000 to make this project a reality.  I don’t have $10,000.  But, when we all pitch in together, we can make it happen easily and effortlessly.  “Many hands make a light load.”

Every single person who donates to this project is taking a definitive stand for their own powers of manifestation.  The making of the album itself is a demonstration of consciousness creating.  Together, we will have all transformed an idea into reality.  That is very powerful stuff!

We will have produced a tangible piece of evidence that testifies to the messages in the album itself:

Be true to yourself

Dreams come true

We are not victims of circumstances

We have more power to create than we ever dreamed possible

The CD itself represents the triumph of manifesting something real. In gratitude for your playing with me, here are the perks you can get:

A Digital Download of the CD, A Physical Copy of the CD, A Ticket to the CD Release Concert, A Concert In Your Own Home, A Song Written Just For You, & Credit as the Executive Producer of the CD.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about “Dare To Be Yourself”.  Use all the tools at your disposal: Email, Facebook, Social Media.  The bigger this gets, the better!  Indiegogo has a bunch of ways to easily send links to your friends and family.

Thank you in advance for the fabulous CD we are going to make, TOGETHER!

YOU CAN STILL CONTRIBUTE AND GET PERKS!
Click here: https://paypal.me/MusicManMarkArnold and tell me what PERK you want in the note section.
SummaryI’m Mark Arnold and I’ve got a story to tell.  The story seems like it’s all about me, but it’s really all about all of us.  It’s a story about evolution, my evolution and yours.  I have been writing and performing music pretty much my whole life.  No matter where I’ve gone, music has gone with me.Now we have entered new territory, a land rich with fertile soil to grow us in profound, spiritual ways.  My music has changed to fit this new landscape.  And I like where it’s headed.“Dare To Be Yourself” is my first professionally recorded CD.  It reflects my journey (and yours, too) as I have awakened from my spiritual slumber and begun a voyage of personal growth and expansion that I’m hopeful will inspire you on your own voyage.I have written more than enough music to fill a CD.  The purpose of recording this CD is to spread the notion that we are not victims of our circumstances, but the creators.  It is an expression of my own joy and excitement about my personal growth, a celebration of my own freedom, and AN INVITATION FOR YOU TO CLAIM YOURS!What We Need & What You GetIt will cost $10,000 to make this project a reality.  I don’t have $10,000.  But, when we all pitch in together, we can make it happen easily and effortlessly.  “Many hands make a light load.”Every single person who donates to this project is taking a definitive stand for their own powers of manifestation.  The making of the album itself is a demonstration of consciousness creating.  Together, we will have all transformed an idea into reality.  That is very powerful stuff!We will have produced a tangible piece of evidence that testifies to the messages in the album itself:Be true to yourselfDreams come trueWe are not victims of circumstancesWe have more power to create than we ever dreamed possibleThe CD itself represents the triumph of manifesting something real. story:
What is Jonathan Day Productions?

Jonathan Day Productions started as a simple idea. It all began when i started thinking of ways that i could better my very small community here in Hazlehurst, GA. Here in this small town music and art have never "taken off", though hundreds of people play instruments here. Overtime i would go hear someone local or see videos of people playing from this area there has been one thing in common... a lack of an excellent production. The music will be really great but the sound systems have been far from even ok. I have been slowly building up my own system and tools to make music great in this community but have come to a halt. The reason I need your help making the next big leap is to push my small company into the the realm of excellence. I want to be able to provide non-profits and small town folks the ability to have an amazing live performance. Hopefully you can help me achieve this goal. To make music great in Hazlehurst, GA.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am looking at trying to raise 6000$. Woah! that sounds like a lot but let me tell you what you as a contributor are helping accomplish.
  • So with this money I am going to purchase a top of the line sound system. If you donate more than $400 you will get to experience the system first hand. There are a ton of perks that I am offering to those who give. Even those that cannot give a lot I will even be giving you a little something.
  • What happens if i don't reach my goal of $6000? Every penny I get will go towards purchasing this sound system. Even if we do not reach the goal at once i will keep pursuing this because I want to see a great production come out of little ole Hazlehurst.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially thats OK!

  • If you can't give financially that is perfectly ok because one of the biggest ways you can help me is by sharing this page literally as many times as possible. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, EVERYWHERE!
  • Also remember that indiegogo has some great tools to help you share this campaign as well!

story:
The Project 

D. CLEA will be releasing IN SICKNESS this spring, and we need help funding it! What is IN SICKNESS? It's a seven-song album, and the first of a pair of concept albums releasing in 2016 that together will be IN SICKNESS, and IN HEALTH. It's been quite some time since we've released an album, and we are beyond ready to show you all the sound that we have spent the past few years shaping and sharpening. 

****Listen to a pre-album version of the track Wearing Skin!


What We Need & What We Are Giving

$5,500 will cover the cost of the album making process, from our time in the recording studio to the pressing of the final product!  The money raised makes it possible for us to share our music with you, and that's what we live for.
We have put together some perks so that by donating money, you will receive an exciting album bundle! There are different perks for different donation amounts. We will be revealing things like album and poster artwork in the weeks leading up to the album release, but below you can see the t-shirt design (available in both gray and white), and our limited edition postcards that are included in some of the perk bundles!

About The Band

Based currently in Springfield, MO, D.CLEA is the Alternative-Pop project fronted by singer-songwriter Darien Clea, joined by Matt Fritzler on percussion, Ryan Westeren on bass, Emmoe Doniz on harmonies, and Caleb Block on guitar. Weaving in elements of Rock, Jazz, Pop, EDM and R&B, D.CLEA designs songs that give equal reverence to the complexities of their melodies, rhythms, and lyrics- offering their audience an experience aimed to entertain them and haunt them.

The Impact 

Music is powerful. It's a vehicle for sharing not just sounds, but feelings. For that reason, there is no limit to how music can connect people to each other, and that is the goal of this album: to connect with people. 
Food For Thought:
  • By donating to this project, you aren't just helping us do what we love; you are supporting a herd of other local artists and entrepreneurs as well. 
  • The creating of an album involves writers and musicians, yes, but by making this album possible you are also helping to make work opportunities for music producers, engineers, photographers, videographers, graphic designers and more!
More About The Album
"The concept of this album really grew out of my own disillusionment with the modern idea of love that I saw was so prevalent- that people in our lives should make us happy, and if they don't, we should cut them out and find new people who do make us happy. This idea bothered me. Where is the richness of relationship if I've never walked with someone through their darkest hour? How does the love in my heart ever expand and grow stronger if I only love people who are easy to love...if I only love people when they are healthy? And I came to the conclusion that I don't believe in Happy-Love. I believe love can make us happier than anything else in the world, yes, but I don't believe that happiness is the same as love. I think the highest form of love can be found in loving someone who is sick, and not just under-the-weather-sick, but so sick they aren't even the same person you loved in the beginning. So sick they can't love you back. That kind of love doesn't usually make you happy. It cleanses and purifies you through and through, and you come face to face with your own sickness along the way, but in the end you'll find the most surprising gift in another's sickness: you'll find health. You loved someone who was unable to love you back and somehow you became more loved than you've ever been. You stood by someone in their sickness and you both came away healthy. 

The songs on this album reflect this journey, not just of loving someone in their sickness, but of being loved in my sickness. I'm so excited to share this album with you and invite you to let it be a part of your journey, In Sickness and In Health."

-Darien 


Other Ways You Can Help
We appreciate you visiting this page, and if donating is not an option but you believe in what we are doing, we would love it if you shared this through:
  • Social Media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.) 
  • Word of Mouth
  • Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you sincerely!

-Darien, Emmoe, Matt, Caleb, and Ryan
