story:
We're ready!

We're a "lyrically refreshing and musically diverse" Roots-Folk duo and we've been touring our original music throughout North America since 2013. Since finding each other and joining forces we've played hundreds of house concerts, concert series', and theaters, and recently we've been getting noticed by festival programmers. It seems we may be on to something.

With audiences buying up our previous two Dan and Laurel albums to the point where we often have to run to the car for more, it's time to step it up and also get our music out to radio and print media. Added to the costs of recording and manufacturing a new album, launching a publicity campaign is expensive and time consuming. We fell short on publicity funding with our second album, and don't want to do that with this one. We'd love to be able to finally hire a helper or two!

We've recently recorded twelve new original songs which together create our most ambitious project to date. We are very excited to share these particular creations on a third album, entitled "Between The Rain" at our official CD release April 27th and to take it on the road for tours already booked through the end of the year. We hope you'll take this chance to pre-order the record and help make it possible!

What We Need & What You Get

Based on past experience and a successfully funded campaign for our second album, we've estimated that we need $7,500 to make our third release the best it can be while staying true to the sound and quality we envision and our growing fan base expects.

Here's the breakdown:

-Recording/Mixing/Mastering ~ $3000

-Studio Musicians ~ $350

-Manufacturing 1000 CD's ~ $1250

-CD Graphic Design ~ $150

-Album Photography ~ $250

-Publicity in print and radio for initial US and Canadian CD release tours ~ $2500

Donations of any amount are appreciated and if you pledge $25 or more you will receive the new album in the mail by June 2016. In addition, we have many other valuable rewards for you to enjoy, including violin, guitar, or songwriting lessons, having us guest record on your next album, music for your next party or event, and digital access to our combined 42 years of individual discographies.

Should we receive more than our target amount (many artists ask for 15-25K to record a new album) we will be able to spend more time in the studio as needed to ensure that each new song gets the treatment it deserves. We'll also have a serious budget for marketing our latest release and a budget for creating other merchandise we hope you'll enjoy and appreciate.

If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will use any funds received to switch gears and either record an EP with the best of these twelve songs (don't even want to think about having to choose...), or find ways to cut costs even more and scale back so we can still share the full length record. Regardless, should the worst case scenario become a reality, we will communicate our new direction to everyone who has pledged, fulfill all gifts associated with the campaign, and still have some form of new music to share with you this Spring.

The Impact

Both now in our 30s, we've been making our livings as professional musicians since we were teenagers. We've both struggled through and overcome times that challenged our belief in our musical life paths and we live a frugal and simple life that affords us the ability to keep touring and sharing what we love.

We've also both enjoyed past successes - through previous albums funded and released, as educators, and as people who consistently touch the hearts and minds of audiences and our music students. Through experience, we know that a professional studio treatment of what we believe are some of our best songs and compositions, as well as a budget to market such a release, at this point in our careers, would help us reach people who want to be moved, who want to laugh, and who want to feel the hope and inspiration we feel through this music.

We love the organic, word of mouth, under the radar approach because it has brought us true fans and many lifelong friends and home away from homes. However, we would also love the boost and credibility that a well recorded and marketed album could have, allowing us to hopefully spend more time working on our music, and less time trying to spark the interest of promoters who have never heard of us.

Risks & Challenges

We have the studio arranged (Bear Creek Studio in Bonny Doon - http://bearcreekrecordingstudio.net), all the people required for production lined up, and a detailed timeline in place to ensure we are ready to release our new album in the States on April 27, 2016 and in Canada on our tour starting in May 2016. While we've factored in extra time for minor delays should they arise, we'd love to be able to completely focus on recording this album now, rather than whether or not funding will be available when we need to write the checks.

We are highly creative, motivated, and problem solving individuals, and have released over 25 albums between us in the past, mostly on very low budgets. Should one door close, we are confident that we'd quickly find another to walk through. We're well prepared and well rehearsed to record these songs and are confident that many of them can be recorded live-off-the-floor in one take.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are financially able to pre-order the new album and contribute to it's creation at this time, we'd appreciate your help sharing this campaign with the music lovers and supporters in your life! Indiegogo makes sharing to mailing lists and social media as easy as clicking the appropriate links to the left of our campaign video above.

We're also booking shows through into 2017 at this time, and pre-buying music for your event - wedding, party, launch - is a wonderful way to give us a bigger boost right now when we most need it. And while we'd be tickled if you chose to feature our original music, we are also well prepared to play hundreds if not thousands of Classical favorites and/or cover tunes. We'd be happy to send along a list of our extensive repertoire. Please send us a message at info@danandlaurel.ca and we can talk dates and options.

Finally, if you're a venue, house concert host, festival director, concert series, radio DJ, or music camp, we'd love to arrange to share our new CD with you in concert. Once the album is in hand, the real work of spreading it far and wide begins! We'll be touring the Western US, South, East Coast, New England, and coast to coast throughout Canada in 2016. We hope you can be an integral part of our journey!

story:
Rachel's Debut Album

Hi, my name is Rachel Knowles.  Singing and entertaining people are my passions. So, I am beginning a journey that includes recording my first album.

I am 13 years old and an 8th grade student. I have been singing and dancing since before I can remember. I have been taking dance classes since I was 3 years old and performing in recitals, talent shows, and dance competitions since.  I have been singing in school choruses since 3rd grade. I sing in the worship team for the children's ministry at my church.

I recently started writing songs and singing more and discovered that I love it.  One of my biggest dreams is to become a Christian pop singer. I want to motivate other young people to pursue their dreams and overcome adversities. Singing and songwriting is the new direction I see myself going with my life.  My music styles include Christian Contemporary, pop, and alternative.

I am working with a local music producer and musician, Nick Coetzee with Rain Music Recording Studio (http://www.rainmusic.org). We recorded the song Oceans by Hillsong in my own style. This is one of my favorite songs and I wanted my initial song to be one that others are familiar with.  I have been writing several other songs that I want to record. 

What I Need From You & What You Get

Although I have supportive parents, family, and friends, they are not able to fully fund this project. I need to raise $6,500 to produce an album that will include Oceans plus four more original songs.  This amount includes all expenses needed to produce the album including producer fees, studio fees, musicians, mastering, artwork, and manufacturing.  

The incentives for your donations are accumulative:

$5.00  Digital Download of Oceans

$10.00 Signed picture mailed to you.

$25.00 Signed copy of the EP mailed to you.

$50.00 Credit for support on EP's liner notes

$100.00 Meet me (and one of my parents) for milkshakes or coffee at a mutually agreeable location in the Tampa Bay Area

$250.00 Concert at your home in the Tampa Bay area.

$500.00 Song written for you and performed at your home or business within 50 miles of Tampa Bay area.  

The Impact

I want to inspire and motivate others by creating positive songs and music. By supporting this project I believe we will impact other kids my age to find their talents and reach for their dreams. I believe that God gives us talents for a reason and I can bring joy and happiness to people and cheer them up when they listen to my songs.

Risks & Challenges

I know that there are a lot of people out there who will say, there is no way she can be a Christian Pop Singer. But, because I have faith in God and I have very supportive parents, family, and friends who are helping me to follow my dreams, I believe I can. And, I have learned the hard way not to let people's negative statements and attitudes get to me. I know that it's not going to be easy.  But, anything that's worth something shouldn't come easy.  

Other Ways You Can Help

And, if you think, there's no way you can help; That's Not True.  Because even if you don't have the money to donate; you can spread the word, share my link, and tell people that I'm worth the support.  Your prayers and kind thoughts mean a lot to me.  I am very grateful for those of you out there who will give me a SHOUT OUT and tell the world about this exciting project.  

Thank you for your time and thoughtful consideration.

Singing and songwriting is the new direction I see myself going with my life.  My music styles include Christian Contemporary, pop, and alternative.
I am working with a local music producer and musician, Nick Coetzee with Rain Music Recording Studio (http://www.rainmusic.org). We recorded the song Oceans by Hillsong in my own style. This is one of my favorite songs and I wanted my initial song to be one that others are familiar with.  I have been writing several other songs that I want to record.    What I Need From You & What You Get Although I have supportive parents, family, and friends, they are not able to fully fund this project. I need to raise $6,500 to produce an album that will include Oceans plus four more original songs.  This amount includes all expenses needed to produce the album including producer fees, studio fees, musicians, mastering, artwork, and manufacturing.  
The incentives for your donations are accumulative:
$5.00  Digital Download of Oceans
$10.00 Signed picture mailed to you.
$25.00 Signed copy of the EP mailed to you.
$50.00 Credit for support on EP's liner notes
$100.00 Meet me (and one of my parents) for milkshakes or coffee at a mutually agreeable location in the Tampa Bay Area
$250.00 Concert at your home in the Tampa Bay area.
$500.00 Song written for you and performed at your home or business within 50 miles of Tampa Bay area.  
    The Impact I want to inspire and motivate others by creating positive songs and music. By supporting this project I believe we will impact other kids my age to find their talents and reach for their dreams. I believe that God gives us talents for a reason and I can bring joy and happiness to people and cheer them up when they listen to my songs.
    Risks & Challenges
I know that there are a lot of people out there who will say, there is no way she can be a Christian Pop Singer. But, because I have faith in God and I have very supportive parents, family, and friends who are helping me to follow my dreams, I believe I can. And, I have learned the hard way not to let people's negative statements and attitudes get to me. I know that it's not going to be easy.  But, anything that's worth something shouldn't come easy.     Other Ways You Can Help And, if you think, there's no way you can help; That's Not True.  Because even if you don't have the money to donate; you can spread the word, share my link, and tell people that I'm worth the support.  Your prayers and kind thoughts mean a lot to me.  I am very grateful for those of you out there who will give me a SHOUT OUT and tell the world about this exciting project.  
Thank you for your time and thoughtful consideration.

story: After returning from Carnegie Hall and performing with Deke Sharron, thanks to DCINY, Kit is now supercharged to release her first original single that she has written! She is finding though, that there are many costs to getting this song released, like the copyrights to her own song, producing it, putting it on digital streaming platforms like iTunes, and other expenses that she had no idea were involved. This is where Kit is asking her fans, friends and family for a little bit of help, no matter how small. This is a song Kit started writing and fine tuning at age twelve and it has been her message of hope and drive. As always, Thank You so Much for your support, as you are the ones who help her Dreams Come True❤️

story:
Handel Week Festival's 17th Season: Dixit Dominus

The Handel Week Festival is Oak Park's celebration of the music of George Frideric Handel (1685-1759).  We need your help to stage one of Handel's most complex and majestic choral works: Dixit Dominus HWV 232. This was the composer's first large-scale work, rediscovered by musicologists in 1926.

Twenty-four singers and a professional baroque orchestra of 14 players will present this dazzling work on Sunday, Feb. 14, 2016 at the acoustically exceptional Grace Episcopal Church in Oak Park, Illinois. 


Handel Week acquires the top baroque artists in Chicago and vicinity by offering union scale-wages to our orchestra and singers in the chorus. We need to fill a gap in our financing to pay our artists and the rent on the lovely Grace Church. 

Handel Week, Inc. is a 501(c)3 corporation and any donation you give is fully tax-deductible. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • On average, our large-scale concerts can cost as much as $30,000 to stage. We receive funding from the Illinois Arts Council, the Oak Park Area Arts Council, generous donations from benefactors and ticket sales. 
  • This year, arts funding is frozen by the State of Illinois budget impasse.
  • We are asking for help with $8,000. 
  • Of that, we already have a commitment of $2,250 from our board of directors. 
  • If you participate in this campaign, we will show our deep appreciation with a professionally recorded CD of the concert along with other prizes --- including a framed page from the libretto, a resin composer mini-bust of GF Handel and lunch with Artistic Director Dennis Northway!

Our Impact

For 17 years, the Handel Week Festival has been a world-class resource for the performance of Handel's works, from the obscure early Italian chamber cantatas to  blockbuster oratorios Messiah and Israel in Egypt. There is simply no other group in the world dedicated to exploring all of Handel's prolific works and performing them with such quality.

The festival brings music lovers from all over Chicago and the western suburbs to Oak Park for three concerts around Handel's birthday (Feb. 23, 1685) every year. Handel Week also presents a free children's concert in April.

Free Children's Concert 2015

Handel Week Festival began in 2000, patterned after the highly successful Bach Week Festival in Evanston. Founders Dennis Northway and Charles Chauncey Wells believed the works of this great master would be as enthusiastically received.

We have partnered with other arts organizations in Oak Park and Chicago including the Heritage Chorale, Music of the Baroque, WFMT, Oak Park Temple, Winifred Haun Dancers,  the Symphony of Oak Park and River Forest, the Oak Park Public Library and the Oak Park Conservatory.

We have presented $500 scholarships to 10 area high school students for vocal studies. Scholarship winners perform with the Handel Week Festival Chorus. 

Scholarship winner 

Kate Barnhart

We have led the world in performing Handel works: In 2003 we presented a world-re-premier of Gloria, a newly-discovered Handel masterpiece which had lain dormant in a London library for about 150 years.

We have nurtured the careers of talented artists in Chicago and beyond by featuring  soloists  Sarah Gartshore, Kimberly McCord, Amy Anderson de Jong, Rosalind Lee and harpsichordist Thomas Wickman. In 2015 we presented Bach’s Mass in B Minor as a special tribute to our benefactress the late Helen Pinnell. 

Kimberly McCord

Risks & Challenges

The Handel Week Festival has survived -- and thrived-- over 17 years. In 2015, our ticket sales for Bach's B Minor Mass were the highest we had seen in the history of the festival. 

But ticket sales cover only about 20 percent of our total operating budget. 

We need your help to bring Handel's exquisite music to our patrons. 

  • Quantity counts! Even if you donate a small amount, or a small monthly gift, your donation will push our campaign higher on the Indiegogo website and give us more visibility! Please choose a perk today and give to the Handel Week Festival. 
  • Other Ways You Can Help
  • If you'd like to help Handel Week, please get the word out about our campaign. Please let your friends on Facebook and Twitter know about our fundraising goal to bring Dixit Dominus to our 2016 festival. 
See our entire Handel Week Festival lineup at: www.handelweek.com

story:
Short Summary

After our first album "Does Humor Belong In Classical Music?", and our second one, "Kong's Revenge", we're going to record the third album on Zappa's Music: "Zapping!".

Zapping! will be an album dedicated to the large Frank's Wonderful World mixed up with other composers who inspired him: from Stravinsky to Edgar Varese to themes often quoted by Frank.

All the arrangements are original. 

Original and crzay artwork, as usual, by Antero Valerio.

On the tracklist you'll find Zappa's pieces like G-Spot Tornado, Echidna's Arf of You, Wet T-Shirt Nite, Son of Mr Green Genes... 

Four original compositions:  The Modern Days Composers Refuse To Die (where Varese, Stravinsky and Zappa live together), Zapping (a surprise!), Gnok Gnik (read the reverse!), and an original composition by the young composer Michele Sarti inspired by Zappa.

For the first time we'll have a special guest, the percussionist Nazareno Caputo.

Our purpose is to play and keep alive Frank's music in our personal way: support us, support Frank's Music!


What We Need & What You Get

We set the goal at:
  • 4,000$ to record and master our album
If we will  reach the threshold of 6,000$ we'll produce also the vinyl of this album!

The advantage in contributing to this project is in having our products at a cheaper price!

Really, ours are start-up prices...so, why don't take advantage from them!!!


Moreover: there are special prices for those who'll be at our presentation concert in Hamburg, (13.07.2016 in St Katharinen Kirke) or at the next Zappanale (from 14 to 17.07.2016 in Bad Doberan). Check them out!

You can listen to our previous record on iTunes, Spotify or Youtube:


You can listen to our studio & live recordings on our Youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/user/inventionismater

Some videos:






We'll produce this album anyway, but with your contribute we'll be able to create a really special product and realease a right number of copies to share our music and our personal declination of Zappa around the world (and, if possible, to produce also a vinyl version!!!)

So, check out our perks and contribute. If you don't know how it works, let's write us at inventionismater@gmail.com and/or share this campaign with people interested in our music and in Zappa's Music!

Thanks for your support,
Inventionis Mater

Pierpaolo Romani & Andrea Pennati

story: During the time that Fin was in the studio recording their first EP, Thom the lead singer got diagnosed with a pretty hefty illness. This put us in the dumps financially and emotionally. We were unable to finish the record. As Thom continues to improve we plan on getting back to the studio in May 2016. Before donating,  We would like to invite you to let the music speak for itself, if it resonates within you, then make the decision whether to contribute or not.

story:
Oh hello there, you look amazing! 

How can we tell? Oh right, the internet told us through facial recognition. And you look fabulous. Excuse us while we sit down and introduce ourselves. I’m Jonah, the intellectual one. I’m Jonathan, the mischievous one. I’m Amy, the Asian one. And I’m Alex, the sassy yet shy one. United, we form the ever mighty, soulful-alt-indie-bluesy-poppy rockin’ quadratic known to many as The LoveHowl. 

We have been a band for over 5 years based out of New York. We’ve had our music featured on tv, made The Deli’s Best Emerging Artists list, played countless shows, but have yet to release a full length album. And ladies and gents, you are in luck because that time…IS NOW. 

We’ve been hard at work in the studio over the past year and can’t wait to finally share some new music with you. Our goal of $5,000 will go towards pressing this bad boy onto vinyl, the production costs for our first real music video, and new merch with the release of the record. As independent artists the costs of producing new material comes straight out of our own pockets so any contribution at all is a huge help.

What you get

Your donation to our new album can get ya some nifty things ranging from signed vinyl, that merch we were just talking about, to some other interesting services. If you are reading this there is a pretty good chance you are an artist or aspiring artist yourself. We at The LoveHowl are a smorgasbord of creative services. So if you or someone you know may want a set of guitar lessons, studio time, or design services for the holidays why you are in luck, cause we can help with that! And you’ll be giving the gift of supporting independent music. It’s a win win for all! HO HO HO! If you are a super fan, (Oh hey! You’re awesome) we’re offering some holiday treats like mad prop name dropping on the album, covering a song of your choice and recording it, an in house show, plus dinner with the band. 

Even if you’re unable to contribute at this time (which we totally understand) sharing is caring and appreciate the help by spreading the word! Tell your friends and fam that The LoveHowl is this handsome band straight outta Brooklyn and they could be a part of our first LP ever! Okay, now go get back to fighting evil and bringing joy to the world. You still look amazing, please share what hair products you are using. We love you.

Love,

The LoveHowl (Amy, Alex, Jonathan & Jonah)

story:
Alex Masi New Album in 2018

I have released eight solo and five band albums (received a Grammy nomination in 1989), toured extensively all over the world both as a solo artist and with my bands. I have collaborated with many great artists both in the studio and on stage, the one I'm most proud to have been associated with is the late, great Allan Holdsworth who's been a huge hero of mine and a never ending influence since my teenage years. Musically speaking I've always been into all kinds of music, I started on the piano when I was kid and the classical influence is still there as clearly shown in my "classical trilogy series" (In the Name of...) where I recorded music by JS Bach, WA Mozart and LV Beethoven but I've also always been attracted to modern music with a high level of groove and Rock is where I've been feeling at home for a few decades now.

IMPACT

With this Indiegogo campaign I hope for the first time in my career to be actually independent from the various restrictions and obstacles one encounters when dealing with record labels at all levels. The freedom of knowing I can record the music I hear in my head without having some record company exec telling me what I should or shouldn't do is HUGE!

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Contributors to my campaign will help achieve the goal of recording and releasing an album full of brand new music, something that's becoming more and more difficult to do in recent years due to the global phenomenon of digital downloads and piracy and the consequent effect it has had on the music industry and, more specifically, on the artists. Plus I plan on using a recording studio other than my home studio and finally record in the same room with the musicians, something I haven't been to do for a few years on my solo albums

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money raised from this campaign will go to booking studio time, especially for recording drums, getting a great sounding room for the drums, a great drummer and the right engineers to capture the performance is critical to the success of an album. I'll also be hiring some great musicians to play with me on the record. Then right after the mixing and mastering the album will need artwork and, finally, pressing copies to send to you, contributors, first
  • I have a number of perks specifically associated to this project ranging from receiving the album before it's actually released, private 1 on 1 lessons, a guitar I've recorded with on previous albums and more

The Impact

  • Contributing to this project, I believe, will make you part of the effort that many musicians, like myself, are making in order to keep new music coming out. 
  • My previous albums like Attack of the Neon Shark, the Bach, Mozart, Beethoven classical trilogy and the other ones have fared quite well both with critics and audiences around the world, even a Grammy nomination
  • With your help I plan on getting this project completed by  June 2018

Risks & Challenges

There won't be any time wasted in the studio like in the old days when with big budgets people felt like they could afford spending days writing parts in the studio, all the material will be ready to be recorded from day one.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Even if you wish you could contribute financially but you can't at the moment, please, feel free to spread the word around on social media, friends, fellow musicians etc I will deeply appreciate any help you guys out there can direct my way!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • And, please, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is 'BRIGHT'?

A brand new musical with a Book, Music, and Lyrics by Zack Aretakis. It had its world premier staging this past October 2018 as part of the NYCFringe Festival.

BRIGHT IS THE RING OF WORDS is a new musical for anyone who has ever felt lost and alone, but felt destined for great light. We will delve into the mind and life of Jack Austin, a young composer who is striving to be the best. His music is contemporary and reverent; a release of deep sorrow that ignites a passion for life, however, he seems to be losing himself and those he loves along the way. Jack finds himself sacrificing family, friends and more importantly, love, for an isolated life that is dedicated to his craft. Will Jack find the light within him in the darkness? Or will he lose everything?

Where is 'BRIGHT' Going?

The ultimate goal, as with any show, is to be able to get it picked up and produced ON or OFF Broadway. We've got the score, the script, the cast, the orchestra, the team...now all we need is your help to get us through the final push of presenting it at the WORLD FAMOUS CARNEGIE HALL in New York City.

Is Theatre expensive to produce?

Many Broadway shows cost easily over 10 million + dollars just to get their show up and running. We are asking for a finite amount of that ($2,000+) to help off-set the cost of presenting this show in the best way we possibly can. It will be represented to over 200 NYC Producers and Agents during the concert. Carnegie Hall comes with a lot of cost; Microphones, Sound Design, Orchestra, Cast, Rental fees, and the list goes on and on. Your donation will help wildly in securing that this show has a future.

Jack finds himself sacrificing family, friends and more importantly, love, for an isolated life that is dedicated to his craft. Will Jack find the light within him in the darkness? Or will he lose everything?Where is 'BRIGHT' Going?The ultimate goal, as with any show, is to be able to get it picked up and produced ON or OFF Broadway. We've got the score, the script, the cast, the orchestra, the team...now all we need is your help to get us through the final push of presenting it at the WORLD FAMOUS CARNEGIE HALL in New York City.Is Theatre expensive to produce?Many Broadway shows cost easily over 10 million + dollars just to get their show up and running. We are asking for a finite amount of that ($2,000+) to help off-set the cost of presenting this show in the best way we possibly can. It will be represented to over 200 NYC Producers and Agents during the concert. Carnegie Hall comes with a lot of cost; Microphones, Sound Design, Orchestra, Cast, Rental fees, and the list goes on and on. Your donation will help wildly in securing that this show has a future.

story:
Hey, we're LOYALS, and we need your help.

On the way home from our tour with Mae a few months ago, a deer sprinted and crashed into the front of our van while we were on the interstate, leaving our touring vehicle completely totaled. We loved that van, and have made so many incredible memories with it over the past decade, and we are sad to see it go.

This unfortunate situation left us in a financial obstacle, and though we have since then secured a new van, we lack the funds to pay for it. This is where YOU come in...

...and we also have a little surprise.

We have a handful of songs that were initially projected to be on our 2018 Self-Titled, debut album, but inevitably didn't make it to the final tracklisting due to the record already being 12 tracks deep. These songs are so special to us, and we have been trying to find the right way to release them. Given what has just happened with our van, and us needing to pay for the new one, this seems like a perfect way to release these songs: You help us fund our new van, and we'll give you the rest of the songs that, in our minds, complete our debut record.

As of the launch of this campaign there will be two songs available, ready to download/stream, and every week we'll release more until the campaign is finished in May. There are other incentives as well, besides the new music, including exclusive merch, Skype calls, and even a private acoustic show! There is something for every LOYALS fan.

We have so many plans in store for the rest of this year, and a new album in the works, but until we get this van funded, we will not be able to fully execute those plans. It takes a lot for us to reach out for help, because we take pride in how hard we work and what we can accomplish on our own, but this situation has left us dry with options. We are so thankful for the fanbase and community that has surrounded LOYALS over the past couple of years, and we hope that you believe in us enough to give and support this campaign.

Love, 

Dane & Andrew from LOYALS

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Jason West. I am a movie cinematographer/ director/ producer. I am a graduate of the George A. Romero film making program at Douglas Education Center in Monessen, Pennsylvania. I graduated top of my class and received every award possible while I was in college. I have worked with movie legends such as Tom Savini, Doug Bradley, Josh Stewart, Dean Cain, Kevin Sorbo and much more. My goal is to bring to life a "Creepshow" like anthology of music videos from the world renowned horror punk band, Grave Robber. I have known this band since 2008, and I have been a huge fan since then. However, my passion alone will not get this project made, and that's why we need your help.

Grave Robber needs your help raising funds for their first ever anthology for their "Escaping the Grave" album. You will be treated with visuals from an amazing team of Tom Savini and George Romero's graduates along with new and fresh talent. You can expect to have the Hell scared out of you with these music videos.

What you can do to help

So basically, we need help from you (the fans). Our goal is $7000 and anything after that will go toward making this project even better. As you scroll down the right side of the screen you will notice the perk packages. The more you donate, the better the perk! All the items on the list have limits, so act fast so you can guarantee your merchandise. You will also notice a featured perk; a "free" concert within a 4 hour drive of the Fort Wayne, Indiana area. That's right, you could have Grave Robber playing a concert in your living room, or you could convince a local venue to have them play for just a $500 donation!!! So please share this with everyone you know!
 

Risks & Challenges

Look, we know how hard it is to open your wallet and take chances on a campaign like this. Just be assured that this anthology is for you, the fans. Not only are we doing this for the fans, but we are doing this in memory of George Romero. He is not only my mentor, but he is my hero and my inspiration to be the best film maker I can be.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you still can't help. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign link to as many friends as possible.
  • Share it as often as you can and on as many social media platforms as you can.

story:
On March 1, Blixa Sounds will release a career spanning retrospective of legendary Boston band Robin Lane & The Chartbusters, aptly titled MANY YEARS AGO.

This 3CD set will include the band’s complete recorded output for Warner Brothers Records in the early 80s, Robin Lane & The Chartbusters (1980), which features Robin’s MTV hit “When Things Go Wrong,” Imitation Life (1981) and the live EP, 5 Live (1980).

The collection will also include their 1984 EP, Heart Connection, as well as all of the previously unreleased recordings from the Heart Connection sessions. It also includes all three songs from their independently released first single as well as pre-Chartbusters demo recordings and live recordings.

To say that “MANY YEARS AGO” is a must for all Robin Lane and The Chartbusters fans is an understatement, it contains everything that they’ve ever recorded and also will have beautiful packaging that includes a 20 page booklet with comprehensive liner notes and classic historical photos, posters, flyers and other classic memorabilia.

Robin Lane is a true survivor whose music career started in Los Angeles, where she was part of the legendary Laurel Canyon music scene where she recorded “Round And Round” with Neil Young on his 1969 classic album Everybody Knows This Is Nowhere.

In 2014, a documentary about Robin Lane, When Things Go Wrong: Robin Lane’s Story was released by original Robin Lane & The Chartbusters drummer Tim Jackson. The film got huge critical acclaim and won Best Documentary at the 2015 New Jersey International Film Festival. Robin Lane’s story is colorful and complicated, but the classic music that she made with Robin Lane & The Chartbusters is timeless and will now get its proper due.

 

THE PERKS

  • CD: $30
  • Signed CD: $40
  • Signed CD with Pin: $50
  • Handwritten Lyric Sheet with Signed CD and Pin: $100
  • Pair of Tickets + Meet & Greet with 2 signed CDs & 2 Buttons: $200

Saturday 3/2 @ 7:00pm - The Burren (Somerville, MA)

Sunday 3/3 @ 4:00pm - The Burren (Somerville, MA)

  • Private House Concert by Robin Lane: $1,000 + Airfare (if necessary) and accommodations.
  • Dinner with Robin Lane at Robin’s house (+3 additional guests): $500
